analyzed: sgyid skyur ba dang / gnad rnams su mtshan mo lhag par na ba dang / snyom pa dang / mig 'bur skrang ba dang / rna ba g-ya' ba dang / skyur ba rnams yin no //
translated: The patient feels lazy, has pain in the vital organs, especially at night, is drowsy, has bulging eyes, itchy ears, and vomits.

original: khrag las gyur pa'i mgo nad kyi mtshan ma ni mkhris pa bas shas cher na ba yin no //
analyzed: khrag las gyur pa'i mgo nad kyi mtshan ma ni mkhris pa bas shas cher na ba yin no //
translated: The signs of a disorder of the head due to blood are similar to those of a tripa disorder, but the pain is more severe.

original: lhag ma ni mkhris pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni mkhris pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: The remaining symptoms should be understood as similar to those of a hot disorder.

original: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i mgo nad kyi rtags ni /
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i mgo nad kyi rtags ni /
translated: The signs and symptoms of a disorder of the head caused by a combination of the three humors are as follows:

original: thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: All the signs and symptoms of the three individual humors are present.

original: kha zas zhag lon pa dang / rnying pa dang / rul pa zos pas mgo'i khrag dang / sha rul bar byas te /
analyzed: kha zas zhag lon pa dang / rnying pa dang / rul pa zos pas mgo'i khrag dang / sha rul bar byas te /
translated: The disorder is caused by consuming stale, old, and rotten food, which causes the blood and flesh of the head to rot.

original: des 'dus pa'i nad skyes shing 'khrugs te /
analyzed: des 'dus pa'i nad skyes shing 'khrugs te /
translated: This gives rise to a combined disorder, which causes the head to swell.

original: mgo bor srin bu skyes te /
analyzed: mgo bor srin bu skyes te /
translated: Worms are produced in the head,

original: khrag 'thung bar byed do //
analyzed: khrag 'thung bar byed do //
translated: which feed on the blood.

original: de'i rgyus mi bzod par na ba dang / sems nyams par byed pa dang / lud pa lu ba dang / nyams stobs zad pa dang / mgo rtsub pa dang / skrangs pa dang / mgo bcad pa snyam byed pa dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: de'i rgyus mi bzod par na ba dang / sems nyams par byed pa dang / lud pa lu ba dang / nyams stobs zad pa dang / mgo rtsub pa dang / skrangs pa dang / mgo bcad pa snyam byed pa dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang /
translated: This causes unbearable pain, mental disturbance, coughing, loss of strength, a rough scalp, swelling, a feeling as if the head is being cut off, and a burning sensation.

original: mgo 'dam pa dang / rnags pa dang / mgo'i thod pa dang / rkan rnams su g-ya' ba dang / skem pa dang / srin bu rgyu ba snyam sems pa dang / snabs zangs mdog bzhin du dmar zhing dangs pa 'byung ba dang / rna ba sgra 'ur 'ur zer ba yin te /
analyzed: mgo 'dam pa dang / rnags pa dang / mgo'i thod pa dang / rkan rnams su g-ya' ba dang / skem pa dang / srin bu rgyu ba snyam sems pa dang / snabs zangs mdog bzhin du dmar zhing dangs pa 'byung ba dang / rna ba sgra 'ur 'ur zer ba yin te /
translated: The head is itchy, putrid, and feels as if it has a skull cap. The palate feels as if it is covered with worms, and the nose runs with a clear, copper-colored mucus. The ears ring.

original: de ni klad pa'i nad srin bu las gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni klad pa'i nad srin bu las gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “brain disease arising from worms.”

original: de la rlung shas che ba mgo'i nad ni mgo bo 'gul zhing 'dam pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rlung shas che ba mgo'i nad ni mgo bo 'gul zhing 'dam pa yin te /
translated: “Head disease due to an excess of wind” causes the head to shake and feel heavy.

original: de'i ming ni mgo 'dam pa'i nad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ming ni mgo 'dam pa'i nad ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “head heaviness.”

original: khrag mkhris shas che ba'i mgo nad ni /
analyzed: khrag mkhris shas che ba'i mgo nad ni /
translated: “Head disease due to an excess of blood and bile”

original: mur 'gram gnyis skrangs pa dang / drag tu na zhing tsha ba dang nub mo gnyid mi 'ong ba dang / glal ba dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / kha bro ba dang / gdong ser ba dang / de rnams dang ldan pa ni mur 'gram gyi nad ces bya ste /
analyzed: mur 'gram gnyis skrangs pa dang / drag tu na zhing tsha ba dang nub mo gnyid mi 'ong ba dang / glal ba dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / kha bro ba dang / gdong ser ba dang / de rnams dang ldan pa ni mur 'gram gyi nad ces bya ste /
translated: causes swelling of the temples, severe pain, and heat. The patient cannot sleep at night, yawns, has a fever, loses his memory, has a bad taste in his mouth, and his face becomes yellow. These are the symptoms of “temple disease.”

original: gso ba ma byas te yal bar bor na ni /
analyzed: gso ba ma byas te yal bar bor na ni /
translated: If it is not treated and is neglected,

original: zhag bdun nas ni srog 'phrog pa yin te /
analyzed: zhag bdun nas ni srog 'phrog pa yin te /
translated: it will take away life after seven days.

original: gso ba myur du byas na ni 'tsho ba yin no //
analyzed: gso ba myur du byas na ni 'tsho ba yin no //
translated: If it is treated quickly, it will be cured.🔽The signs of a head disease associated with bile and wind are pain,

original: mkhris pa dang rlung dang ldan pa'i mgo nad kyi rtags ni mur 'gram dang / mig dang / smin ma dang / 'phral ba rnams su na zhing zug la 'bar @361a * //🔽ba yin te /
analyzed: mkhris pa dang rlung dang ldan pa'i mgo nad kyi rtags ni mur 'gram dang / mig dang / smin ma dang / 'phral ba rnams su na zhing zug la 'bar @361a * // ba yin te /
translated: throbbing, and burning in the temples, eyes, eyebrows, and forehead.

original: de yang nyi ma shar nas phyed kyi bar du cher na ba dang / lhag par nyi ma phyed la tshabs cher na zhing 'phar ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang nyi ma shar nas phyed kyi bar du cher na ba dang / lhag par nyi ma phyed la tshabs cher na zhing 'phar ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, it hurts a lot from sunrise until noon, and it is especially severe at noon, throbbing.

original: de la ni dong gra la sogs pas gso bar byas kyang mi phan te /
analyzed: de la ni dong gra la sogs pas gso bar byas kyang mi phan te /
translated: Even if it is treated with dong-gra and so on, it will not help.

original: nyi ma phyed phan chad nas rang nyid rim gyis zhi ba de ni /
analyzed: nyi ma phyed phan chad nas rang nyid rim gyis zhi ba de ni /
translated: After noon, it gradually subsides by itself.

original: mgo'i nad nyi ma ltar 'khor ba yin zhes bya ba ste /🔽de ltar mgo nad rnam pa bcur bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mgo'i nad nyi ma ltar 'khor ba yin zhes bya ba ste / de ltar mgo nad rnam pa bcur bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is called “head disease that circles like the sun.”🔽Thus, head diseases are explained as being of ten types.

original: mgo nad de nyid kyi bye brag las thod pa'i nad rnam pa dgu bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: mgo nad de nyid kyi bye brag las thod pa'i nad rnam pa dgu bshad pa yin te /
translated: From the specific types of head diseases, nine types of skull diseases are explained.

original: yang rlung las gyur pa'i klad pa'i nad mngal gyi nang na yod pa'i dus su yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang rlung las gyur pa'i klad pa'i nad mngal gyi nang na yod pa'i dus su yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Also, a brain disease caused by wind may occur while the fetus is still in the womb.

original: de yang mdog gnag ba dang / nad med pa dang / skrang ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang mdog gnag ba dang / nad med pa dang / skrang ba yin te /
translated: It is characterized by a dark complexion, health, and swelling.

original: de ni nye ba'i mgo zhes bya ba'i klad pa'i nad yin no //
analyzed: de ni nye ba'i mgo zhes bya ba'i klad pa'i nad yin no //
translated: This is called “the brain disease of the proximate head.”

original: mgo nad thor bu can 'brum bu can zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: mgo nad thor bu can 'brum bu can zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: There is a scattered brain disease called “the one with pustules.”

original: de yang nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood according to the nature of the disease.

original: mkhris pa dang khrag dang / bad kan las gyur ba'i klad pa'i nad yod de /
analyzed: mkhris pa dang khrag dang / bad kan las gyur ba'i klad pa'i nad yod de /
translated: There are brain diseases caused by bile, blood, and phlegm.

original: nad des mgo'i nang rul bar byas te /🔽srin bu skyes nas zos pa las 'brum bu khre 'am /
analyzed: nad des mgo'i nang rul bar byas te / srin bu skyes nas zos pa las 'brum bu khre 'am /
translated: That disease causes the head to rot from within.

original: 'bras dkar po tsam 'byung ba ni ba la ta ka lta bu'i mgo nad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras dkar po tsam 'byung ba ni ba la ta ka lta bu'i mgo nad ces bya'o //
translated: Worms are born and eat it, causing pustules the size of sesame seeds or white rice to appear. This is called “the head disease like a betal nut.”

original: bad kan dang / rlung las gyur pa'i klad pa'i nad mgo g-ya' ba dang / skra 'byi ba dang / tshor ba med pa dang / rtsub pa la pags pa'i phyi shun gog pa de ni klad pa'i nad ru na ka zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bad kan dang / rlung las gyur pa'i klad pa'i nad mgo g-ya' ba dang / skra 'byi ba dang / tshor ba med pa dang / rtsub pa la pags pa'i phyi shun gog pa de ni klad pa'i nad ru na ka zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The disease of the brain called rurura is a disease of the brain caused by phlegm and wind, which causes itching of the head, loss of hair, numbness, roughness, and flaking of the outer skin.

original: mkhris pa dang rlung 'dres pa ba spu'i khung bu nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: mkhris pa dang rlung 'dres pa ba spu'i khung bu nang du zhugs te /
translated: A mixture of bile and wind enters the pores of the skin,

original: skra rtsa 'byi bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skra rtsa 'byi bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: causing the roots of the hair to fall out.

original: de'i shas kyis nang du bad kan dang khrag zhugs te /
analyzed: de'i shas kyis nang du bad kan dang khrag zhugs te /
translated: Due to its influence, phlegm and blood enter inside,

original: sbubs rnams skyer mi ster de 'gog par byed pa de ni klad pa'i nad aindra lupa ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbubs rnams skyer mi ster de 'gog par byed pa de ni klad pa'i nad aindra lupa ta zhes bya'o //
translated: preventing the growth of follicles and obstructing them. This is the disease of the brain called indralupta.

original: gzhan dag ni re ru dza zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni re ru dza zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that it is called reurja.

original: kha cig ni spu 'byi zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni spu 'byi zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that it is hair loss.

original: mi rnams kyi na tshod 'gyur ba bzhin du rim gyis skra 'byi zhing sbyi cer du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi na tshod 'gyur ba bzhin du rim gyis skra 'byi zhing sbyi cer du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: As people age, their hair gradually falls out and they become bald.

original: de yang rlung las spyi cer du gyur pa'i rtags ni tshig pa bzhin du mdog gnag pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rlung las spyi cer du gyur pa'i rtags ni tshig pa bzhin du mdog gnag pa yin no //
translated: The sign of a general swelling due to wind is a dark complexion, like a burn.

original: mkhris pa'i spyi cer ni rtsva tshos pa lta bus khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i spyi cer ni rtsva tshos pa lta bus khyab pa yin no //
translated: A general swelling due to bile is a spreading redness, like burnt grass.

original: bad kan gyi spyi cer ni pags pa mthug cing mdog gnag pa dkar ba yin te /
analyzed: bad kan gyi spyi cer ni pags pa mthug cing mdog gnag pa dkar ba yin te /
translated: A general swelling due to phlegm is a thick, dark, white skin.

original: de ltar nad gzhi rang rang gi mdog bzhin du pags pa'i mdog kyang de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nad gzhi rang rang gi mdog bzhin du pags pa'i mdog kyang de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the complexion of the skin should be understood to be like the complexion of the individual humors.

original: nad gzhi thams cad kyi mtshan @361b ma dang ldan te /
analyzed: nad gzhi thams cad kyi mtshan @361b ma dang ldan te /
translated: The signs of all illnesses are as follows:

original: sen mo'i mdog ltar snang ba dang / yang na mes bsregs pa bzhin du spu med cing tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa de ni gsor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sen mo'i mdog ltar snang ba dang / yang na mes bsregs pa bzhin du spu med cing tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa de ni gsor mi rung ngo //
translated: If the skin appears like a fingernail, or is hairless and hot to the touch, like a burn, then the illness is incurable.

original: mya ngan dang chad pa dang khros pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi drod gang yin pa de spyi bor zhugs nas des skra'i rtsa bar tshos shing smin par byas nas skra dkar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan dang chad pa dang khros pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi drod gang yin pa de spyi bor zhugs nas des skra'i rtsa bar tshos shing smin par byas nas skra dkar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The heat of the body that arises from grief, despair, or anger enters the crown of the head, and from there it cooks and ripens the roots of the hair, causing gray hair to grow.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i skra dkar gyi mtshan ma ni spu grugs pa can dang / cung zad sngo bsangs su 'dug pa dang / sra zhing rtsub la chu'i nad mdog ltar 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i skra dkar gyi mtshan ma ni spu grugs pa can dang / cung zad sngo bsangs su 'dug pa dang / sra zhing rtsub la chu'i nad mdog ltar 'dug pa yin no //
translated: The signs of gray hair due to wind are: the hair is rough, slightly bluish, hard, rough, and has the color of water-drops.

original: mkhris pa'i skra dkar gyi mtshan ma ni tsha ba dang / mdog cung zad sngo bsangs su 'dug pa dang / bad kan gyi skra dkar gyi mtshan ma ni snum pa dang / 'phel ba dang / sbom pa dang / mdog dkar ba yin no //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i skra dkar gyi mtshan ma ni tsha ba dang / mdog cung zad sngo bsangs su 'dug pa dang / bad kan gyi skra dkar gyi mtshan ma ni snum pa dang / 'phel ba dang / sbom pa dang / mdog dkar ba yin no //
translated: The signs of gray hair due to bile are: it is hot, slightly bluish, and has the color of a flower. The signs of gray hair due to phlegm are: it is oily, increases, is thick, and is white.

original: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i skra dkar gyi mtshan ma ni 'dres pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i skra dkar gyi mtshan ma ni 'dres pa yin no //
translated: The signs of gray hair due to a combination of humors are a mixture of the above.

original: 'dus pa'i mgo nad las gyur pa'i spyi cer dang / skra dkar la sogs pa gzhan dag ni gsor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i mgo nad las gyur pa'i spyi cer dang / skra dkar la sogs pa gzhan dag ni gsor mi rung ngo //
translated: The other types of gray hair, such as those that occur due to a head disease caused by a combination of humors, cannot be cured.

original: lus gyur pa las byung ba'i spyi cer dang / skra dkar ni bcud kyis len gyi cho gas gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus gyur pa las byung ba'i spyi cer dang / skra dkar ni bcud kyis len gyi cho gas gso bar bya'o //
translated: Gray hair that occurs due to a change in the body can be cured by the methods of rasāyana.

original: mgo nad kyi dmigs shes par bya ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mgo nad kyi dmigs shes par bya ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: This is the twenty-third chapter, on the diagnosis of head diseases, from the Secret Quintessential Instructions on the Eight Branches of the Ambrosia Essence Tantra.

original: // / de nas mgo nad gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas mgo nad gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then, the chapter on the treatment of head diseases will be explained.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i mgo nad la ni rlung gi cho ga rnams spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i mgo nad la ni rlung gi cho ga rnams spyad par bya ste /
translated: For head diseases arising from wind, one should practice the wind rituals.

original: de yang thog ma dang nyal khar mgo bo mar gyis bskus te /
analyzed: de yang thog ma dang nyal khar mgo bo mar gyis bskus te /
translated: At the beginning and at bedtime, the head should be anointed with ghee.

original: mar khu dro 'jam dang / 'o ma btung bar blud do //
analyzed: mar khu dro 'jam dang / 'o ma btung bar blud do //
translated: Warm, soft ghee and milk should be given to drink.

original: sran ma sha dang rgya sran dang / sran mungga ste /
analyzed: sran ma sha dang rgya sran dang / sran mungga ste /
translated: Beans, lentils, and mung beans.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i mgo nad la /
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i mgo nad la /
translated: For head diseases arising from wind,

original: de rnams gang yang rung ba mar dang ldan par sbyar bar bza'o //🔽til mar dang 'o ma bsres pa'i btung bar blud pa'am /
analyzed: de rnams gang yang rung ba mar dang ldan par sbyar bar bza'o // til mar dang 'o ma bsres pa'i btung bar blud pa'am /
translated: any of these should be eaten together with ghee.🔽A drink mixed with sesame oil and milk should be given,

original: til mar ma rnyed pa na til btags pa'i 'o ma dang lhan cig sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: til mar ma rnyed pa na til btags pa'i 'o ma dang lhan cig sbyar ba blud do //
translated: or if sesame oil is not available, milk mixed with ground sesame should be given.

original: de'i 'og tu glan pa'i dugs sam /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu glan pa'i dugs sam /
translated: After that, a moistening fomentation or

original: yang na sha brdungs pa 'u su dang sbyar bas mgo la dugs byas na phan no //
analyzed: yang na sha brdungs pa 'u su dang sbyar bas mgo la dugs byas na phan no //
translated: Alternatively, it is beneficial to apply a compress to the head with a paste of meat and ushira.

original: rlung 'joms pa'i sman rtsa ba bcu pa la sogs pa 'o ma dang sbyar bas mgo la blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung 'joms pa'i sman rtsa ba bcu pa la sogs pa 'o ma dang sbyar bas mgo la blugs par bya'o //
translated: Medicinal roots that conquer wind disorders should be mixed with milk and applied to the head.

original: snum dang ldan pa'i sna sman gtang ba dang / du ba rngub pa dang / de bzhin du mgo bo dang / rna ba rnams nyams brta bar bya'o //
analyzed: snum dang ldan pa'i sna sman gtang ba dang / du ba rngub pa dang / de bzhin du mgo bo dang / rna ba rnams nyams brta bar bya'o //
translated: Apply medicated nasal drops that contain oil, inhale smoke, and likewise massage the head and ears.

original: sman ba ra na'i @362a * //
analyzed: sman ba ra na'i @362a * //
translated: The medicinal compound of the varaṇa group

original: sde tshan 'o ma dang chu dang bskol la /
analyzed: sde tshan 'o ma dang chu dang bskol la /
translated: should be boiled in milk and water.

original: 'o ma lus pa dang / de bsrubs la mar sar phyung ba dang / mngar ba'i sde tshan gyi sman dang / yang bskol ba'i khu ba mar des snar blugs pa byas na rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: 'o ma lus pa dang / de bsrubs la mar sar phyung ba dang / mngar ba'i sde tshan gyi sman dang / yang bskol ba'i khu ba mar des snar blugs pa byas na rab tu bsngags so //
translated: The remaining milk should be churned to extract the butter, and the sweet group of medicines should be boiled in the milk. It is highly recommended to administer this as a nasal medication.

original: yang na mngar ba'i sde tshan de nyid dang / 'o ma yang bskol ba mar dang kha ra dang ldan pa sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na mngar ba'i sde tshan de nyid dang / 'o ma yang bskol ba mar dang kha ra dang ldan pa sbyin no //
translated: Alternatively, the same sweet group of medicines should be boiled in milk, and this should be given with butter and sugar.

original: ras bal gyi sa bon dang / shing tsha dang / gla sgang dang / sna ma'i me tog kham bye ba rnams kyi phye ma chu dron dang sbyar te sna sman du btang na /
analyzed: ras bal gyi sa bon dang / shing tsha dang / gla sgang dang / sna ma'i me tog kham bye ba rnams kyi phye ma chu dron dang sbyar te sna sman du btang na /
translated: Cotton seed, asafoetida, ginger, and jasmine flowers should be ground, mixed with warm water, and used as a nasal medication.

original: mgo nad zug gzer dang bcas pa 'joms so //
analyzed: mgo nad zug gzer dang bcas pa 'joms so //
translated: This will cure headaches and migraines.

original: li kha ra dang / gur gum dang / mar lhan cig bskol te snar blugs na /
analyzed: li kha ra dang / gur gum dang / mar lhan cig bskol te snar blugs na /
translated: Alternatively, one should prepare a nasal medication by boiling together red arsenic, saffron, and ghee.

original: khrag dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i klad nad sel to //
analyzed: khrag dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i klad nad sel to //
translated: This will cure brain disorders caused by blood and bile.

original: yang na ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / autpa la dang / tsandan dang / de rnams mar dang sbyar ba'i 'dag gus mgo la byugs na phan no //
analyzed: yang na ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / autpa la dang / tsandan dang / de rnams mar dang sbyar ba'i 'dag gus mgo la byugs na phan no //
translated: Alternatively, one should prepare a nasal medication by boiling together Indian valerian, eaglewood, blue lotus, and sandalwood, and mix it with ghee.🔽This will cure brain disorders caused by wind.

original: rlung gi nad la gnod pas 'dir gtar ga ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: rlung gi nad la gnod pas 'dir gtar ga ni mi bya'o //
translated: However, bloodletting should not be performed here because it would harm the wind.

original: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du gso ba de dag gis ma zhi na ni me'i las bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du gso ba de dag gis ma zhi na ni me'i las bya ste /
translated: If the disorders are not cured by the treatments described above, one should perform moxibustion.

original: bad kan la yang de ltar me btsa' bya'o //
analyzed: bad kan la yang de ltar me btsa' bya'o //
translated: Moxibustion should also be performed in the same way for phlegm disorders.

original: klad pa phyed na ba'i rlung 'joms pa la yang cho ga de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: klad pa phyed na ba'i rlung 'joms pa la yang cho ga de ltar bya'o //
translated: The same procedure should be performed to cure wind disorders that affect the brain.

original: de bzhin du nad gzhi'i tshul dang sbyar te gso ba yang ci rigs par sbyar te /

analyzed: spang spos dang / ru rta dang / til nag po dang / thal tres dang / @364a * //
translated: Spikenard, costus root, black sesame, and taltris:

translated: Iron filings, briṃgārajā, the three fruits, and black clay: make a paste of these with molasses, and leave it in a bamboo tube for one month.

original: de nas mgo la bskus na skra rtsa ba dang bcas pa nag por byed de /
analyzed: de nas mgo la bskus na skra rtsa ba dang bcas pa nag por byed de /
