analyzed: 'o ma dang mar lus pa'i nang du 'tsho byed sde bcu'i sman gyi phye mas btab la yang bskol te ;
translated: Add the powder of the ten medicinal plants to the remaining milk and ghee, and boil again.

original: mar lus pa las snar blugs na /
analyzed: mar lus pa las snar blugs na /
translated: Pour it into the remaining ghee.

original: nam tshong yan chad kyi nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: nam tshong yan chad kyi nad sel bar byed do //
translated: This will cure diseases from the throat down to the intestines.

original: rma bya'i sgro dang / mkhris pa dang / rgyu ma dang / rkang pa dang / rtug pa dang / mchu dang / de dag bor ba'i sha nyi tshe dang / rtsa ba bcu pa dang / ba la dang / ra sna dang / shing mngar dang sman de rnams srang gsum gsum rnams chu dang bskol te /
analyzed: rma bya'i sgro dang / mkhris pa dang / rgyu ma dang / rkang pa dang / rtug pa dang / mchu dang / de dag bor ba'i sha nyi tshe dang / rtsa ba bcu pa dang / ba la dang / ra sna dang / shing mngar dang sman de rnams srang gsum gsum rnams chu dang bskol te /
translated: Take peacock feathers, bile, intestines, feet, feces, beak, the flesh of those discarded, the ten roots, bala, rhinoceros horn, sweet plant, and three sang each of those medicines, boil them with water,

original: bzhi cha lus pa'i nang du mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / de'i bzhi 'gyur gyi 'o ma dang / dz'i ban ti dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / me da dang / rgun 'brum dang / ba ru ra dang / pa ru sha ka rnam gnyis dang /
analyzed: bzhi cha lus pa'i nang du mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / de'i bzhi 'gyur gyi 'o ma dang / dz'i ban ti dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / me da dang / rgun 'brum dang / ba ru ra dang / pa ru sha ka rnam gnyis dang /
translated: and add thirty-two sang of ghee, four times that amount of milk, jivanti, the three fruits, medaka, grapes, bhurbuja, and the two types of parusha.

original: nu  gang dang / bu tshang rdo dang / byi tsher ba dang me tog ma tu ka dang / star ka dang / b'a t'a ma dang / munydza ka dang / shri shi da dang / de rnams zho gnyis gnyis btags pa'i phye ma btab la bskol te mar lus pa ni rma bya chen po'i sman mar zhes bya ste yon tan gong ma bas che ste /
analyzed: nu  gang dang / bu tshang rdo dang / byi tsher ba dang me tog ma tu ka dang / star ka dang / b'a t'a ma dang / munydza ka dang / shri shi da dang / de rnams zho gnyis gnyis btags pa'i phye ma btab la bskol te mar lus pa ni rma bya chen po'i sman mar zhes bya ste yon tan gong ma bas che ste /
translated: The medicinal butter prepared from the above ingredients is called the great peacock medicinal butter. It has greater qualities than the above.

original: lus zungs brtas shing dbang po gsal bar byed pa dang / skad 'gags pa dang / lud pa dang dbugs mi bde bas nyam thag pa 'joms te /
analyzed: lus zungs brtas shing dbang po gsal bar byed pa dang / skad 'gags pa dang / lud pa dang dbugs mi bde bas nyam thag pa 'joms te /
translated: It increases bodily constituents and sharpens the sense faculties. It cures hoarseness, and the distress of phlegm and dyspnea.

original: de bzhin du zla mtshan zag pa dang / khu chu'i skyon la rab tu bsngags te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zla mtshan zag pa dang / khu chu'i skyon la rab tu bsngags te /
translated: It is highly recommended for menstrual disorders and semen disorders.

original: nad med cing mo gsham la yang bu ster bar byed do //
analyzed: nad med cing mo gsham la yang bu ster bar byed do //
translated: It promotes health and even grants children to barren women.

original: de bzhin du byi ba dang / khyim bya dang / dad pa dang / ri bong dang / de rnams gang yang rung ba'i re re nas rma bya'i cho ga bzhin du ma lus par byas na yang phan yon de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byi ba dang / khyim bya dang / dad pa dang / ri bong dang / de rnams gang yang rung ba'i re re nas rma bya'i cho ga bzhin du ma lus par byas na yang phan yon de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Likewise, if one performs the entire procedure for a peacock, using any of these substances—rat, chicken, pigeon, rabbit—the benefits will be the same.

original: de ltar nam tshong yan chad kyi nad nyis brgya sum cu so gcig po phan tshun ma 'dres par rgya cher bza' ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nam tshong yan chad kyi nad nyis brgya sum cu so gcig po phan tshun ma 'dres par rgya cher bza' ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the two hundred and thirty-one diseases, beginning with those of the liver, are treated extensively, without being mixed up.

original: skyes bu rnams kyi lus kyi rtsa ba ni mgo bo yin la yan lag gzhan rnams ni yal ga lta bu yin no zhes drang srong rnams smra ste /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi lus kyi rtsa ba ni mgo bo yin la yan lag gzhan rnams ni yal ga lta bu yin no zhes drang srong rnams smra ste /
translated: The sages say that the head is the root of the body of human beings, and the other limbs are like branches.

original: de'i phyir mgo bo lus kyi rtsa ba lta bu la mtshon dang nad la sogs pas gnod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mgo bo lus kyi rtsa ba lta bu la mtshon dang nad la sogs pas gnod par 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if the head, which is like the root of the body, is harmed by weapons, illness, and so on,

original: myur du gso bar bya ba gces so //
analyzed: myur du gso bar bya ba gces so //
translated: it is important to treat it quickly.

original: dbang po rnams dang / srog kyang mgo la brten te gnas pas /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang / srog kyang mgo la brten te gnas pas /
translated: The sense faculties and life force also depend on the head.

original: des na yan lag gi dam pa mgo bo bsrung ba la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: des na yan lag gi dam pa mgo bo bsrung ba la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should strive to protect the head, the most important of the limbs.

original: mgo bo'i nad gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mgo bo'i nad gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the twenty-fourth chapter, on the treatment of head diseases, from The Quintessence Tantra, the Secret Oral Tradition of the Eight Branches of the Science of Healing.

original: // / nam tshong yan chad kyi nad gso ba'i rgyud bshad zin to /
analyzed: // / nam tshong yan chad kyi nad gso ba'i rgyud bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the Tantra of the Treatment of Diseases of the Upper Body is complete.

original: // / de nas rma gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas rma gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the chapter on the treatment of wounds will be explained.

original: de la rma la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rma la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of wounds:

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang / glo bur du byung ba gnyis so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang / glo bur du byung ba gnyis so //
translated: those that occur naturally and those that occur suddenly.

original: de yang rma red pa dang / rma ma red pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rma red pa dang / rma ma red pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, there are two types of wounds, depending on whether or not they are infected.

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i rma ni nad gzhi'i dbang gis lus las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i rma ni nad gzhi'i dbang gis lus las skyes pa'o //
translated: A natural wound is one that occurs in the body due to the condition of a disease.

original: glo bur du byung ba'i rma ni phyi rol gyi mtshon la sogs pa phog @365a * //🔽ba las byung ngo //
analyzed: glo bur du byung ba'i rma ni phyi rol gyi mtshon la sogs pa phog @365a * // ba las byung ngo //
translated: A sudden wound is one that occurs due to an external blow from a weapon and so forth.

original: de la rma red pa ni nad gzhi dang bcas pa ste ma rungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rma red pa ni nad gzhi dang bcas pa ste ma rungs pa'o //
translated: An infected wound is one that is accompanied by a disease and is therefore dangerous.

original: rma ma red pa ni dag pa ste /
analyzed: rma ma red pa ni dag pa ste /
translated: An uninfected wound is a clean one.

original: nad gzhi dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nad gzhi dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: It is not accompanied by a disease.

original: nad gzhi rnams dang khrag 'dres te /
analyzed: nad gzhi rnams dang khrag 'dres te /
translated: The blood is mixed with the disease.

original: rma red pa'i mtshan ma ni phag che la kha chung ba dang / yang na kha che la phag chung ba dang rma sra zhing rdo 'dra ba dang / yang na shin tu tsha ba dang / shin tu zab pa dang / yang na rma mtho ba dang /
analyzed: rma red pa'i mtshan ma ni phag che la kha chung ba dang / yang na kha che la phag chung ba dang rma sra zhing rdo 'dra ba dang / yang na shin tu tsha ba dang / shin tu zab pa dang / yang na rma mtho ba dang /
translated: The signs of a bad wound are a pig that is large but has a small mouth, or a pig that has a large mouth but is small, a wound that is hard like a rock, or very hot, or very deep, or a wound that is very high,

original: rma shin tu grang ba 'am /
analyzed: rma shin tu grang ba 'am /
translated: or very cold,

original: yang na shin tu dro ba dang / mdog dmar ba dbal skya ba dang / rnag dang chu ser 'dzag pa dang / lus zad pa dang / rnag dang / sha dang / rgyus pa dang / rmas rtsa g-yogs pa dang / rma mched cing rab tu na ba dang /
analyzed: yang na shin tu dro ba dang / mdog dmar ba dbal skya ba dang / rnag dang chu ser 'dzag pa dang / lus zad pa dang / rnag dang / sha dang / rgyus pa dang / rmas rtsa g-yogs pa dang / rma mched cing rab tu na ba dang /
translated: or very warm, or red in color with a pale edge, or oozing pus and lymph, or emaciated, or with pus, flesh, sinew, and veins covering the wound, or the wound is spreading and very painful,

original: tsha ba dang / skrangs pas rab tu na ba dang / g-ya' ba la sogs pa'i bla brnan de dag dang ldan pa yun ring por rma 'tsho dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: tsha ba dang / skrangs pas rab tu na ba dang / g-ya' ba la sogs pa'i bla brnan de dag dang ldan pa yun ring por rma 'tsho dka' ba yin te /
translated: or hot and painful with swelling, or with itching and so on. Those who have those are difficult to heal for a long time.

original: bcva lnga po de dag ni rma ma rungs pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: bcva lnga po de dag ni rma ma rungs pa'i rtags so //
translated: Those fifteen are the signs of a bad wound.

original: rlung las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni rma mdog rtsa gnag cing 'byar ba dang / thal ba dang / thi ba dang / rus pa'i mdog tu snang ba dang / rma'i nang nas zho ga chu dang / sha bkrus pa'i chu dang 'dra ba slan te nyung ngur 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: rlung las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni rma mdog rtsa gnag cing 'byar ba dang / thal ba dang / thi ba dang / rus pa'i mdog tu snang ba dang / rma'i nang nas zho ga chu dang / sha bkrus pa'i chu dang 'dra ba slan te nyung ngur 'byung ba dang /
translated: The signs of a wound caused by vata are a wound with a dark, rough color, appearing like ash, a dove, or the color of bone, and a wound that oozes little, like yogurt, water, or washed meat.

original: sha zad cing shin tu na zhing zug pa dang / rtsub cing 'gags pa yin no //
analyzed: sha zad cing shin tu na zhing zug pa dang / rtsub cing 'gags pa yin no //
translated: The flesh is exhausted, very painful, and rough and blocked.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni rma myur du smin pa dang / rma'i mdog ser ba dang / sngo ba dang / ser skya dang / kham par 'dug pa dang / gcin gyi mdog tu 'dug pa dang / rgya skyegs shing gi khu ba lta bu dang /
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni rma myur du smin pa dang / rma'i mdog ser ba dang / sngo ba dang / ser skya dang / kham par 'dug pa dang / gcin gyi mdog tu 'dug pa dang / rgya skyegs shing gi khu ba lta bu dang /
translated: The signs of a wound caused by bile are a wound that quickly ripens, a wound that is yellow, blue, pale yellow, and the color of urine, and a wound that oozes like the sap of a lac tree.

original: thal chu lta bu dang / til mar lta bu'i chu ser tsha ba mang du 'byung ba dang / rma kha thal sman gyis btab pa dang / khab kyis gtsags pa bzhin du na zhing dmar la tsha zhing smin pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽bad kan las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni mdog skya ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / chu ser dkar zhing bska ba mang du 'jag pa dang / rma'i thon 'khor mkhrang zhing mthon por 'dug pa dang / rgyus pa dang / rtsa'i dra ba snang zhing zug gzer chung ba yin no //
analyzed: thal chu lta bu dang / til mar lta bu'i chu ser tsha ba mang du 'byung ba dang / rma kha thal sman gyis btab pa dang / khab kyis gtsags pa bzhin du na zhing dmar la tsha zhing smin pa dang ldan pa'o // bad kan las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni mdog skya ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / chu ser dkar zhing bska ba mang du 'jag pa dang / rma'i thon 'khor mkhrang zhing mthon por 'dug pa dang / rgyus pa dang / rtsa'i dra ba snang zhing zug gzer chung ba yin no //
translated: It is like a hot spring, or like a hot oil bath, with a lot of hot pus coming out. It is like a wound anointed with alkaline medicine, or like a wound pricked with a needle, painful, red, hot, and ripe.🔽The signs of a wound caused by phlegm are a pale color, itching, a lot of white, astringent pus, the surrounding area of the wound is hard and raised, and there is a network of sinews and veins, with little pain.

original: khrag las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni byu ru'i mdog ltar shin tu dmar ba dang / chu ser khrag dang bcas @365b par 'dzag pa dang / rta'i gnas kyi dri ltar bro ba dang / gzhan yang mkhris pa'i rma'i mtshan ma yang 'dir sbyar ro //
analyzed: khrag las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni byu ru'i mdog ltar shin tu dmar ba dang / chu ser khrag dang bcas @365b par 'dzag pa dang / rta'i gnas kyi dri ltar bro ba dang / gzhan yang mkhris pa'i rma'i mtshan ma yang 'dir sbyar ro //
translated: The signs of a wound caused by blood are a color like coral, very red, with pus and blood flowing out, smelling like a horse's urine, and also the signs of a wound caused by bile are applied here.

original: nad gzhi gnyis 'dus pa las gyur pa'i rma dang / gsum 'dus pa las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma yang gang dang gang 'dus pa de dang de'i mtshan ma 'dres pa brtags te shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nad gzhi gnyis 'dus pa las gyur pa'i rma dang / gsum 'dus pa las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma yang gang dang gang 'dus pa de dang de'i mtshan ma 'dres pa brtags te shes par bya'o //
translated: The signs of a wound caused by the combination of two humors or the combination of three humors should be diagnosed by examining the combination of the signs of each of them.

original: rma dag cing ma red de gnod pa byed pa'i mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: rma dag cing ma red de gnod pa byed pa'i mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of a wound that is clean, not swollen, and not harmful are as follows:

original: lce'i mdog 'dra bas 'jam zhing mnyen pa dang / rma'i thon 'khor skya nar 'dug pa dang / 'brum phran snyam du 'byung ba dang / yang na rma'i dbus su chung zhing mtho ba 'byung ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: lce'i mdog 'dra bas 'jam zhing mnyen pa dang / rma'i thon 'khor skya nar 'dug pa dang / 'brum phran snyam du 'byung ba dang / yang na rma'i dbus su chung zhing mtho ba 'byung ba rnams yin no //
translated: The color of the tongue is similar, it is smooth and soft, the edge of the wound is pale and straight, and small blisters appear, or else in the middle of the wound a small elevation appears.

original: pags pa dang / sha dang / rtsa dang / rgyus pa dang / tshigs dang / rus pa dang / nang rol dang / gnad dang / brgyad po de rnams su kha 'byung ba ni gso dka' ba dang / de yang go rims bzhin du 'og ma 'og mas gso dka'o //
analyzed: pags pa dang / sha dang / rtsa dang / rgyus pa dang / tshigs dang / rus pa dang / nang rol dang / gnad dang / brgyad po de rnams su kha 'byung ba ni gso dka' ba dang / de yang go rims bzhin du 'og ma 'og mas gso dka'o //
translated: The eight types of wounds that are difficult to treat are those that occur in the skin, flesh, vessels, tendons, joints, bones, internal organs, and vital points. Among them, the latter are more difficult to treat than the former.

original: skyes bu'i snying stobs che zhing phog snya dang ldan pa dang / sha che zhing me'i drod dang ldan pa dang / lang tsho dang ldan zhing nyams stobs dang ldan pa dang / rma'i sgros zlum pa dang / dkyus ring ba dang / zur gsum dang /🔽zur bzhi po yod pa de ni gso sla ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i snying stobs che zhing phog snya dang ldan pa dang / sha che zhing me'i drod dang ldan pa dang / lang tsho dang ldan zhing nyams stobs dang ldan pa dang / rma'i sgros zlum pa dang / dkyus ring ba dang / zur gsum dang / zur bzhi po yod pa de ni gso sla ba yin no //
translated: A person who is courageous, who has a strong constitution, who has strong flesh and strong digestive heat, who is youthful and strong, and whose wounds are round, long, triangular, or square, is easy to heal.

original: de bzhin du dpyi dang / rkub dang / pho mtshan dang / mchu dang / rgyab kyi sgal tshigs dang / rgyab kyi gzhung dang / kha dang mkhur tshos su rma byung ba yang gso sla'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpyi dang / rkub dang / pho mtshan dang / mchu dang / rgyab kyi sgal tshigs dang / rgyab kyi gzhung dang / kha dang mkhur tshos su rma byung ba yang gso sla'o //
translated: Similarly, wounds to the hips, buttocks, penis, lips, spine, back, and mouth are easy to heal.

original: rma gso dka' ba ni mig dang / snying dang / sna dang / mig 'gram dang / lte ba dang / pho mtshan dang / rkub kyi bar bred bred po dang / lto ba dang / rna ba dang / rtsib logs dang / mchan khung dang /
analyzed: rma gso dka' ba ni mig dang / snying dang / sna dang / mig 'gram dang / lte ba dang / pho mtshan dang / rkub kyi bar bred bred po dang / lto ba dang / rna ba dang / rtsib logs dang / mchan khung dang /
translated: Wounds that are difficult to heal are those to the eyes, heart, nose, eyes, navel, penis, buttocks, abdomen, ears, ribs, armpits,

original: nu ma rnams su byung ba'i rma dang / rma'i nang nas lbu ba dang / chu ser dang / rnag dang / rlung 'byung zhing zug rdu dang bcas pa dang / stod du skyugs pa dang / mtshan bar rdol ba dang / gdong gi nang du byung ba dang /
analyzed: nu ma rnams su byung ba'i rma dang / rma'i nang nas lbu ba dang / chu ser dang / rnag dang / rlung 'byung zhing zug rdu dang bcas pa dang / stod du skyugs pa dang / mtshan bar rdol ba dang / gdong gi nang du byung ba dang /
translated: The wounds that occur in the breasts, the wounds that produce foam, pus, and wind, the wounds that are painful, the wounds that are vomited up, the wounds that occur in the vagina, and the wounds that occur in the face.

original: rked pa dang / rus pa la brten pa la /
analyzed: rked pa dang / rus pa la brten pa la /
translated: The wounds that occur in the waist and in the bones.

original: mdze nad can la rma byung ba dang / dug bsten pa dang / lus skem pa dang / gcin nad sbrang rtsi lta bus btab pa dang / de rnams la rma byung na gso dka' ba yin te 'tsho bar yang dka'o //🔽gang @366a * //
analyzed: mdze nad can la rma byung ba dang / dug bsten pa dang / lus skem pa dang / gcin nad sbrang rtsi lta bus btab pa dang / de rnams la rma byung na gso dka' ba yin te 'tsho bar yang dka'o // gang @366a * //
translated: The wounds that occur in lepers, the wounds that occur in those who have taken poison, the wounds that occur in those who are emaciated, the wounds that occur in those who have been stung by a honey bee, and the wounds that occur in those who have all of those diseases are difficult to cure and are hard to heal.

original: yang rma'i steng du rma byung ba dang / shu ba chen po'i nad dang / rims dang / tshad bar 'khru ba dang / lud pa lu ba dang / skom dad che ba dang / gnyid med pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / rma rnags mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: yang rma'i steng du rma byung ba dang / shu ba chen po'i nad dang / rims dang / tshad bar 'khru ba dang / lud pa lu ba dang / skom dad che ba dang / gnyid med pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / rma rnags mi shes pa dang /
translated: The wounds that occur on top of other wounds, the wounds that occur in those who have a severe skin disease, the wounds that occur in those who have a fever, the wounds that occur in those who have diarrhea, the wounds that occur in those who have a cough, the wounds that occur in those who are very thirsty, the wounds that occur in those who are sleepless, the wounds that occur in those who have difficulty breathing, and the wounds that occur in those who do not know how to heal wounds.

original: klad pa'i srubs bye zhing klad rgyas snang ba dang ; rgyus pa rul bar byas pa dang / rtsa chad pa dang / rma phug ring ba dang / srin bus zos pa dang / rus pa chad pa dang / zug rdu dang / dug dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: klad pa'i srubs bye zhing klad rgyas snang ba dang ; rgyus pa rul bar byas pa dang / rtsa chad pa dang / rma phug ring ba dang / srin bus zos pa dang / rus pa chad pa dang / zug rdu dang / dug dang bcas pa dang /
translated: The opening of the skull is exposed, the brain is visible, the tendons are rotten, the nerves are severed, the wound is deep, the worm is eaten, the bone is broken, the wound is infected, the wound is poisoned,

original: rma brtags pa dang / log par bcings pa dang / snum shas che ba dang / rtsub pa dang / rma'i nang du spu la sogs pa zhugs pa dang / 'gul bskyod mangs pa dang / khong pa ma dag pa dang / 'grangs ches pa dang /
analyzed: rma brtags pa dang / log par bcings pa dang / snum shas che ba dang / rtsub pa dang / rma'i nang du spu la sogs pa zhugs pa dang / 'gul bskyod mangs pa dang / khong pa ma dag pa dang / 'grangs ches pa dang /
translated: the wound is examined, the wound is improperly bandaged, the wound is too oily, the wound is rough, the wound is penetrated by hair and so on, the wound is moved too much, the stomach is impure, the stomach is too full,

original: lus rab tu rjud pa dang / chang mang du 'thung ba dang / nyin par gnyid log pa dang / nyal po bsten pa dang / mtshan mo gnyid ma log pa dang / rma'i cho ga log par byas pa dang / 'di rnams spyad na ni gso ba byas kyang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: lus rab tu rjud pa dang / chang mang du 'thung ba dang / nyin par gnyid log pa dang / nyal po bsten pa dang / mtshan mo gnyid ma log pa dang / rma'i cho ga log par byas pa dang / 'di rnams spyad na ni gso ba byas kyang mi 'grub po //
translated: the body is very weak, one drinks a lot of alcohol, one sleeps during the day, one has sex, one does not sleep at night, one improperly performs the wound ritual, if one engages in these, then even if treated, it will not be successful.

original: gang gi rma gso ba mdog bri  ba'i mdog tu 'dug pa dang / nang gi rnag zad pa dang / sha'u phra mo brtan par 'byung ba ni myur du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang gi rma gso ba mdog bri  ba'i mdog tu 'dug pa dang / nang gi rnag zad pa dang / sha'u phra mo brtan par 'byung ba ni myur du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: If the wound is pale, as if it were being cauterized, if the pus inside is exhausted, and if a thin, firm skin forms, then it will heal quickly.

original: gal te rma skrangs pa lta na ni nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du slon khrus kyis sbyang bar byas te /
analyzed: gal te rma skrangs pa lta na ni nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du slon khrus kyis sbyang bar byas te /
translated: If the wound is swollen, it should be treated according to the illness and cleansed with a medicinal bath.

original: lus dag nas de'i 'og tu sman gyi sbyor ba byas na myur du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dag nas de'i 'og tu sman gyi sbyor ba byas na myur du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the body is purified, then the application of medicine should be done afterwards, and it will heal quickly.

original: ci ste rma skrangs par gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste rma skrangs par gyur na ni /
translated: If the wound becomes swollen,

original: rgyun du bsil ba'i cho ga bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun du bsil ba'i cho ga bya ste /
translated: then a cooling procedure should be done continuously.

original: ji ltar skyes bu mes tshig pa la yang me de nyid la bdugs pas phan pa bzhin du gang gi rma skrangs shing mkhrang la mdog nag par 'gyur zhing na ba dang bcas la /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu mes tshig pa la yang me de nyid la bdugs pas phan pa bzhin du gang gi rma skrangs shing mkhrang la mdog nag par 'gyur zhing na ba dang bcas la /
translated: Just as a person who is burned by fire is benefited by being fanned with the same fire, if the wound becomes swollen, hard, dark-colored, painful,

original: dug dang ldan pa la ni khyad par du srin bu pad ba la sogs pas khrag dbyung ngo //
analyzed: dug dang ldan pa la ni khyad par du srin bu pad ba la sogs pas khrag dbyung ngo //
translated: and poisonous, then in particular leeches should be used to draw out the blood.

original: de ltar khrag ngan dang bral bar lta na de ma thag skrangs pa dang / mdog dmar ba dang ; zug gzer zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar khrag ngan dang bral bar lta na de ma thag skrangs pa dang / mdog dmar ba dang ; zug gzer zhi bar byed do //
translated: If the blood is seen to be bad, then the swelling, redness, and pain will be relieved immediately.

original: de ltar khrag phyung bzhin du sman bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dag ci tsam du btags pa 'o ma dang / bu ram shing gi khu ba'i nang du mar lan brgya sbrus pa'i mar dang ldan par byas nas bskus na /
analyzed: de ltar khrag phyung bzhin du sman bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dag ci tsam du btags pa 'o ma dang / bu ram shing gi khu ba'i nang du mar lan brgya sbrus pa'i mar dang ldan par byas nas bskus na /
translated: While the blood is being drawn, the wound should be anointed with a cooling medicine, as much as is needed, mixed with milk and sugarcane juice, and with ghee that has been churned a hundred times.

original: snga ma ma skams par phyis kyang @366b bskus la zhag rer de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma ma skams par phyis kyang @366b bskus la zhag rer de ltar bya'o //
translated: The previous application should be allowed to dry before applying the next one. This should be done every day.

original: de ltar bya ba yang bsku ba'i zhag la sbyar gyi /🔽sbyar nas zhag lon pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bya ba yang bsku ba'i zhag la sbyar gyi / sbyar nas zhag lon pa mi rung ngo //
translated: This should be done on the day of application,🔽but it is not suitable to apply it after a day has passed.

original: byug pa dang / blugs pa dang / bskub la sogs pa yang 'phral la byas pa can gyi rnyings pa mi phan no //
analyzed: byug pa dang / blugs pa dang / bskub la sogs pa yang 'phral la byas pa can gyi rnyings pa mi phan no //
translated: Anointing, pouring, and bathing should be done immediately, and old [medicines] are not helpful.

original: n+ya gro dha dang / au dumb'a ra dang / aa shvadtha dang / plaksha dang / lcang ma dang / 'di rnams kyi shun lpags btags pa'i phye ma mar dang lde gur sbyar bas bskus na /
analyzed: n+ya gro dha dang / au dumb'a ra dang / aa shvadtha dang / plaksha dang / lcang ma dang / 'di rnams kyi shun lpags btags pa'i phye ma mar dang lde gur sbyar bas bskus na /
translated: The bark of nyagrodha, udumbara, ashvattha, plaksha, and bamboo, when applied as a paste mixed with ghee and honey,

original: skrangs pa sel ba'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: skrangs pa sel ba'i mchog yin no //
translated: is the best for relieving swelling.

original: rlung las gyur pa'i skrang pa mkhrang zhing sra ba zug gzer che zhing khrag 'dzag bzhin du rma skrangs shing na ba 'di lta bu la ni /
analyzed: rlung las gyur pa'i skrang pa mkhrang zhing sra ba zug gzer che zhing khrag 'dzag bzhin du rma skrangs shing na ba 'di lta bu la ni /
translated: For a swelling that has arisen from wind, which is hard and solid, with severe pain and bleeding, and a swollen wound that hurts like this,

original: dugs dang gsher sa'i sha las g-yos su byas pa'i zas dang / zar ma dang / til mar brngos te /
analyzed: dugs dang gsher sa'i sha las g-yos su byas pa'i zas dang / zar ma dang / til mar brngos te /
translated: one should eat food prepared with a decoction of meat from a hot spring or a marsh, and roasted sesame oil

original: 'o ma dang btags la bskus na /🔽rma na zhing na la skrangs pa tshabs che ba yang sel to //
analyzed: 'o ma dang btags la bskus na / rma na zhing na la skrangs pa tshabs che ba yang sel to //
translated: mixed with milk and applied as a paste.🔽Even if the wound is painful, swollen, and severely inflamed, it will be cured.

original: bad kan dang rlung gis rma skrangs pa la ni sra la brtan zhing zug gzer chung ba yin te ;
analyzed: bad kan dang rlung gis rma skrangs pa la ni sra la brtan zhing zug gzer chung ba yin te ;
translated: For a wound swollen with phlegm and wind, it is firm and stable with little pain.

original: de la ni bad kan dang rlung 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i nus pa snum gyis bsku byug bya ste /
analyzed: de la ni bad kan dang rlung 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i nus pa snum gyis bsku byug bya ste /
translated: For this, apply an ointment prepared with medicines that conquer phlegm and wind.

original: de'i 'og tu 'od ma'i sbu gu nas rim gyis dugs byas la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'od ma'i sbu gu nas rim gyis dugs byas la /
translated: After that, apply a compress through a bamboo tube.

original: de'i 'og tu skangs pa snyi bar bya ba'i phyir lag pa'i mthil lam mthe bos mnye bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu skangs pa snyi bar bya ba'i phyir lag pa'i mthil lam mthe bos mnye bar bya'o //
translated: After that, to soften the swelling, massage it with the palm of the hand or with the fingers.

original: de'i 'og tu na sa dang / gro dang / mon sran sde'u rnams bskol te btags pa'i phye ma lde gur bskus na yang skrangs pa snyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu na sa dang / gro dang / mon sran sde'u rnams bskol te btags pa'i phye ma lde gur bskus na yang skrangs pa snyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, if it is not softened, apply a poultice made from a paste of cooked and ground barley, wheat, and lentils.

original: des kyang zhi bar ma gyur na dugs bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang zhi bar ma gyur na dugs bya'o //
translated: If that does not pacify it, apply a compress.

original: de la yang rma smin na ni zhi bar 'gyur la ma smin na ni de lta ma yin no //🔽de la dugs ni /
analyzed: de la yang rma smin na ni zhi bar 'gyur la ma smin na ni de lta ma yin no // de la dugs ni /
translated: If the wound is ripe, it will be pacified, but if it is not ripe, it will not be.🔽For that, a compress is recommended.

original: rgya shug dang / til dang ; zar ma dang / rgyam tsha dang / phabs dang / ru rta'i phye ma dang / skyur po dang sbyar ba'i zan dron gyis glan pa'i dugs byas na rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: rgya shug dang / til dang ; zar ma dang / rgyam tsha dang / phabs dang / ru rta'i phye ma dang / skyur po dang sbyar ba'i zan dron gyis glan pa'i dugs byas na rab tu bsngags so //
translated: Mix jujube, sesame, mustard, rock salt, yeast, and ru rta powder with sour substances and apply a compress with a cake of that mixture.

original: legs par smin na ni skrang pa'i phyogs gcig tu mthon por 'dus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: legs par smin na ni skrang pa'i phyogs gcig tu mthon por 'dus par 'gyur te /
translated: If the swelling is well ripened, it will rise up in one place.

original: de la ni ci rigs par btsir ro //
analyzed: de la ni ci rigs par btsir ro //
translated: Squeeze it as appropriate.

original: shin tu gzhon pa 'am skyid de ba dag drag tu btsir ba la sogs pa'i las mi bzod pa la ni gu gul dang / zar ma dang / ba bla dang / gtsang sman khron bu dang / rta'i rtug pa dang / thal sman gyi sman rnams kyis skrang pa smin pa la rang rdol du gzhug go //
analyzed: shin tu gzhon pa 'am skyid de ba dag drag tu btsir ba la sogs pa'i las mi bzod pa la ni gu gul dang / zar ma dang / ba bla dang / gtsang sman khron bu dang / rta'i rtug pa dang / thal sman gyi sman rnams kyis skrang pa smin pa la rang rdol du gzhug go //
translated: For those who are very young or delicate and cannot tolerate strong squeezing and so forth, use gugul, sarpa, babula, tsangmen, khorbu, horse dung, and medicinal powders to ripen the swelling and let it burst on its own.

original: rma nang du 'khyims te @367a * //
analyzed: rma nang du 'khyims te @367a * //
translated: If the wound is twisted inside

original: phyir byung du ma 'dod na /
analyzed: phyir byung du ma 'dod na /
translated: and does not want to come out,

original: phan tshun mched par rgyu zhing gnas rnams su zhugs pa la ni snum med sman gyis rnags dbyung ba'i ched du rma nang du bskus la rnag 'jib tu gzhug go //
analyzed: phan tshun mched par rgyu zhing gnas rnams su zhugs pa la ni snum med sman gyis rnags dbyung ba'i ched du rma nang du bskus la rnag 'jib tu gzhug go //
translated: it will spread from one place to another. To cause the pus to come out, smear the wound with a medicinal ointment that does not contain oil.

original: rma skoms par gyur na ni 'jib sman dang / sman gyis bsku ba rnams spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rma skoms par gyur na ni 'jib sman dang / sman gyis bsku ba rnams spang bar bya'o //
translated: If the wound is dry, stop using the medicinal ointment and medicinal powders.

original: 'jib sman dang byug pa de dag kyang rma khar mi bsku ste /
analyzed: 'jib sman dang byug pa de dag kyang rma khar mi bsku ste /
translated: Do not apply ointments or unguents to the wound.

original: sbyor ba de dag byas na nyes pa rnams mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba de dag byas na nyes pa rnams mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If you do these things, the faults will not occur.

original: de la 'jib sman ni bod sran dang / nas dang / gro dang / mon sran sde'u dang / bra bo dang / gzhan yang sman spyi bag can rnams lhan cig sbyar la 'jib rtsi bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jib sman ni bod sran dang / nas dang / gro dang / mon sran sde'u dang / bra bo dang / gzhan yang sman spyi bag can rnams lhan cig sbyar la 'jib rtsi bya'o //
translated: As for the inhalations, mix Tibetan beans, barley, wheat, lentils, millet, and other generally available herbs together and make an inhalation.

original: gcin nad dang / mdze nad kyi rman tshabs cher red pa la ni byi'u rug pa dang / dong ga'i sde tshan gnyis kyi dang po sman bdun bdun bskol ba'i khu bas rma bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: gcin nad dang / mdze nad kyi rman tshabs cher red pa la ni byi'u rug pa dang / dong ga'i sde tshan gnyis kyi dang po sman bdun bdun bskol ba'i khu bas rma bkru bar bya'o //
translated: For those with serious urinary or leprosy wounds, boil seven of the first herbs from each of the two groups of partridge pea and sweet flag and use the liquid to wash the wound.

original: yang na pa to la dang / nim pa'i 'o ma bskol bas bkru'o //
analyzed: yang na pa to la dang / nim pa'i 'o ma bskol bas bkru'o //
translated: Alternatively, wash it with a decoction of patola and neem milk.

original: rma dag pa yang rung ma dag pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: rma dag pa yang rung ma dag pa yang rung ste /
translated: Whether the wound is clean or not,

original: de la ni n+ya gro dha la sogs pa gong du bstan pa'i sman lnga'i shun phrags bskol ba'i khu bas rma bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la ni n+ya gro dha la sogs pa gong du bstan pa'i sman lnga'i shun phrags bskol ba'i khu bas rma bkru bar bya'o //
translated: boil the outer bark of the five herbs such as the banyan tree and so on, which were taught above, and use the liquid to wash the wound.

original: yang na pa to la dang / til dang / shing mngar dang / dur byid dang / dan ti dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / nim pa'i lo ma dang / rgyam tsha dang / 'di rnams sbyar ba'i 'dag gus bskus na rma sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na pa to la dang / til dang / shing mngar dang / dur byid dang / dan ti dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / nim pa'i lo ma dang / rgyam tsha dang / 'di rnams sbyar ba'i 'dag gus bskus na rma sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Alternatively, apply a compress of patola, sesame, sweet wood, turmeric, dhenuka, the two types of serpo, nimba leaves, and rock salt.

original: rma kha tshigs dang gnad rnams su byung ba la ni dur byid dang / danti dang / lang ga li dang / rgyam tsha dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i chang bu phra mo byas te /
analyzed: rma kha tshigs dang gnad rnams su byung ba la ni dur byid dang / danti dang / lang ga li dang / rgyam tsha dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i chang bu phra mo byas te /
translated: For wounds that occur at joints and vital points, make a small ball of dhenuka, dhenuka, langali, rock salt, and honey.

original: rma nang du bcug na sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: rma nang du bcug na sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Place it inside the wound and it will heal.

original: rlung gis rma zug gzer drag po dang bcas shing rnag khrag 'dzag pa la ni nas dang / gro dang / mon cha ra dang / shri preshta dang / thang shing dang mar dang bcas pa'i dud pas bdug go / khrag dang mkhris pa shas che ba'i rma la ni shin tu bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i sman gyis bsku'o //
analyzed: rlung gis rma zug gzer drag po dang bcas shing rnag khrag 'dzag pa la ni nas dang / gro dang / mon cha ra dang / shri preshta dang / thang shing dang mar dang bcas pa'i dud pas bdug go / khrag dang mkhris pa shas che ba'i rma la ni shin tu bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i sman gyis bsku'o //
translated: For a wound that is painful due to wind and oozes pus and blood, one should fumigate it with barley, wheat, monchha, shripreshta, pine resin, and ghee.🔽For a wound that is predominantly blood and bile, one should apply a medicinal paste with a very cooling potency.

original: rma kha skams shing sha bri la rma zab pa la ni sha skyed pa'i sman bya ste /
analyzed: rma kha skams shing sha bri la rma zab pa la ni sha skyed pa'i sman bya ste /
translated: For a wound that is dry, sunken, and deep, one should use a flesh-producing medicine.

original: de yang n+ya gro dha dang / shug pa'i sde tshan dang / aa shva gandha dang / ba la dang / til dang / de rnams kyis bsku ba dang / sha za ba'i srog chags kyi sha cho ga bzhin du g-yos su byas te /
analyzed: de yang n+ya gro dha dang / shug pa'i sde tshan dang / aa shva gandha dang / ba la dang / til dang / de rnams kyis bsku ba dang / sha za ba'i srog chags kyi sha cho ga bzhin du g-yos su byas te /
translated: That is, one should apply a paste of nyagrodha, the catechu group, ashwagandha, bala, sesame, and so forth, and cook the flesh of flesh-eating animals according to the ritual.

original: zos na sha skyed de /
analyzed: zos na sha skyed de /
translated: If one eats it, it produces flesh.

original: @367b sems kyang dri ma med par byed do //
analyzed: @367b sems kyang dri ma med par byed do //
translated: It also purifies the mind.

original: rma kha'i sha gsar ba phyir 'bur zhing rlo ba la ni srin bu shing gi me tog dang / nag tshur dang / ldong ros dang / ba bla dang / gu gul dang / kru trug tres dang / 'di rnams kyi 'dag gus bskus pa phan no //
analyzed: rma kha'i sha gsar ba phyir 'bur zhing rlo ba la ni srin bu shing gi me tog dang / nag tshur dang / ldong ros dang / ba bla dang / gu gul dang / kru trug tres dang / 'di rnams kyi 'dag gus bskus pa phan no //
translated: wood flower insect, black aconite, realgar, white sugar, gugul, and kru truk tre.

original: gal te sha de mthon por mthug cing sral g-ya' zhing yun ring po nas 'tsho ba la ni thal sman gyi las kyis gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sha de mthon por mthug cing sral g-ya' zhing yun ring po nas 'tsho ba la ni thal sman gyi las kyis gso bar bya'o //
translated: If the flesh is thick, raised, itchy, and has been festering for a long time, treat it with a medicinal powder.

original: rde'u 'byin pa'i rma las gcin 'byung ba dang / tshigs su chad pa rnams la ni mdo'i gnas su ji skad bstan pa'i cho ga rnams bya'o //
analyzed: rde'u 'byin pa'i rma las gcin 'byung ba dang / tshigs su chad pa rnams la ni mdo'i gnas su ji skad bstan pa'i cho ga rnams bya'o //
translated: For a wound that has a stone in it, or for a wound that has urine or a joint in it, perform the rites as taught in the chapter on the sites of the channels.

original: rma'i chog tshul bzhin byas kyang mi 'grub pa la ni me'i las rnams bya'o //
analyzed: rma'i chog tshul bzhin byas kyang mi 'grub pa la ni me'i las rnams bya'o //
translated: If a wound does not heal despite proper treatment, perform the rites of fire.

original: de ltar rma'i kha rab tu sha rlo ba la sogs pa'i cho ga gong du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rma'i kha rab tu sha rlo ba la sogs pa'i cho ga gong du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the rites for fresh flesh and so forth,

original: da ni rma 'tsho zhing 'drub par bya ba'i phyir sman sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rma 'tsho zhing 'drub par bya ba'i phyir sman sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: now, in order to heal and close a wound, apply medicine.

original: aa shva gandha dang / seng phrom dang / kad pa la dang / shing mngar dang / btsod dang / da ta ka'i me tog dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma sbyar na rma 'tsho bar byed pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: aa shva gandha dang / seng phrom dang / kad pa la dang / shing mngar dang / btsod dang / da ta ka'i me tog dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma sbyar na rma 'tsho bar byed pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: Ashvagandha, mango, kadamba, sweet flag, madder, and datura flowers—a compound of these powders is the best for healing wounds.

original: rma ma smin pa dang / rma kha'i sha rul zhing 'drubs su mi 'dod pa la ni sman kha ba dang / mngar ba bskol ba'i nang du til mar dang / shing mngar gyi phye ma btab ste /
analyzed: rma ma smin pa dang / rma kha'i sha rul zhing 'drubs su mi 'dod pa la ni sman kha ba dang / mngar ba bskol ba'i nang du til mar dang / shing mngar gyi phye ma btab ste /
translated: For unripe wounds and putrid flesh in wounds that are not desired to be sutured, boil bitter and sweet medicines, add sesame oil and sweet flag powder,

original: snum dang ldan pa dro 'jam tsam gyis bskus na rma 'drub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snum dang ldan pa dro 'jam tsam gyis bskus na rma 'drub par 'gyur ro //
translated: and apply it lukewarm and oily. The wound will be sutured.

original: gong ma ni sbyor ba de'i steng du nim pa'i lo ma dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar te bskus na /
analyzed: gong ma ni sbyor ba de'i steng du nim pa'i lo ma dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar te bskus na /
translated: The above preparation, further mixed with neem leaves and honey,

original: rma'i cho ga sbyong ba'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: rma'i cho ga sbyong ba'i mchog yin no //
translated: is the best for purifying wound rituals.

original: yang na sbyor ba de nyid zhun mar dang bcas pas bskus na yang rma myur du 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba de nyid zhun mar dang bcas pas bskus na yang rma myur du 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: Alternatively, applying just that preparation with ghee also quickly heals wounds.

original: gang du til med pa'i gnas su nas kyi skyin pa bya'o //
analyzed: gang du til med pa'i gnas su nas kyi skyin pa bya'o //
translated: In a place where sesame is not available, barley should be used as a substitute.

original: zhes de nyid rigs pa'i sman pa rnams 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes de nyid rigs pa'i sman pa rnams 'dod do //
translated: This is the opinion of the physicians who know the truth.

original: khrag dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma dang / rma dug can dang / glo bur du byung ba'i rma dang / zabs su song ba'i rma dang / tsha ba dang bcas pa'i rmal ni mar dang 'o ma dang ; rma 'tsho ba'i sman dang lhan cig sbyar te btang na rma 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khrag dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma dang / rma dug can dang / glo bur du byung ba'i rma dang / zabs su song ba'i rma dang / tsha ba dang bcas pa'i rmal ni mar dang 'o ma dang ; rma 'tsho ba'i sman dang lhan cig sbyar te btang na rma 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For wounds caused by blood and bile, poisonous wounds, sudden wounds, deep wounds, and hot wounds, if one applies ghee, milk, and wound-healing medicine together, the wound will heal.

original: bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i rma la ni rma sman dang bskol ba'i nang du til mar dang sbyar ba btang na /
analyzed: bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i rma la ni rma sman dang bskol ba'i nang du til mar dang sbyar ba btang na /
translated: For wounds caused by phlegm and wind, if one applies wound medicine and boiled sesame oil,

original: rma 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rma 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the wound will heal.

original: nag tshur bya bal ma dang / seng phrom dang / aa ru ra dang / @368a * //
analyzed: nag tshur bya bal ma dang / seng phrom dang / aa ru ra dang / @368a * //
translated: For wounds caused by blood and bile, one should apply a paste of black gram, hog plum, and yellow myrobalan.

original: sra rtsi pog dang / li khri dang / dngul rdo dang / spangs ma dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma po son cha dang / til mar dang bcas pa btang na rma 'tsho ba'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: sra rtsi pog dang / li khri dang / dngul rdo dang / spangs ma dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma po son cha dang / til mar dang bcas pa btang na rma 'tsho ba'i mchog yin no //
translated: If one applies a paste of resin, lac, silver ore, and frankincense, mixed with sesame oil, it is the best for healing wounds.

original: rma kha mnyam pa dang / rma'i sha brtan pa dang / pags pa la rma 'byung ba la ni ka kum dang / au dumb'a ra dang / aa shvadtha dang / shing 'dzam bu dang / kad pha la dang / seng phrom dang / 'di rnams btags pa'i phye mas btab na yang rma dag pa yin no //
analyzed: rma kha mnyam pa dang / rma'i sha brtan pa dang / pags pa la rma 'byung ba la ni ka kum dang / au dumb'a ra dang / aa shvadtha dang / shing 'dzam bu dang / kad pha la dang / seng phrom dang / 'di rnams btags pa'i phye mas btab na yang rma dag pa yin no //
translated: If the wound is even, the wound flesh is firm, and the skin is wounded, if one applies a paste of saffron, udumbara, ashvattha, jambu, kadamba, and sengphrom, the wound will also heal.

original: rma kha gsar pa pags pa dang / sha'u skyer mi 'dod pa la ni /
analyzed: rma kha gsar pa pags pa dang / sha'u skyer mi 'dod pa la ni /
translated: If the wound is new and the skin and flesh are not growing,

original: ka gu ba la sogs pa gong gi shing de rnams kyi phye mas btab na pags pa myur du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ka gu ba la sogs pa gong gi shing de rnams kyi phye mas btab na pags pa myur du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if one applies a paste of the above trees such as kakubha, the skin will quickly grow.

original: rgya skyegs dang / ldong ros dang / btsod dang / ba bla dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gus bskus na /🔽pags pa'i rma dag par byed pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: rgya skyegs dang / ldong ros dang / btsod dang / ba bla dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gus bskus na / pags pa'i rma dag par byed pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: The best remedy for healing skin wounds is an ointment made from lac, red arsenic, red ochre, white mustard, the two types of turmeric, and the two types of saffron mixed with butter and honey.

original: skyer pa dang / pri yang ku dang / aa mra'i rus pa dang / he ma ka la dang / dngul chu dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma ba lang gi lcib btsir ba'i khu ba dang sbyar ba'i lde gus bskus na pags pa'i rang bzhin gyi mdog bskyed pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: skyer pa dang / pri yang ku dang / aa mra'i rus pa dang / he ma ka la dang / dngul chu dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma ba lang gi lcib btsir ba'i khu ba dang sbyar ba'i lde gus bskus na pags pa'i rang bzhin gyi mdog bskyed pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: The best remedy for restoring the skin’s natural color is an ointment made from the ashes of burnt birch, priyangu, mango, and hema tree seeds, mercury, and silver mixed with the juice of a crushed cow’s hoof.

original: spu skyed pa'i don du glang po che'i so snod kha sbyor gyi nang du dud pa ma shor bar bsregs pa dang / skyer khan dang til mar sbyar bas bskus na spu skye ba dang / de bzhin du srog chags rkang pa bzhi pa'i sen mo dang /
analyzed: spu skyed pa'i don du glang po che'i so snod kha sbyor gyi nang du dud pa ma shor bar bsregs pa dang / skyer khan dang til mar sbyar bas bskus na spu skye ba dang / de bzhin du srog chags rkang pa bzhi pa'i sen mo dang /
translated: To grow hair, burn the root of an elephant’s tusk in a closed container without letting the smoke escape. Mix the ashes with kyerkan and sesame oil and apply it. Hair will grow. Similarly, mix the claws of a four-legged animal with

original: spu dang / rus pa dang / pags pa dang / rva dang / rmig pa dang / 'di rnams gong ma bzhin du bsregs la snag tshar byas pa til mar dang sbyar bas bskus na spu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spu dang / rus pa dang / pags pa dang / rva dang / rmig pa dang / 'di rnams gong ma bzhin du bsregs la snag tshar byas pa til mar dang sbyar bas bskus na spu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Hair, bone, skin, horn, and hoof, having burned these as before, make ink, and if one applies it mixed with sesame oil, hair will grow.

original: rma dang ldan pa'i skyes bus ni kha zas kyi phan gnod gang bsrung ba ni /
analyzed: rma dang ldan pa'i skyes bus ni kha zas kyi phan gnod gang bsrung ba ni /
translated: As for the benefit and harm of food for a person who has an ulcer,

original: mdo'i gnas mtshon gyi las bstan pa'i skabs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i gnas mtshon gyi las bstan pa'i skabs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: one should look in the section on the teaching of the signs of the site of the sūtra.

original: rlung las gyur pa'i rma la ni rtsa ba che chung lnga'i sde tshan dang / rlung 'dzoms pa'i sman dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //
analyzed: rlung las gyur pa'i rma la ni rtsa ba che chung lnga'i sde tshan dang / rlung 'dzoms pa'i sman dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //
translated: In the case of an ulcer that is due to wind, one should administer a compound of the five major and minor root medicines and the medicines that gather wind.

original: de bzhin du mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma la ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma la ni /
translated: Similarly, in the case of an ulcer that is due to bile,

original: n+ya gro dha dang / shug pa'i sde tshan gnyis dang / mkhris pa 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar te gtang ngo //
analyzed: n+ya gro dha dang / shug pa'i sde tshan gnyis dang / mkhris pa 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar te gtang ngo //
translated: one should administer a compound of the two groups of nyagrodha and śigru and the medicines that destroy bile.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i rma la ni /
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i rma la ni /
translated: In the case of an ulcer that is due to phlegm,🔽one should administer a compound of the three groups of

original: dong ga'i sde tshan dang / gang bad @368b kan 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //
analyzed: dong ga'i sde tshan dang / gang bad @368b kan 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //
translated: In the case of a pitta-dominant wound, one should apply a compound of the group of bitter medicines.

original: nad gzhi 'dres pa las gyur pa'i rma la ni sman yang 'dres par sbyar la gtang ngo //
analyzed: nad gzhi 'dres pa las gyur pa'i rma la ni sman yang 'dres par sbyar la gtang ngo //
translated: In the case of a wound caused by a combination of humors, one should apply a compound of a combination of medicines.

original: gong gi sman gyi sbyor ba de dag ni bkru ba dang / byug pa dang / sman mar dang / 'bru mar dang / khu ba bya ba dang / phye ma dang / gdar bu dang sbyor ba bdun po de dag gis ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: gong gi sman gyi sbyor ba de dag ni bkru ba dang / byug pa dang / sman mar dang / 'bru mar dang / khu ba bya ba dang / phye ma dang / gdar bu dang sbyor ba bdun po de dag gis ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These medicinal compounds mentioned above should be applied in the seven ways of cleansing, anointing, medicinal butter, oil, juice, powder, and plaster, as appropriate.

original: dz'a ti dang / nim pa dang / pa to la'i lo ma dang / pu tse shel dang / skyer pa dang / yung ba dang / thal tres dang / btsod dang / aa ru ra dang / sbra tshil dang / spangs ma dang / shing mngar dang /
analyzed: dz'a ti dang / nim pa dang / pa to la'i lo ma dang / pu tse shel dang / skyer pa dang / yung ba dang / thal tres dang / btsod dang / aa ru ra dang / sbra tshil dang / spangs ma dang / shing mngar dang /
translated: Jati, nimba, patola leaves, puche shel, kyera, indigo, turmeric, red ochre, haritaki, bear’s fat, spangma, and sweet wood.

original: ka ranydza'i sa bon dang / 'di rnams mar dang tshul bzhin bskol te sbyar la btang na rma kha chung ba dang gnad la brten te rnag 'dzag pa dang / rma zab cing zug gzer dang bcas pa dang / rma mched pa la phan te de dag cing 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: ka ranydza'i sa bon dang / 'di rnams mar dang tshul bzhin bskol te sbyar la btang na rma kha chung ba dang gnad la brten te rnag 'dzag pa dang / rma zab cing zug gzer dang bcas pa dang / rma mched pa la phan te de dag cing 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: If these are properly boiled with sesame oil and applied, it will benefit small wounds, wounds that ooze pus due to being located on vital points, deep wounds with pain, and spreading wounds. It will cleanse and heal them.

original: rma gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa lnga pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rma gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa lnga pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the twenty-fifth chapter, on wound healing, from The Quintessence Tantra: The Secret Oral Tradition of the Eight Branches of the Science of Healing.

original: // / de nas glo bur du rma gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /🔽de la glo bur du byung ba'i rma ni /
analyzed: // / de nas glo bur du rma gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste / de la glo bur du byung ba'i rma ni /
translated: Then the chapter on the treatment of sudden wounds will be explained.

original: 'phral du mtshon la sogs pas smas pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phral du mtshon la sogs pas smas pa las 'byung ste /
translated: Sudden wounds are those that occur immediately from being struck by weapons and so forth.

original: de yang rma 'byung ba'i gnas kyang mtha' yas mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang rma 'byung ba'i gnas kyang mtha' yas mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, although the locations of wounds are limitless,

original: re zhig smas pa'i rma rnam pa brgyad du bshad cing brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig smas pa'i rma rnam pa brgyad du bshad cing brjod par bya ste /
translated: for the time being, the eight types of struck wounds will be explained and described.

original: de yang pags pa bshus pa dang / rma nyis rtseg tu 'byung ba dang / rnam par chad pa dang / rab tu 'phyang ba dang / yan lag lhung ba dang / rngu ba zug pa dang / gnad du bsnun pa dang / grugs pa'i rma rnams so //
analyzed: de yang pags pa bshus pa dang / rma nyis rtseg tu 'byung ba dang / rnam par chad pa dang / rab tu 'phyang ba dang / yan lag lhung ba dang / rngu ba zug pa dang / gnad du bsnun pa dang / grugs pa'i rma rnams so //
translated: The wounds are: flayed, with two openings, cut, hanging, with a broken limb, with a piercing pain, with a vital part struck, and with a festering sore.

original: de la pags pa bshus pa'i rma ni pags pa tsam shus te /🔽chu ser nyi tshe 'am /
analyzed: de la pags pa bshus pa'i rma ni pags pa tsam shus te / chu ser nyi tshe 'am /
translated: A flayed wound is one in which the skin is removed,

original: khrag cung zad dang bcas pa 'dzag la nad dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: khrag cung zad dang bcas pa 'dzag la nad dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: and only the lymph or a little blood flows out, and it is painful.

original: rma nyis rtsig tu 'byung ba ni dang por gcig gis bsnun la de dang nye bar yang bsnun pa yin no //
analyzed: rma nyis rtsig tu 'byung ba ni dang por gcig gis bsnun la de dang nye bar yang bsnun pa yin no //
translated: A wound with two openings is one that is first struck by one thing and then struck by something else nearby.

original: rnam bar chad pa'i rma ni mtshon gyis lan cig bcad pa'i steng du yang brnan pa'o //🔽rab tu 'phyang ba'i rma ni rus pa'i lhag ma tsam gyis 'brel te 'phyang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam bar chad pa'i rma ni mtshon gyis lan cig bcad pa'i steng du yang brnan pa'o // rab tu 'phyang ba'i rma ni rus pa'i lhag ma tsam gyis 'brel te 'phyang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: A cut wound is one that is cut by a weapon and then cut again.🔽A hanging wound is one that hangs by a mere remnant of bone.

original: yan lag lhung ba'i rma ni yan lag 'ur por chad de sa la lhung ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag lhung ba'i rma ni yan lag 'ur por chad de sa la lhung ba'o //
translated: A broken limb wound is one in which a limb is cut off and falls to the ground.

original: rdu ba zug pa zhes bya ba'i rma ni @369a * //🔽mchon rtse shin tu phra ba lus la zug ste /
analyzed: rdu ba zug pa zhes bya ba'i rma ni @369a * // mchon rtse shin tu phra ba lus la zug ste /
translated: The wound called “stabbing pain”🔽is a very fine weapon that penetrates the body.

original: khong par zhugs pa ma gtogs par mtshon nang du lus pa'o //
analyzed: khong par zhugs pa ma gtogs par mtshon nang du lus pa'o //
translated: Except for entering the stomach, the weapon remains inside the body.

original: bsnun zhes bya ba ni gnad du bsnun pa'o //
analyzed: bsnun zhes bya ba ni gnad du bsnun pa'o //
translated: “ Piercing” means penetrating a vital point.

original: grugs pa zhes bya ba'i rma ni khrag dang rkang gnyis 'brel bar 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: grugs pa zhes bya ba'i rma ni khrag dang rkang gnyis 'brel bar 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: The wound called “disturbance” is a disturbance of the two, blood and pus.

original: mtshon gyis drag tu bsnun zhing phog na ni /
analyzed: mtshon gyis drag tu bsnun zhing phog na ni /
translated: If one is struck hard with a weapon,

original: rma kha yangs shing rgya chen por song ste /
analyzed: rma kha yangs shing rgya chen por song ste /
translated: the wound becomes wide and large,

original: rus pa dang mtshams bye pa yin no //
analyzed: rus pa dang mtshams bye pa yin no //
translated: and the bones and joints separate.

original: de ltar rma glo bur du byung ba la ni shing mngar dang mar sbyar bas bsku'o //
analyzed: de ltar rma glo bur du byung ba la ni shing mngar dang mar sbyar bas bsku'o //
translated: Thus, for a wound that suddenly occurs, one should apply a mixture of sweet wood and butter.

original: yang na shin tu zug gzer che ba la ni /
analyzed: yang na shin tu zug gzer che ba la ni /
translated: Or, for a very severe pain,

original: ba bla'i 'bru mar dro 'jam tsam gyis bsku'o //
analyzed: ba bla'i 'bru mar dro 'jam tsam gyis bsku'o //
translated: one should apply just a warm, gentle amount of ghee from a sheep’s head.

original: smas te khrag mang po byung zhing tsha ba skyes na de gzhi la bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: smas te khrag mang po byung zhing tsha ba skyes na de gzhi la bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If one is wounded and much blood comes out, and a fever arises, in order to stop that,

original: sman mngar ba dang bsil ba'i sman snum pa dang bcas pa rma khar blugs so //
analyzed: sman mngar ba dang bsil ba'i sman snum pa dang bcas pa rma khar blugs so //
translated: For wounds, apply sweet and cooling medicines, and oily substances.

original: glo bur du 'byung ba'i rma kha rgya chen por song na ni rub par bya ba'i phyir sbrang rtsi dang mar sbyar bas bsku zhing mkhris pa 'joms pa'i bsil ba'i sman rnams kyang sbyar ro //
analyzed: glo bur du 'byung ba'i rma kha rgya chen por song na ni rub par bya ba'i phyir sbrang rtsi dang mar sbyar bas bsku zhing mkhris pa 'joms pa'i bsil ba'i sman rnams kyang sbyar ro //
translated: If the wound is suddenly enlarged, apply honey and ghee to close it, and also cooling medicines to counteract pitta.

original: de'i 'og tu slon khrus kyis lus sbyang ba dang / smyung ba bya ba dang / zas zos pa'i 'og tu rtag tu gtar gas khrag dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu slon khrus kyis lus sbyang ba dang / smyung ba bya ba dang / zas zos pa'i 'og tu rtag tu gtar gas khrag dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: After that, cleanse the body with a bath, fast, and always let blood from the wound after eating.

original: de la pags pa bshus pa'i rma dang / grugs pa'i rma gnyis la ni khyad par du cho ga gong ma ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de la pags pa bshus pa'i rma dang / grugs pa'i rma gnyis la ni khyad par du cho ga gong ma ltar bya ste /
translated: In the case of wounds with skin removed and wounds with blisters, the procedure is especially as described above.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na de gnyis ni 'dzag pa nyung zhing myur du smin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na de gnyis ni 'dzag pa nyung zhing myur du smin pas so //
translated: Why is that? Because those two have little discharge and quickly ripen.

original: rma gzhan ni phal cher rma mang du 'byung ste /
analyzed: rma gzhan ni phal cher rma mang du 'byung ste /
translated: Other wounds mostly occur frequently.

original: khrag mang du 'dzag cing zad pas /
analyzed: khrag mang du 'dzag cing zad pas /
translated: Because of the loss of much blood,

original: rlung 'khrugs nas zug gzer skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rlung 'khrugs nas zug gzer skyed par byed do //
translated: the wind is disturbed and causes pain.

original: de la ni rlung 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba dang / blugs pa dang / dugs dang / bsku ba dang / byug pa dang / 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba rnams bya'o //
analyzed: de la ni rlung 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba dang / blugs pa dang / dugs dang / bsku ba dang / byug pa dang / 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba rnams bya'o //
translated: For this, administer potions, enema, fomentation, anointing, ointment, and mild enema, prepared with medicines that conquer wind.

original: glo bur du byung ba'i rma la 'phral gyi gso ba de dag byas nas zhag bdun gyi bar du bzhag go //
analyzed: glo bur du byung ba'i rma la 'phral gyi gso ba de dag byas nas zhag bdun gyi bar du bzhag go //
translated: For a wound that has suddenly occurred, perform those immediate treatments and keep the patient for seven days.

original: de ltar zhag bdun gyi bar du 'das te /
analyzed: de ltar zhag bdun gyi bar du 'das te /
translated: If it has been more than seven days,

original: zug gzer gyi shugs glod pa dang / de'i 'og tu gong du smos pa'i cho ga rnams spyad do //
analyzed: zug gzer gyi shugs glod pa dang / de'i 'og tu gong du smos pa'i cho ga rnams spyad do //
translated: and the force of the pain has subsided, then perform the procedures mentioned above.

original: de ltar bshad pa de dag ni rma spyi'i cho gar bstan pa yin no //
