translated: and the intestine is thick and large,

original: rgyu ma nang du zhugs su ma 'dod na /
analyzed: rgyu ma nang du zhugs su ma 'dod na /
translated: and if the intestine does not want to enter inside,

original: de shong pa'i tshad tsam dral la nang du gzhug go //
analyzed: de shong pa'i tshad tsam dral la nang du gzhug go //
translated: then cut the intestine to the size that will fit inside and insert it.

original: rgyu ma de rang gi gnas su legs par phyin par shes na rma de btsem par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma de rang gi gnas su legs par phyin par shes na rma de btsem par bya'o //
translated: When you know that the intestine has reached its proper place, then sew up the wound.

original: gal te rgyu ma sngar ji ltar 'dug pa bzhin du ma song ste /
analyzed: gal te rgyu ma sngar ji ltar 'dug pa bzhin du ma song ste /
translated: If the intestine has not gone back to its former place,

original: rgyu ma 'chus shing 'khrug par bcug na ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma 'chus shing 'khrug par bcug na ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and if the intestine is twisted and disturbed, then death will occur.

original: de nas ras snum gyis bsgos pas dkris la steng nas mar gyis kyang bsku'o //
analyzed: de nas ras snum gyis bsgos pas dkris la steng nas mar gyis kyang bsku'o //
translated: Then wrap it with a cloth soaked in oil and cover it with ghee.

original: de'i 'og tu tsi tra ka'i 'bru mar 'o ma dang sbyar ba dro 'jam tsam blud na bshang ba sla zhing rlung dang bcas pa bde bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tsi tra ka'i 'bru mar 'o ma dang sbyar ba dro 'jam tsam blud na bshang ba sla zhing rlung dang bcas pa bde bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, if one drinks a warm, mild infusion of citraka seeds mixed with milk, the stool will be soft and the flatus will be released comfortably.

original: cho ga gong ma ji lta ba bzhin du lo gcig gi bar du rma @371b ba srung ba la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga gong ma ji lta ba bzhin du lo gcig gi bar du rma @371b ba srung ba la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: As in the previous ritual, one should strive to protect the wound for one year.

original: smas te lto tshil phyir byung nas thal ba dang sa la sogs pa'i dri mas gos na ni rtsa ba bcu pa'i sman btags la khol ba'i khu bas bkrus la /
analyzed: smas te lto tshil phyir byung nas thal ba dang sa la sogs pa'i dri mas gos na ni rtsa ba bcu pa'i sman btags la khol ba'i khu bas bkrus la /
translated: If the fat from the stomach comes out and is soiled by the smell of ash, earth, and so on, wash it with a decoction of the ten root medicines.

original: sman pa mkhas pas tshil ji tsam phyir byung ba'i mtshams su skud pas dam du bcings te mtshon rnon pos bcad pa 'am /
analyzed: sman pa mkhas pas tshil ji tsam phyir byung ba'i mtshams su skud pas dam du bcings te mtshon rnon pos bcad pa 'am /
translated: A skilled physician should tightly bind the fat with a thread at the point where it has come out, and cut it with a sharp instrument.

original: yang na mtshon me la bsregs pas bzhu'o //
analyzed: yang na mtshon me la bsregs pas bzhu'o //
translated: Alternatively, it will melt by burning the instrument in fire.

original: gzhan du log par bcad na ni khong pa na zhing zug la rgyu ma sgra dang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan du log par bcad na ni khong pa na zhing zug la rgyu ma sgra dang bcas pa 'am /
translated: If it is wrongly cut elsewhere, it will cause internal pain, and the intestines will make sounds,

original: yang na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or one will die.

original: de ltar byas pa'i 'og tu ras sbrang rtsis byugs pas bcings la kha zas zhu ba'i tshod tsam na mar blud do //
analyzed: de ltar byas pa'i 'og tu ras sbrang rtsis byugs pas bcings la kha zas zhu ba'i tshod tsam na mar blud do //
translated: After doing this, apply a bandage smeared with honey, and give her a drink of butter-oil when the food is digested.

original: dan di dang / rgya skyegs dang / gze ma dang / shing mngar dang / de rnams 'o ma dang bskol ba blud pa 'am yang na gong du smos pa'i cho ga bzhin du byas na na zhing tsha ba las rgyal bar byed pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: dan di dang / rgya skyegs dang / gze ma dang / shing mngar dang / de rnams 'o ma dang bskol ba blud pa 'am yang na gong du smos pa'i cho ga bzhin du byas na na zhing tsha ba las rgyal bar byed pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: Give her a drink of a decoction of dandi, lac, turmeric, sweet flag, and sweet-flag root boiled in milk, or else do it according to the above procedure. This is the best for overcoming illness and fever.

original: tshil gyis thor bu gso ba'i nad du bshad pa'i 'bru mar gyi bsku byug byas na yang phan no //
analyzed: tshil gyis thor bu gso ba'i nad du bshad pa'i 'bru mar gyi bsku byug byas na yang phan no //
translated: Also, it is helpful to apply the oil described in the treatment of sudden onset of abscesses.

original: bal bu'i lo ma dang / shug pa dang / spang spos dang / ha re nu ka dang / aa ka ru dang / tsandan dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / padma'i sa bon dang / pu tse shel dang / de rnams til mar dang bskol ba'i khu ba bskus na /
analyzed: bal bu'i lo ma dang / shug pa dang / spang spos dang / ha re nu ka dang / aa ka ru dang / tsandan dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / padma'i sa bon dang / pu tse shel dang / de rnams til mar dang bskol ba'i khu ba bskus na /
translated: Apply a paste of leaves of the Indian beech, juniper, Indian valerian, harītakī, agalloch, sandalwood, the two types of turmeric, lotus seeds, and purisela boiled in sesame oil.

original: rma glo bur du byung ba gso bar byed pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: rma glo bur du byung ba gso bar byed pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: This is the best for healing sudden onset of wounds.

original: mtshon gyis bsnun ta ma /
analyzed: mtshon gyis bsnun ta ma /
translated: If the patient is struck by a weapon,

original: g-yang sa nas lhung ste dran pa nyams shing rmongs bag tu gyur pa ni rlung dang / khrag 'joms pa'i sman gyis mnye ba dang / dril ba dang / lus dag par byed pa la sogs pas tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yang sa nas lhung ste dran pa nyams shing rmongs bag tu gyur pa ni rlung dang / khrag 'joms pa'i sman gyis mnye ba dang / dril ba dang / lus dag par byed pa la sogs pas tshim par bya'o //
translated: if he has lost consciousness and become confused from falling into a ravine, he should be satisfied by massaging with medicine that subdues wind and blood, by rubbing, by cleansing the body, and so forth.🔽If the joints of the body are dislocated, if the body is severely injured, if there is bleeding, if the vital points are struck,

original: lus kyi yan lag gi tshigs bye ba dang / lus tshabs cher snad pa dang / khrag zag pa dang / gnad du bsnun pa dang / de rnams la ni zom bzang po lus shong ba tsam til mar gyis bkang ste /
analyzed: lus kyi yan lag gi tshigs bye ba dang / lus tshabs cher snad pa dang / khrag zag pa dang / gnad du bsnun pa dang / de rnams la ni zom bzang po lus shong ba tsam til mar gyis bkang ste /
translated: for those, fill a good bag that is the size of the body with sesame oil,

original: lus gzhug cing de'i 'og tu sha khu sbyin no //
analyzed: lus gzhug cing de'i 'og tu sha khu sbyin no //
translated: and insert the body into it. After that, give meat soup.

original: glo bur du byung ba'i rma gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa drug pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: glo bur du byung ba'i rma gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa drug pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the twenty-sixth chapter on healing sudden wounds.

original: // / de nas chag grugs gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas chag grugs gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the chapter on healing fractures will be explained.

original: de la thog mar lhung ba dang / snad pa la sogs pas rus pa'i tshigs dang / tshigs ma yin par bye ba @372a * //
analyzed: de la thog mar lhung ba dang / snad pa la sogs pas rus pa'i tshigs dang / tshigs ma yin par bye ba @372a * //
translated: Among those, first, if the joints or non-joints of the bones are dislocated by falling, being injured, and so forth,

original: dang ; chag pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang ; chag pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: and the two types of fracture.

original: de la tshigs byung ba'i rtags ni brkyang bskum gyi rtsol ba ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de la tshigs byung ba'i rtags ni brkyang bskum gyi rtsol ba ni mi nus so //
translated: The signs of a dislocation are that one is unable to flex or extend the affected limb.

original: rus pa chag pa'i mtshan ma ni shas cher skrang ba dang / dus thams cad du zug cing na ba dang / bsgul bskyod phra mo tsam yang mi nus pa dang / myangs na rus pa khrol sgra grag pa ste /
analyzed: rus pa chag pa'i mtshan ma ni shas cher skrang ba dang / dus thams cad du zug cing na ba dang / bsgul bskyod phra mo tsam yang mi nus pa dang / myangs na rus pa khrol sgra grag pa ste /
translated: The signs of a fracture are severe swelling, constant pain, an inability to move the limb even slightly, and a cracking sound when the limb is squeezed.

original: de dag ni chag pa'i mtshan nyid mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni chag pa'i mtshan nyid mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: These are the brief characteristics of fractures.

original: de la chag grugs kyi sbyor ba mang du smos pa las sbyor ba mang du ji lta ba bzhin du nyung zhig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la chag grugs kyi sbyor ba mang du smos pa las sbyor ba mang du ji lta ba bzhin du nyung zhig brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, although many treatments for fractures and dislocations are mentioned, I will describe a few of the most common.

original: thog mar rus pa chag par gyur na rus pa 'khrol ba'i sgra grag go //
analyzed: thog mar rus pa chag par gyur na rus pa 'khrol ba'i sgra grag go //
translated: First, if a bone is fractured, there will be a cracking sound.

original: de la rus pa gang yang rked khums su chag pa ni gzhug par sla zhing 'tsho bar yang sla'o //
analyzed: de la rus pa gang yang rked khums su chag pa ni gzhug par sla zhing 'tsho bar yang sla'o //
translated: If a bone is broken in the middle, it is easy to set and the patient will recover.

original: rus pa chag pa de zug cing ma chag pa tsam du lus pa'am /
analyzed: rus pa chag pa de zug cing ma chag pa tsam du lus pa'am /
translated: If the fracture is not set properly, the bone will not heal properly.

original: yang na rus pa gzhol phyogs chag ste /
analyzed: yang na rus pa gzhol phyogs chag ste /
translated: Or, if the bone is broken and displaced,

original: drangs kyang mtho dman du song ba ni shin tu gso dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: drangs kyang mtho dman du song ba ni shin tu gso dka' ba yin no //
translated: even if it is pulled out, it becomes high or low, and is very difficult to heal.

original: de bzhin du lus rjud pa dang / nyams stobs chung ba dang / rlung nad na ba dang / zas nyung du za ba dang / klad pa'i tshigs dang / rkang pa'i tshigs bye zhing 'byung ba dang / gdong bu'i rus pa chag pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus rjud pa dang / nyams stobs chung ba dang / rlung nad na ba dang / zas nyung du za ba dang / klad pa'i tshigs dang / rkang pa'i tshigs bye zhing 'byung ba dang / gdong bu'i rus pa chag pa dang /
translated: Similarly, if the body is emaciated, weak, suffering from wind disorders, eating little food, the joints of the head and feet are separated and protrude, the cheekbones are broken,

original: 'di rnams ni gso ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni gso ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: these should be abandoned as curable.

original: gzhan yang mgo'i rus pa bye zhing mi 'byor ba dang phrad pa'i rus pa dum bur song ba dang / mur 'gram dang spyi gtsug slad de chag pa dang / yang na rus pa chag pa de legs par ma bcings pa dang / bcings kyang bar du bskul bskyod kyis grugs pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang mgo'i rus pa bye zhing mi 'byor ba dang phrad pa'i rus pa dum bur song ba dang / mur 'gram dang spyi gtsug slad de chag pa dang / yang na rus pa chag pa de legs par ma bcings pa dang / bcings kyang bar du bskul bskyod kyis grugs pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, if the bones of the head are separated and do not fit together, the bones of the forehead become fragmented, the temples and crown protrude and break, or if the broken bones are not properly bound, or even if bound, are shaken in the middle and become loose,

original: yang na lam du 'gro zhing bskyod drags pas grugs pa dang / gso ba log pa byas pa rnams kyang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na lam du 'gro zhing bskyod drags pas grugs pa dang / gso ba log pa byas pa rnams kyang spang bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should avoid those who have been injured by walking or moving too much, or by improper treatment.

original: gang yan lag la sogs pa gcus pa'am /
analyzed: gang yan lag la sogs pa gcus pa'am /
translated: If a limb or other part is twisted or pulled,

original: drangs pas yan lag gi rus pa phra mo chag gam /
analyzed: drangs pas yan lag gi rus pa phra mo chag gam /
translated: a small bone in the limb may be broken,

original: yang na tshigs byung ngam /🔽rus pa snyi ba chag gam /🔽yang na rus pa sbubs can chag gam /
analyzed: yang na tshigs byung ngam / rus pa snyi ba chag gam / yang na rus pa sbubs can chag gam /
translated: or a joint may come apart,🔽or a soft bone may be broken,🔽or a hollow bone may be broken,

original: yang na klang pa zhom pa 'am /
analyzed: yang na klang pa zhom pa 'am /
translated: or a bone may be fractured,

original: de las gzhan pa'i rus pa chag ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rus pa chag ste /
translated: or any other bone may be broken.

original: chag 'phro mthon dman du song na /
analyzed: chag 'phro mthon dman du song na /
translated: If the fracture is uneven,

original: gang mtho ba mnan cing dma' ba bteg ste /
analyzed: gang mtho ba mnan cing dma' ba bteg ste /
translated: press down on the higher part and raise the lower part,

original: drang por legs par gzhug go //
analyzed: drang por legs par gzhug go //
translated: and straighten it well.

original: phrag pa'i rus pa chag ste /
analyzed: phrag pa'i rus pa chag ste /
translated: If a shoulder bone is broken,🔽raise the lower part, which has become very low, and insert it.

original: chag 'phro shin tu dma' bar gyur pa las dma' ba yar bteg ste bcug @372b la pags pa sar pas dam du bcing bar bya ba'i cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: chag 'phro shin tu dma' bar gyur pa las dma' ba yar bteg ste bcug @372b la pags pa sar pas dam du bcing bar bya ba'i cho ga bya'o //
translated: The procedure is to tightly bind it with fresh skin.

original: lus kyi tshigs 'gul ba dang / mi 'gul ba thams cad rig par chag gam /
analyzed: lus kyi tshigs 'gul ba dang / mi 'gul ba thams cad rig par chag gam /
translated: All the joints of the body, whether moving or not, should be examined for fractures.

original: byung na yang cho ga de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: byung na yang cho ga de ltar bya'o //
translated: If it does occur, one should perform the rite in that way.

original: gzhan yang rkang lag gi rus pa la sogs pa chag pa gang yang rung ba de dag kyang ci nas legs par bcug la mi 'gul ba'i thabs su bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rkang lag gi rus pa la sogs pa chag pa gang yang rung ba de dag kyang ci nas legs par bcug la mi 'gul ba'i thabs su bya ste /
translated: Moreover, any broken bone of the hand, foot, etc., should be properly set, and a method for immobility should be employed.

original: ras mar mang bo bskus pas dkris la bcings te /
analyzed: ras mar mang bo bskus pas dkris la bcings te /
translated: Having wrapped it with a cloth soaked in ghee, it should be bound.

original: ka dam pa dang / au dumb'a ra dang / aa shvadtha dang / s'a la'i shing dang / aa rdzu na'i shing dang / rgya skyegs kyi shing dang / smyug ma dang / 'od ma dang / de rnams gang yang rung ba'i shun pa dang /
analyzed: ka dam pa dang / au dumb'a ra dang / aa shvadtha dang / s'a la'i shing dang / aa rdzu na'i shing dang / rgya skyegs kyi shing dang / smyug ma dang / 'od ma dang / de rnams gang yang rung ba'i shun pa dang /
translated: The bark of any of these trees—kadamba, udumbara, aśvattha, sāl, arjuna, lac, bamboo, or reed—

original: gshag ma'i byang bu zhing che zhing srab la 'jam pas dbang du byas la bsdams te ku sha'i srad bus bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: gshag ma'i byang bu zhing che zhing srab la 'jam pas dbang du byas la bsdams te ku sha'i srad bus bcing bar bya'o //
translated: should be used to make a splint that is large, thin, and smooth. Having controlled it, it should be bound with a string of kuśa grass.

original: gal te lhod par bcings na ni 'byor ba bye zhing chag pa brten par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lhod par bcings na ni 'byor ba bye zhing chag pa brten par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is bound too loosely, the fracture will separate and not heal.

original: bcing ba bsdam drags na ni shin tu na zhing zug gzer dang ; tsha zhing khol ba dang / skrang bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcing ba bsdam drags na ni shin tu na zhing zug gzer dang ; tsha zhing khol ba dang / skrang bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If the bandage is too tight, it will cause severe pain, burning, swelling, and inflammation.

original: bcings pa de tsha ba'i dus na ni zhag gsum gsum zhing lan re bkrol lo //
analyzed: bcings pa de tsha ba'i dus na ni zhag gsum gsum zhing lan re bkrol lo //
translated: The bandage should be loosened once every three days during the hot season.

original: grang ba'i dus na ni zhag bdun bdun zhing bkrol lo //
analyzed: grang ba'i dus na ni zhag bdun bdun zhing bkrol lo //
translated: During the cold season, it should be loosened once every seven days.

original: dro grang mnyam pa'i dus na ni lnga lnga zhing bkrol lo //
analyzed: dro grang mnyam pa'i dus na ni lnga lnga zhing bkrol lo //
translated: During the moderate season, it should be loosened once every five days.🔽The frequency of loosening should be adjusted according to the severity of the fracture and the patient’s strength.

original: yang chag grugs kyi nad gzhi dang ; stobs che chung dang sbyar la ci rigs par gyis shig / bkrol ba'i bar skabs kun tu n+ya gro dha la sogs pa bskol ba'i khu ba bsgrangs pas bkru zhing blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang chag grugs kyi nad gzhi dang ; stobs che chung dang sbyar la ci rigs par gyis shig / bkrol ba'i bar skabs kun tu n+ya gro dha la sogs pa bskol ba'i khu ba bsgrangs pas bkru zhing blugs par bya'o //
translated: In between loosening, the wound should be washed and irrigated with boiled water from boiled herbs such as nyagrodha.

original: gal te zug gzer dang bcas pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te zug gzer dang bcas pa yin na ni /
translated: If there is pain,

original: rtsa ba chen po lnga bskol pas bkru'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba chen po lnga bskol pas bkru'o //
translated: the wound should be washed with boiled water from the five great roots.

original: de bzhin du sman pas yul dang dus kyi bye brag shes par byas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sman pas yul dang dus kyi bye brag shes par byas nas /
translated: Similarly, the physician should know the specificities of place and time.

original: tsakra mar da'i mar rlung 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i lde gu dro 'jam tsam gyis bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: tsakra mar da'i mar rlung 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i lde gu dro 'jam tsam gyis bsku bar bya'o //
translated: Apply a paste of cakra, marada, and wind-subduing medicine, just warm and soft, to the affected area.

original: gzhan yang shin tu bsil ba'i byug pa dang / blugs pa yang rgyun du bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang shin tu bsil ba'i byug pa dang / blugs pa yang rgyun du bya'o //
translated: Also, apply very cool ointments and pourings regularly.

original: ba'i 'o ma dang mar dang sman mngar ba dang sbyar ba bskol brgya skyegs dang bcas pa grang mo nang re bzhin blud do //
analyzed: ba'i 'o ma dang mar dang sman mngar ba dang sbyar ba bskol brgya skyegs dang bcas pa grang mo nang re bzhin blud do //
translated: Boil cow's milk, butter, and sweet medicine, strain it, and let it cool. Give it to drink every day.

original: chag grugs rma dang bcas pa 'byung ba la ni sbrang rtsi dang mar shas cher sbyar bas bsku'o //
analyzed: chag grugs rma dang bcas pa 'byung ba la ni sbrang rtsi dang mar shas cher sbyar bas bsku'o //
translated: For cracks and sores, apply a mixture of mostly honey and butter.

original: gzhan yang skrangs pa gso ba'i cho ga las 'byung ba bzhin du sman bskol ba'i khu ba blugs pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang skrangs pa gso ba'i cho ga las 'byung ba bzhin du sman bskol ba'i khu ba blugs pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Also, do the pouring of boiled medicine and so forth according to the procedure for curing swelling.

original: @373a * // rma kha las sha'i dum bu 'phyang ba lta na ni sbrang rtsi mar dang sbyar bas bskus la slar sbyar te legs par bcing ngo //
analyzed: @373a * // rma kha las sha'i dum bu 'phyang ba lta na ni sbrang rtsi mar dang sbyar bas bskus la slar sbyar te legs par bcing ngo //
translated: If a piece of flesh hangs from the mouth of the wound, apply a mixture of honey and butter, reattach it, and bind it well.

original: de ltar bcings nas sha 'phyang ba de legs par sbyar ba 'dra na bri yang ku dang / seng phrom dkar po dang / kad phal dang / btsod dang / da ta ki dang ; 'di rnams kyi phye mas gdab pa 'am /
analyzed: de ltar bcings nas sha 'phyang ba de legs par sbyar ba 'dra na bri yang ku dang / seng phrom dkar po dang / kad phal dang / btsod dang / da ta ki dang ; 'di rnams kyi phye mas gdab pa 'am /
translated: bṛhatī, white sengphrom, kadamba, vermilion, and dāḍima.

original: yang na da ta ki dang / seng phrom gyi phye mas rma kha la btab na myur du rma 'drub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na da ta ki dang / seng phrom gyi phye mas rma kha la btab na myur du rma 'drub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Alternatively, if the wound is covered with a paste of dāḍima and sengphrom, it will heal quickly.

original: de dag ni chag grugs kyi gso ba rim par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni chag grugs kyi gso ba rim par bstan pa yin te /
translated: These are the stages of treatment for fractures.

original: lus kyi khams nyams pa dang / dgun gyi dus dang / nyams stobs dang ; lus shas che ba dang / nad gzhi chung ba rnams kyi rma ni gso sla ba yin te /🔽gzhan du ni gso bka' ba yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi khams nyams pa dang / dgun gyi dus dang / nyams stobs dang ; lus shas che ba dang / nad gzhi chung ba rnams kyi rma ni gso sla ba yin te / gzhan du ni gso bka' ba yin te /
translated: Wounds of those whose bodily elements are weak, in winter, with little strength, and with a large body, and with a small illness are easy to heal.

original: gzhan du ni dka' ba yin par bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan du ni dka' ba yin par bshad do //
translated: Otherwise, they are said to be difficult to heal.

original: de la thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma'i bar dus 'o ma yang dang po nas rim par myur du bskyed de /
analyzed: de la thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma'i bar dus 'o ma yang dang po nas rim par myur du bskyed de /
translated: In that case, milk should be gradually increased from the beginning until the end.

original: blugs pa la sogs pa cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du byas na /
analyzed: blugs pa la sogs pa cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du byas na /
translated: If one performs the ritual of pouring [medicines] in the proper way,

original: rim gyis rma kha brtan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rim gyis rma kha brtan par 'gyur te /

original: tshigs byung ba dang / rus pa chag pa yang slar 'byor par byed do //
analyzed: tshigs byung ba dang / rus pa chag pa yang slar 'byor par byed do //

original: rked pa dang / brla dang / rje ngar gang yang rung ba chag na /
analyzed: rked pa dang / brla dang / rje ngar gang yang rung ba chag na /

analyzed: de la ni lus mi 'gyur ba'i cho ga bya ste /

original: nyal khri spang leb la gzer bu lnga btab ste /
analyzed: nyal khri spang leb la gzer bu lnga btab ste /

original: de yang byin pa g-yas g-yon gnyis nas gzer re re dang / brla ngos gnyis nas re re dang / rkang pa'i mthil drang nas gcig ste /
analyzed: de yang byin pa g-yas g-yon gnyis nas gzer re re dang / brla ngos gnyis nas re re dang / rkang pa'i mthil drang nas gcig ste /
translated: That is, one should nail down the two sides of the heel, one on each side, and one on the sole of the foot,

original: de ltar gzer lnga'i bar du mi 'gul bar bzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar gzer lnga'i bar du mi 'gul bar bzhag go //
translated: and in that way one should remain without moving until the five nails have been put in.

original: sta zur dang / sgal tshigs dang / gdong pa gang yang rung ba'i tshigs byung ngam chag na bkrol ba la sogs pa'i cho ga gong ma bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: sta zur dang / sgal tshigs dang / gdong pa gang yang rung ba'i tshigs byung ngam chag na bkrol ba la sogs pa'i cho ga gong ma bzhin du bya'o //
translated: If a joint has come apart or been broken in the shoulder, the spine, or the face, one should perform the ritual of releasing [the joint] and so forth as before.

original: gal te yun ring po nas bkrol ba la sogs pa zhig yin na ni snum dang dugs la sogs pas 'jam po byas te gzod bkrol lo //
analyzed: gal te yun ring po nas bkrol ba la sogs pa zhig yin na ni snum dang dugs la sogs pas 'jam po byas te gzod bkrol lo //
translated: If the fracture has been set for a long time, then it should be first softened with oil massage and poultice, and then set.

original: bkrol ba'i 'og tu gal te chag 'phro ma zhugs sam grugs pa ltar na yang gong ma bzhin du'am sman pa'i blos ci rigs par yang legs par brtag ste gzhug go //🔽sngar rus pa chag cing shas cher na ba dang bcas pa de legs par 'drub par 'gyur ba las phyis snad pa'am /🔽lhung ba la sogs pas yang chag par gyur na ni sngar ji ltar chag pa bzhin du @373b 'am /
analyzed: bkrol ba'i 'og tu gal te chag 'phro ma zhugs sam grugs pa ltar na yang gong ma bzhin du'am sman pa'i blos ci rigs par yang legs par brtag ste gzhug go // sngar rus pa chag cing shas cher na ba dang bcas pa de legs par 'drub par 'gyur ba las phyis snad pa'am / lhung ba la sogs pas yang chag par gyur na ni sngar ji ltar chag pa bzhin du @373b 'am /
translated: After setting, if the fracture has not been properly set or if it is found to be loose, then it should be reset as before or in any other suitable way as per the physician’s discretion.🔽If the fracture was previously set well but later becomes loose due to a fall or other injury, then it should be reset as before or in any other suitable way as per the physician’s discretion.

original: sman pa'i blos ci rigs par yang brtags te gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: sman pa'i blos ci rigs par yang brtags te gso bar bya'o //
translated: If the fracture was previously set well but later becomes loose due to a fall or other injury, then it should be reset as before or in any other suitable way as per the physician’s discretion.

original: de ltar chag grugs su gyur ba la ni sman pas ci nas rnags par mi 'gyur bar bsrungs te /
analyzed: de ltar chag grugs su gyur ba la ni sman pas ci nas rnags par mi 'gyur bar bsrungs te /
translated: Thus, the physician should protect the fracture from suppuration.

original: gal te rnags par gyur na ni sha dang rtsa dang rgyus pa dang 'di rnams la gnod pas 'drub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rnags par gyur na ni sha dang rtsa dang rgyus pa dang 'di rnams la gnod pas 'drub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it becomes putrid, it will not be able to heal the flesh, sinews, and bones, because it is harmful.

original: zhigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will cause them to rot.

original: gzhan yang rlung nad kyi cho ga'i nang du bshad pa'i snum gyi sbyor ba rnam pa bzhi po sna nas gtang ba dang / 'jam rtsi la sogs pa stobs bskyed pa'i phyir 'di la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rlung nad kyi cho ga'i nang du bshad pa'i snum gyi sbyor ba rnam pa bzhi po sna nas gtang ba dang / 'jam rtsi la sogs pa stobs bskyed pa'i phyir 'di la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the four types of oil preparations explained in the procedures for treating wind disorders should be used here, such as the nasal administration and the unctuous substances for strengthening.

original: de bzhin du kha zas kyang 'bras s'a lu dang / mar dang / sha khu dang / 'o ma la sogs pa dang / sran chung dang mungga la sogs pa bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dag tshod zin par chag grugs can la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha zas kyang 'bras s'a lu dang / mar dang / sha khu dang / 'o ma la sogs pa dang / sran chung dang mungga la sogs pa bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dag tshod zin par chag grugs can la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the diet should be rice, butter, meat soup, milk, and so on, and the cooling mung beans, lentils, and so on, in the right amount.

original: ci nas chag grugs 'byor bar byed pa'i bag bsten par byed do //
analyzed: ci nas chag grugs 'byor bar byed pa'i bag bsten par byed do //
translated: The food should be used to the extent that it helps heal the wounds.

original: chag grugs bye zhing mi 'byor ba'i rtags ni kha ba'i bag dang ; thal sman dang / skyur dang / nyal po dang / nyi ma dang / rtsol ba rnam gnyis brten par mi bya ste spang ngo //
analyzed: chag grugs bye zhing mi 'byor ba'i rtags ni kha ba'i bag dang ; thal sman dang / skyur dang / nyal po dang / nyi ma dang / rtsol ba rnam gnyis brten par mi bya ste spang ngo //
translated: The signs of the body being damaged, broken, and not fit are: snow, ashes, sour, sex, sun, and the two kinds of exertion should not be relied upon, that is, they should be abandoned.

original: de bzhin du kha zas rtsub pa rnams kyang spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha zas rtsub pa rnams kyang spang bar bya ste /
translated: Similarly, rough foods should also be abandoned.

original: mi bsngags so //
analyzed: mi bsngags so //
translated: They are not praised.

original: til nag po phub ma med pa ras kyi nang du thum por byas te dam du bcings nas chu'i nang du zhag bdun gyi bar du nub re sbangs nyin re bskams te /
analyzed: til nag po phub ma med pa ras kyi nang du thum por byas te dam du bcings nas chu'i nang du zhag bdun gyi bar du nub re sbangs nyin re bskams te /
translated: Black sesame seeds without husks should be wrapped in cloth, tightly bound, and soaked in water for seven days, drying each day.

original: de bzhin du 'o ma dang / shing mngar bskol ba'i khu ba dang re rer yang cho ga gong ma ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'o ma dang / shing mngar bskol ba'i khu ba dang re rer yang cho ga gong ma ltar bya ste /
translated: In the same way, milk, and the juice boiled with sweet wood should be done one by one, as in the previous ritual.

original: de nas zhag bdun gyi bar du 'o ma la sogs pa'i nang du spangs shing bskams te khu ba zhen pa dang / til nag po rdul med pa btags pa'i phye ma dang / spang spos dang / ba la ka dang / btsod dang / chu srin sen mo dang /
analyzed: de nas zhag bdun gyi bar du 'o ma la sogs pa'i nang du spangs shing bskams te khu ba zhen pa dang / til nag po rdul med pa btags pa'i phye ma dang / spang spos dang / ba la ka dang / btsod dang / chu srin sen mo dang /
translated: Then, for seven days, it is discarded in milk and so forth, dried, and the liquid is collected. It is mixed with a powder made from black sesame seeds without husks, with spikenard, with red sandalwood, with crocodile excrement,

original: shu ti dang / gla ba dang / ru rta dang / ba bla rnam gsum dang / aa ka ru dang / tsandan dang / gur gum dang / thal tres dang / ko nyon rtse'i thang chu dang / sra rtsi pog dang / thang shing dang /
analyzed: shu ti dang / gla ba dang / ru rta dang / ba bla rnam gsum dang / aa ka ru dang / tsandan dang / gur gum dang / thal tres dang / ko nyon rtse'i thang chu dang / sra rtsi pog dang / thang shing dang /

analyzed: sman shug pa'i sde tshan la sogs pa dang / dri zhim po'i sbyor ba de dag btags pa'i phye ma 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te /
translated: with the group of medicinal plants such as juniper, and so forth, and with a preparation of sweet-smelling substances. That powder is boiled together with milk.

original: btsir ba'i 'bru mar 'byung ba dang / de'i nang du rdo dreg dang / ra sna dang / sa la parni dang / ka shar ka dang / @374a * //
analyzed: btsir ba'i 'bru mar 'byung ba dang / de'i nang du rdo dreg dang / ra sna dang / sa la parni dang / ka shar ka dang / @374a * //
translated: When the oil that comes from pressing it arises, it is mixed with the juice of a stone, with the juice of a goat's horn, with the juice of a peacock feather, with the juice of a parrot's feather,🔽and with the juice of a mynah bird's feather.

original: gandha pri yang ku dang / rgya spos dang / gandha bha dra dang / seng phrom dang / kshi ra bi da ri dang / rtsa d'ur ba dang / gong gi spang spos la sogs pa'i phye ma dang lhan cig tshul bzhin bskol ba ni 'bru mar dri zhim po'i mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: gandha pri yang ku dang / rgya spos dang / gandha bha dra dang / seng phrom dang / kshi ra bi da ri dang / rtsa d'ur ba dang / gong gi spang spos la sogs pa'i phye ma dang lhan cig tshul bzhin bskol ba ni 'bru mar dri zhim po'i mchog ces bya ste /
translated: together with the powders of the above-mentioned incense, properly boiled, is called the supreme fragrant oil.

analyzed: de las ran par spyad na ni myur du nad med cing rus pa brtan par byed do //
translated: If used in moderation, it quickly brings about good health and strengthens the bones.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad shas che ba yang 'bru mar gyi sbyor ba 'di bsten na myur du zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad shas che ba yang 'bru mar gyi sbyor ba 'di bsten na myur du zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those with a predominance of diseases caused by wind and bile will quickly be pacified if they rely on this oil preparation.

original: rgyud phyi ma mchog grub pa'i gnas las chag grugs gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa bdun pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma mchog grub pa'i gnas las chag grugs gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa bdun pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the twenty-seventh chapter on healing fractures from the chapter on healing fractures in the Continuation of the Continuation of the Secret Assembly Tantra.

analyzed: // / de nas mtshan bar rdol ba'i nad dmigs bstan cing nad gso pa'i cho ga'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the chapter on the ritual for curing diseases that are revealed in dreams.

original: de la mtshan bar rdol ba'i nad rgyu ni glang po che dang rta la rgyun tu zhon pa dang / mal mkhrang ba la nyal ba dang / tsog tsog por 'dug pa dang / gzhan yang gzhang 'brum gyi nad gzhir bstan par bsten pa dang /

translated: The ripening of the wound by incompatible food, or the ripening of the wound that suddenly occurs, or the fault of frequently criticizing the holy ones, mostly causes a boil to appear one or two finger-widths to the left of the anus.

analyzed: de rdol bar byed pa las nang ngam phyi rol du rma 'byung ste /

original: sha dang khrag ma rung bar byas te rul bar byed do //
analyzed: sha dang khrag ma rung bar byas te rul bar byed do //
translated: It spoils the flesh and blood and causes them to rot.

original: de nas rma de chu so dang / gcin gyi gnas su 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas rma de chu so dang / gcin gyi gnas su 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Then that wound goes to the urinary tract and the place of urine.

original: 'dzag pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: 'dzag pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
translated: It has the nature of leaking.

original: de gso ba log par byas na ni mtshan bar rdol ba'i rma de mched par byed do //
analyzed: de gso ba log par byas na ni mtshan bar rdol ba'i rma de mched par byed do //
translated: If it is treated incorrectly, the wound of the vulva will spread.

original: de yang mo mtshan dang / chu so dang / gzhang dang / de rnams su cher mched cing rgyas la rma skyed pa'i nang nas rlung dang gcin dang phyi sa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang mo mtshan dang / chu so dang / gzhang dang / de rnams su cher mched cing rgyas la rma skyed pa'i nang nas rlung dang gcin dang phyi sa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it spreads and expands in the vagina, the urethra, and the anus, and among the wounds that produce pus, urine, and feces, it is the worst.

analyzed: de yang nad gzhi re rer gyur pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dus pa dang / glo bur du byung ba dang / rnam pa brgyad du bshad par bya'o //
translated: It should be explained that it has eight types: individual, combined, acute, chronic, and four types of wounds.

original: de smin pa'i mtshan bar rdol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de smin pa'i mtshan bar rdol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called the “wound of the vulva that has ripened.”

original: de yang nad kyi rtsa ba mi mngon pa dang / tshabs cher na ba dang / rma mi 'drub cing 'khrugs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: de yang nad kyi rtsa ba mi mngon pa dang / tshabs cher na ba dang / rma mi 'drub cing 'khrugs pa rnams yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the root of disease, it is very serious, and it is a wound that does not heal and is disturbed.

original: gzhan du na ni phol mig nyi tshe yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni phol mig nyi tshe yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it is a simple carbuncle.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i phol mig gi mtshan ma ni @374b mdog sngo nag tu 'gyur ba dang / na zhing zug pa dang / 'phar ba dang / nad dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i phol mig gi mtshan ma ni @374b mdog sngo nag tu 'gyur ba dang / na zhing zug pa dang / 'phar ba dang / nad dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The signs of a boil that is due to wind are that it is black, painful, throbbing, and has a disease.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rtags ni rnga mo'i mgrin pa bzhin du mtho ba dang / mdog dmar ba dang / tsha ba che ba dang / rims kyis 'debs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rtags ni rnga mo'i mgrin pa bzhin du mtho ba dang / mdog dmar ba dang / tsha ba che ba dang / rims kyis 'debs pa rnams yin no //
translated: The signs of one that is due to bile are that it is raised like a camel’s neck, red, very hot, and has a fever.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i phol mig gi mtshan ma ni brtan pa dang / snum pa dang / nad kyi rtsa ba 'phros pa dang / mdog skya ba dang / g-ya' ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i phol mig gi mtshan ma ni brtan pa dang / snum pa dang / nad kyi rtsa ba 'phros pa dang / mdog skya ba dang / g-ya' ba rnams yin no //
translated: The signs of a boil that is due to phlegm are that it is stable, oily, has a spread of disease, is pale, and itches.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i mtshan ma ni mdog nag pa dang / dmar ba dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug ba dang / mi bzod par na ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i mtshan ma ni mdog nag pa dang / dmar ba dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug ba dang / mi bzod par na ba rnams yin no //
translated: The signs of a boil that is due to wind and bile are that it is black, red, hot, and very painful.

original: bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i phol mig gi mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i phol mig gi mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of a boil that is due to phlegm and wind are that it is

original: cung zad dkar zhing cung zad gnag pa yin no //
analyzed: cung zad dkar zhing cung zad gnag pa yin no //
translated: It is slightly white and slightly black.

original: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i phol mig gi mtshan ma ni rkang pa'i mthe bong dang mnyam pa'i phol mig byung zhing zug gzer che ba dang / kha zas yi gar mi 'ong ba dang / skom dad che ba dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i phol mig gi mtshan ma ni rkang pa'i mthe bong dang mnyam pa'i phol mig byung zhing zug gzer che ba dang / kha zas yi gar mi 'ong ba dang / skom dad che ba dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang /
translated: The signs of a boil that arises from a combination of humors are: a boil the size of the big toe that has arisen and is very painful, distaste for food, great thirst, a burning sensation,

original: rims kyis 'deb pa dang / slon pa la sogs pa nad sna tshogs kyis gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: rims kyis 'deb pa dang / slon pa la sogs pa nad sna tshogs kyis gnod pa yin no //
translated: being afflicted by various illnesses such as fever, vomiting, and so on.

original: rlung las gyur pa'i phol mig gso ba ma byas te smin na ni rma kha mang du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rlung las gyur pa'i phol mig gso ba ma byas te smin na ni rma kha mang du 'byung ba ste /
translated: If a boil that arises from wind is not treated and ripens, many wounds will appear.

original: de yang ji ltar bug brgya pa'i tshags ma las chu 'jag pa bzhin du rma kha de las kyang 'dzag pa dang / lbu ba dang bcas par rgyun du 'dzag pa de rma kha brgya pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar bug brgya pa'i tshags ma las chu 'jag pa bzhin du rma kha de las kyang 'dzag pa dang / lbu ba dang bcas par rgyun du 'dzag pa de rma kha brgya pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, like water flowing from a hundred holes in a dam, pus and froth will constantly flow from those wounds. That is called a hundred-wound boil.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad kyang rlung dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad kyang rlung dang 'dra ste /
translated: A boil that arises from bile is also similar to wind.

original: de ni rnga mo'i mgrin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rnga mo'i mgrin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called a camel's neck.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i nad ni 'dzag pa spyi dang skabs mang du 'byung ste /
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i nad ni 'dzag pa spyi dang skabs mang du 'byung ste /
translated: Diseases arising from phlegm are generally and often found to ooze.

original: de ni kun tu 'dzag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni kun tu 'dzag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “general oozing.”

original: rlung dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad kyis bshang sgo'i phyi rol du khyab cing mched de 'khor ba ltar 'dug pa de ni pa ri ksha pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad kyis bshang sgo'i phyi rol du khyab cing mched de 'khor ba ltar 'dug pa de ni pa ri ksha pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Diseases arising from wind and bile spread and spread outside the anus, as if in a circle. This is called “pariśa.”

original: rlung dang bad kan las gyur pa'i nad gzhang la brten te drang por 'byung ba de ni mtshan bar rdol gyi nad drang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rlung dang bad kan las gyur pa'i nad gzhang la brten te drang por 'byung ba de ni mtshan bar rdol gyi nad drang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Diseases arising from wind and phlegm are based in the anus and come out straight. This is called “straight anal fistula.”

original: bad kan dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad thog mar gzhang 'brum gyi gnas su byung zhing de la brten te 'khrugs nas gzhang 'brum gyi rtsa bar g-ya' ba dang / skrang ba dang / tsha ba dang / gzhang 'brum gyi rtsa pa der @375a * //

translated: Diseases arising from phlegm and bile first occur in the hemorrhoid area and, based on that, become agitated, causing itching, swelling, heat, and pain in the hemorrhoid roots.

original: myur du smin te rdol cing rnags pas rgyun du 'dzag pa de ni gzhang 'brum gyi mtshan bar rdol pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: myur du smin te rdol cing rnags pas rgyun du 'dzag pa de ni gzhang 'brum gyi mtshan bar rdol pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It quickly matures, bursts open, and constantly oozes pus. This is called the “bursting anal fistula.”

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i thor bu'i mtshan ma ni nad med pa dang / sra ba dang / reg na grang ba dang / mdog dkar ba dang g-ya' ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i thor bu'i mtshan ma ni nad med pa dang / sra ba dang / reg na grang ba dang / mdog dkar ba dang g-ya' ba rnams yin no //
translated: The signs of a boil that arises from phlegm are: it is not painful, it is hard, it is cold to the touch, it is white in color, and it itches.

original: gal te smin na ni rnag ska ba 'dzag pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te smin na ni rnag ska ba 'dzag pa yin no //
translated: If it ripens, it oozes thick pus.

original: nad gzhi khrag dang 'dres pa'i thor bu ni srin bu dang bcas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: nad gzhi khrag dang 'dres pa'i thor bu ni srin bu dang bcas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: A boil that arises from a mixture of blood and humors appears with worms.

original: sha dang rtsa 'dres pa las byung ba'i thor bu ni tshor ba med cing bem bem por 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: sha dang rtsa 'dres pa las byung ba'i thor bu ni tshor ba med cing bem bem por 'dug pa ste /
translated: A boil that arises from a mixture of flesh and veins is without feeling and is soft.

original: mtshan ma gzhan ni mkhris pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma gzhan ni mkhris pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The other signs are like those of bile.

original: sha skyes pa'i zas bsten pas sha rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha skyes pa'i zas bsten pas sha rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By relying on food that produces flesh, the flesh becomes healthy.

original: thor bu 'byung zhing de yang snum pa dang / @377a * //
analyzed: thor bu 'byung zhing de yang snum pa dang / @377a * //
translated: A boil appears, and it is oily,

original: che ba dang / sra ba dang / rtsa'i dra bas khyab par snang ste /
analyzed: che ba dang / sra ba dang / rtsa'i dra bas khyab par snang ste /
translated: large, hard, and covered with a network of veins.

original: mtshan ma lhag pa ni bad kan dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma lhag pa ni bad kan dang 'dra'o //
translated: The other signs are like those of phlegm.

original: tshil skye ba'i zas bsten pas tshil zabs cher skyes nas rlung gis sha dang pags par tshil drangs te thor bur gyur pa ni shin tu snum pa dang 'jam pa dang rtsa brtan pa yin te rtags lhag ma ni bad kan gyi thor bu dang 'dra ste ldang
analyzed: tshil skye ba'i zas bsten pas tshil zabs cher skyes nas rlung gis sha dang pags par tshil drangs te thor bur gyur pa ni shin tu snum pa dang 'jam pa dang rtsa brtan pa yin te rtags lhag ma ni bad kan gyi thor bu dang 'dra ste ldang
translated: By relying on food that produces fat, the fat increases greatly. Wind draws the fat into the flesh and skin, and it becomes a boil. It is very oily, smooth and firm. The remaining signs are like the boils of phlegm.

original: dub kyang byed do //
analyzed: dub kyang byed do //
translated: It also occurs in those who are exhausted.

original: de gal te rdol na ni tshil mthug po dmar ba dang dkar ba dag 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de gal te rdol na ni tshil mthug po dmar ba dang dkar ba dag 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If it bursts, then thick red or white fat comes out.

original: rus pa chag gam nad pa la thor bur gyur pa ni shin tu mtho ba 'am /
analyzed: rus pa chag gam nad pa la thor bur gyur pa ni shin tu mtho ba 'am /
translated: If a bone is broken or a boil occurs in a sick person, it occurs very high or

original: yang na dma' ba 'byung ste de yang rkang ba ma la sogs par byung ste /
analyzed: yang na dma' ba 'byung ste de yang rkang ba ma la sogs par byung ste /
translated: low. It also occurs in the feet and so on.

original: de yang chu la sogs par bab chol du song ba las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang chu la sogs par bab chol du song ba las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It also occurs from falling into water and so on.

original: rtsol ba drags pas rtsa dang khrag 'khrugs shing rlung gis rtsa 'khums te yo ba dang skem pa dang / mi 'phar ba dang / nad nyung zhing mdud pa'i thor bur 'gyur te de ni rtsa'i thor bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba drags pas rtsa dang khrag 'khrugs shing rlung gis rtsa 'khums te yo ba dang skem pa dang / mi 'phar ba dang / nad nyung zhing mdud pa'i thor bur 'gyur te de ni rtsa'i thor bu zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the scattered channels.

original: rma 'drub kyang rung /
analyzed: rma 'drub kyang rung /
translated: Whether the wound is healed or not,

original: ma 'drub kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ma 'drub kyang rung ste /
translated: whether it is healed or not,

original: ro kun dang ldan pa'i zas bsten pa dang / rma la ras ma mthug pos dkris pa 'am /
analyzed: ro kun dang ldan pa'i zas bsten pa dang / rma la ras ma mthug pos dkris pa 'am /
translated: one should rely on food that has all the tastes, and wrap the wound with a thick cloth,

original: yang na ma dkris par gzhag pa 'am /
analyzed: yang na ma dkris par gzhag pa 'am /
translated: or else leave it unwrapped.

original: lus kyi rma la rdo la sogs pas phog pa dang / rlung nad la khrag shas cher phyung ba 'am /
analyzed: lus kyi rma la rdo la sogs pas phog pa dang / rlung nad la khrag shas cher phyung ba 'am /
translated: The wound on the body is struck by stones and so forth, or blood is drawn excessively for a wind disorder,🔽or else it is not drawn.

original: yang na ma phyung ba yang rung rlung 'khrugs te rma'i kha zlum por 'gyur zhing rma skams pa dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang g-ya' ba rnams yin te de ni rma'i thor bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ma phyung ba yang rung rlung 'khrugs te rma'i kha zlum por 'gyur zhing rma skams pa dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang g-ya' ba rnams yin te de ni rma'i thor bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The wind is disturbed, the mouth of the wound becomes round, the wound dries up, and there is a burning sensation and itching. This is called the scattered wounds.

original: de la gsor rung ba'i 'brum bu'i nad gzhi gsum dang / khrag dang tshil las gyur pa la ni /
analyzed: de la gsor rung ba'i 'brum bu'i nad gzhi gsum dang / khrag dang tshil las gyur pa la ni /
translated: Those arising from blood and fat

original: mgul bar rgyu ba sbom po dang / gnad dang mgul pa dang / lto ba rnams su 'brum bu che zhing zum ste /
analyzed: mgul bar rgyu ba sbom po dang / gnad dang mgul pa dang / lto ba rnams su 'brum bu che zhing zum ste /
translated: are large and deep pustules in the throat, vital points, neck, and abdomen.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni nang na tshil nad gzhi rnams dang lhan cig 'khrugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni nang na tshil nad gzhi rnams dang lhan cig 'khrugs pa yin te /
translated: Their characteristics are that the blood and fat are disturbed together with the humors.

original: de yang bad kan dang tshil shas che zhing brtan pa dang smin mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang bad kan dang tshil shas che zhing brtan pa dang smin mi shes pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, they have a predominance of phlegm and fat, are stable, and do not ripen.

original: rtsa'i nang du khrag gnas pa de nad gzhi rnams kyis ma rung bar 'gyur te khrag tshos shing rgyas pas sha'i gong bur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa'i nang du khrag gnas pa de nad gzhi rnams kyis ma rung bar 'gyur te khrag tshos shing rgyas pas sha'i gong bur gyur pa yin no //
translated: The blood that resides in the channels becomes unsuitable due to the humors. As the blood coagulates and expands, it becomes a mass of flesh.

original: pags pa'i phyi rol du shu ba mang pos khyab cing shas cher skyes pa dang / rgyun du khrag ngan 'dzag pa de ni khrag gi 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pags pa'i phyi rol du shu ba mang pos khyab cing shas cher skyes pa dang / rgyun du khrag ngan 'dzag pa de ni khrag gi 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
translated: It is covered with many pustules on the surface of the skin, and it grows large. It constantly oozes bad blood. This is called blood smallpox.

original: 'brum bu de rnams las @377b khrag dang sha las gyur pa ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'brum bu de rnams las @377b khrag dang sha las gyur pa ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: Of these, the ones that are blood and flesh-based should be avoided.

original: lhag ma bzhi ni gsor rung ngo //🔽de la rkang bam gyi nad ni chu so dang / brla phrag gnyis kyi bar dang / brla la sogs pa lus kyi smad la brten te bad kan dang / sha dang / khrag gi nyes pa rim gyis yun ring po nas rkang pa 'dus te sbom par skrangs shing sra ba de ni rkang bam zhes bya'o //🔽de la rlung las gyur pa'i rkang bam gyi mtshan ma ni 'brum bu dang bcas shing mdog gnag la glo bur du na zhing rtsub pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma bzhi ni gsor rung ngo // de la rkang bam gyi nad ni chu so dang / brla phrag gnyis kyi bar dang / brla la sogs pa lus kyi smad la brten te bad kan dang / sha dang / khrag gi nyes pa rim gyis yun ring po nas rkang pa 'dus te sbom par skrangs shing sra ba de ni rkang bam zhes bya'o // de la rlung las gyur pa'i rkang bam gyi mtshan ma ni 'brum bu dang bcas shing mdog gnag la glo bur du na zhing rtsub pa yin no //
translated: The remaining four are curable.🔽Of these, the edema is based in the lower body, between the kidneys and the thighs, and so forth. Due to a gradual and long-term vitiation of phlegm, flesh, and blood, the legs swell up, become thick, and are hard. This is called edema.🔽The signs of a wind-based edema are that it is accompanied by blisters, is dark in color, and is suddenly painful and rough.

original: mkhris pa'i rkang bam gyi nad ni mdog ser ba dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / rims kyis 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rkang bam gyi nad ni mdog ser ba dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / rims kyis 'debs pa yin no //
translated: A bile-based edema is yellow in color, hot to the touch, and causes fever.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i rkang bam ni thi ba dang / snum pa dang / zug gzer chung ba dang shu bas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i rkang bam ni thi ba dang / snum pa dang / zug gzer chung ba dang shu bas khyab pa yin no //
translated: The one that arises from phlegm is like a pigeon, oily, with little pain, and covered with blisters.

original: rkang bam de tshabs che zhing mang du 'dzag pa la lo gcig las 'das pa de ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rkang bam de tshabs che zhing mang du 'dzag pa la lo gcig las 'das pa de ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: If the carbuncle is severe, with much discharge, and more than a year old, it should be abandoned.

original: slob dpon kha cig na re rkang pa la rkang bam ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin du lag pa dang / rna ba dang / mchu dang sna rnams kyi phyogs dang nye bar rkang bam gyi nad 'byung ngo zhes smra'o //
analyzed: slob dpon kha cig na re rkang pa la rkang bam ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin du lag pa dang / rna ba dang / mchu dang sna rnams kyi phyogs dang nye bar rkang bam gyi nad 'byung ngo zhes smra'o //
translated: Some masters say that just as carbuncles appear on the feet, so they appear on the hands, ears, lips, and nose.

original: de la 'brum chen zhes bya ba ni nad gzhi dang tshil 'khrugs te /
analyzed: de la 'brum chen zhes bya ba ni nad gzhi dang tshil 'khrugs te /
translated: Regarding that, the so-called large boils are a condition where the humors and fat are disturbed.

original: de mgul pa dang / rtse'u chung gnyis dang / mig dang / mchan khung dang / chu so dang brla brag rnams la brten te mdog nad gzhi rang gi mdog tu snang zhing sra ba dang / snum pa dang / bum sha dang / skyu ru ra'i tshad tsam 'byung zhing de'i nye 'khor du 'bras mang po 'byung la myur du mi smin pa dang smin na ni nad chung ba yin no //
analyzed: de mgul pa dang / rtse'u chung gnyis dang / mig dang / mchan khung dang / chu so dang brla brag rnams la brten te mdog nad gzhi rang gi mdog tu snang zhing sra ba dang / snum pa dang / bum sha dang / skyu ru ra'i tshad tsam 'byung zhing de'i nye 'khor du 'bras mang po 'byung la myur du mi smin pa dang smin na ni nad chung ba yin no //
translated: It is based on the neck, the two collar bones, the eyes, the armpits, the urinary tract, and the thighs. In brief, it appears in the color of the disease, is hard, oily, and the size of a jujube fruit. Many pustules appear around it, and it does not quickly ripen. If it does ripen, the disease is slight.

original: kha cig ni smin nas 'dzag par 'gyur /🔽kha cig ni zhig nas skye /
analyzed: kha cig ni smin nas 'dzag par 'gyur / kha cig ni zhig nas skye /
translated: Some ripen and ooze.🔽Some burst and heal.

original: kha cig ni yun ring du gnas kha cig ni rtsva d'ur ba bcad pa bzhin du 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni yun ring du gnas kha cig ni rtsva d'ur ba bcad pa bzhin du 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Some last a long time. Some grow like a cut reed.

original: de ni 'brum chen gyi nad 'bras kyi phreng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'brum chen gyi nad 'bras kyi phreng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the disease of large pustules, the “rosary of pustules.”

original: 'bras kyi phreng ba'i nad rims dang / skyug pa dang rtsib logs su zug pa dang / lud pa lu ba dang / sna chu 'dzag pa dang ldan na ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras kyi phreng ba'i nad rims dang / skyug pa dang rtsib logs su zug pa dang / lud pa lu ba dang / sna chu 'dzag pa dang ldan na ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: The “rosary of pustules” is to be abandoned if it is accompanied by fever, vomiting, pain in the sides, coughing, and a runny nose.

original: de la rma 'khyims pa'i nad ni rma skrangs pa smin nas ma rdol ba dang / rma la gnod pa rnams bstan pas sha la sogs pa'i nang du rnag gis gang zhing rjes su zhugs nas @378a * //
analyzed: de la rma 'khyims pa'i nad ni rma skrangs pa smin nas ma rdol ba dang / rma la gnod pa rnams bstan pas sha la sogs pa'i nang du rnag gis gang zhing rjes su zhugs nas @378a * //
translated: In this regard, the disease of sinus is a swelling of the wound that has ripened but not burst, and the pus fills inside the flesh, etc., and penetrates further by the teaching of the injuries to the wound.

original: phugs ring du 'gro ste sbu bu nas chu 'dzag pa bzhin du rnag 'dzag par 'gyur zhing rma'i phugs drang po gcig las byer te sna tshogs su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: phugs ring du 'gro ste sbu bu nas chu 'dzag pa bzhin du rnag 'dzag par 'gyur zhing rma'i phugs drang po gcig las byer te sna tshogs su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: It goes far into the depth, and like water leaking from a hole, the pus leaks out, and the depth of the wound is divided from the one straight depth and goes in various directions.

original: de la yang nad gzhi rnam pa gsum dang 'dus pa dang zug rngu ste rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang nad gzhi rnam pa gsum dang 'dus pa dang zug rngu ste rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it becomes five types: the three types of disease, combination, and pain.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i rma 'khyims pa ni rma kha chung zhing nad dang bcas pa dang / mdog 'gyur ba dang 'dzag pa lbu ba dang bcas par 'byung zhing nub mo lhag par 'dzag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i rma 'khyims pa ni rma kha chung zhing nad dang bcas pa dang / mdog 'gyur ba dang 'dzag pa lbu ba dang bcas par 'byung zhing nub mo lhag par 'dzag pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the sinus caused by wind is a small wound opening with disease, and the color changes and the pus leaks out with foam, and it especially leaks out at night.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma ni skom dang che ba dang / rims kyis 'deb pa dang / lus tsha bar gyur pa dang / mdog ser ba dang / rul ba'i dri bro ba dang / rnag bro ba 'byung ba dang / nyin par lhag par 'dzag pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma ni skom dang che ba dang / rims kyis 'deb pa dang / lus tsha bar gyur pa dang / mdog ser ba dang / rul ba'i dri bro ba dang / rnag bro ba 'byung ba dang / nyin par lhag par 'dzag pa rnams yin no //
translated: A wound caused by bile is thirsty, large, feverish, yellow, putrid, and discharges pus. It oozes more during the day.

original: bad kan las gyur pa ni 'dzag par sla ba dang / spyi bag tu 'dug pa dang / g-ya' ba dang / sra ba dang mtshan mo cher rnags pa yin no //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa ni 'dzag par sla ba dang / spyi bag tu 'dug pa dang / g-ya' ba dang / sra ba dang mtshan mo cher rnags pa yin no //
translated: A wound caused by phlegm is soft, slimy, itchy, hard, and oozes more at night.

original: 'dus pa las gyur pa ni kun gyi mtshan ma dang ldan pa yin te spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur pa ni kun gyi mtshan ma dang ldan pa yin te spang bar bya'o //
translated: A wound caused by a combination of humors has all the symptoms of the three humors. It should be avoided.

original: zug rngu zug pa'i rma 'khyims pa ni zug rngu nang nas yod pa ma phyung na rma phugs byer bar byed do //
analyzed: zug rngu zug pa'i rma 'khyims pa ni zug rngu nang nas yod pa ma phyung na rma phugs byer bar byed do //
translated: A wound with a splinter is a wound in which a splinter is lodged. If the splinter is not removed, the wound will not heal.

original: de nas rnag lbu ba dang bcas pa dang / sla ba dang / dang ba dang / dro ba dang / khrag dang bcas par 'byung bar 'gyur te rtag tu nad dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas rnag lbu ba dang bcas pa dang / sla ba dang / dang ba dang / dro ba dang / khrag dang bcas par 'byung bar 'gyur te rtag tu nad dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Then, pus with foam, soft, clear, warm, and mixed with blood will appear. It will always be accompanied by pain.

original: thor bu dang 'brum bu la sogs pa'i nad dmigs brtags pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa dgu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: thor bu dang 'brum bu la sogs pa'i nad dmigs brtags pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa dgu pa rdzogs so /
translated: This is the twenty-ninth chapter, the “Diagnosis of Epidemics, Boils, and So Forth.”🔽

original: // / de nas thor bu dang 'brum bu la sogs pa gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas thor bu dang 'brum bu la sogs pa gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: This concludes the twenty-ninth chapter, on the diagnosis of abscesses, boils, and so on, from The Quintessence Tantra, the Secret Oral Tradition of the Eight Branches of the Science of Healing.🔽Chapter XXX🔽The chapter on the treatment of abscesses, boils, and so on.

original: de la thor bu ma smin pa la ni rang rang gi nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du skrang ba'i cho ga rnams bya'o //
analyzed: de la thor bu ma smin pa la ni rang rang gi nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du skrang ba'i cho ga rnams bya'o //
translated: In the case of an unripened abscess, one should perform the swelling treatment according to the nature of the disease.

original: lus sbyang zhing dag par 'dod pas bri ha ti dang / tsi tra ka dang / kanda ka ri dang / pi pi ling rnams mar dang bskol ba'i mar gyis snum chos byas te /
analyzed: lus sbyang zhing dag par 'dod pas bri ha ti dang / tsi tra ka dang / kanda ka ri dang / pi pi ling rnams mar dang bskol ba'i mar gyis snum chos byas te /
translated: One who wishes to purify and cleanse the body should perform an oil treatment with clarified butter boiled with brihati, citraka, kandakari, and pippali.

original: de'i 'og tu rno ba'i sman gyis slon khrus dang byug pa rnams sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rno ba'i sman gyis slon khrus dang byug pa rnams sbyar ro //
translated: Thereafter, one should apply a strong medicine, a decoction, and an ointment.

original: thor bu la dugs mang du bya zhing yang dang yang mnye bar bya'o //
analyzed: thor bu la dugs mang du bya zhing yang dang yang mnye bar bya'o //
translated: In the case of an abscess, one should perform a hot compress many times and massage again and again.

original: de dag ni khyad par du rlung gi gso ba bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni khyad par du rlung gi gso ba bstan pa yin te /
translated: These are the special treatments for wind disorders.

original: mkhris pa'i khrag las gyur pa la yang srin bu pad pas khrag dbyung ba dang bsil ba'i cho ga mang du bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i khrag las gyur pa la yang srin bu pad pas khrag dbyung ba dang bsil ba'i cho ga mang du bya'o //
translated: For blood disorders due to bile, bloodletting with leeches and many cooling rituals should be performed.

original: bad kan las gyur pa la ni rlung gi cho ga ltar bya'o //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa la ni rlung gi cho ga ltar bya'o //
translated: For those caused by phlegm, the wind rituals should be performed.

original: @378b da lta mod kyis ma smin pa la ni mtshon gyis bcad de khrag dbyung na ni mes bsreg go //
analyzed: @378b da lta mod kyis ma smin pa la ni mtshon gyis bcad de khrag dbyung na ni mes bsreg go //
translated: If it is not ripe, it should be cut with a weapon immediately and bloodletting performed. If it is burnt, it should be cut with a weapon.

original: ma lus par bcad na ni legs pa yin la lhag ma lus par bcad na ni phyis ldang ste nges par rgyas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma lus par bcad na ni legs pa yin la lhag ma lus par bcad na ni phyis ldang ste nges par rgyas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is completely cut, it is good. If the remainder is left uncut, it will later rise up and definitely spread and increase.

original: mas gtang ba'i sman dang gtar ga yang bya'o //
analyzed: mas gtang ba'i sman dang gtar ga yang bya'o //
translated: Medicines and bloodletting should be given by the mother.

original: 'brum bu gso ba'i thor bu gso ba ji lta ba bzhin du nad gzhi dang sbyar te gso ba ma lus par byas na phan no //
analyzed: 'brum bu gso ba'i thor bu gso ba ji lta ba bzhin du nad gzhi dang sbyar te gso ba ma lus par byas na phan no //
translated: If all the treatments are applied according to the individual conditions of the disease, as in the treatment of smallpox, it will be beneficial.

original: sha dang rma las byung ba'i thor bu ni de bzhin du gsos na sos tsam du 'jog nus so //
analyzed: sha dang rma las byung ba'i thor bu ni de bzhin du gsos na sos tsam du 'jog nus so //
translated: If the abscesses arising from flesh and wounds are treated in the same way, it is possible to keep them just healed.

original: thor bu tshigs las byung pa la ni thong lcags la sogs pa'i lcags bsregs pas bsreg ste til gyi lde gus rma la bskus na phan no //
analyzed: thor bu tshigs las byung pa la ni thong lcags la sogs pa'i lcags bsregs pas bsreg ste til gyi lde gus rma la bskus na phan no //
translated: For those arising from the joints, burn them with heated iron such as a plowshare. If one applies sesame paste to the wound, it will help.

original: gos gnyis kyi dkris pa 'am /
analyzed: gos gnyis kyi dkris pa 'am /
translated: Wrap the wound with two pieces of cloth.

original: yang na mtshon gyis dral la tshigs phyung ste rma bsreg go //
analyzed: yang na mtshon gyis dral la tshigs phyung ste rma bsreg go //
translated: Or, cut it with a knife, remove the joint, and cauterize the wound.

original: rtsa las skyes pa'i thor bu gsar pa la ni sa ha ra dza'i 'bru mar blud de de bzhin du rlung 'joms pa'i sman dang dugs bya ste mas gtang ba'i sman dang gtar ga yang bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa las skyes pa'i thor bu gsar pa la ni sa ha ra dza'i 'bru mar blud de de bzhin du rlung 'joms pa'i sman dang dugs bya ste mas gtang ba'i sman dang gtar ga yang bya'o //
translated: For a new boil arising from a vein, administer sesame oil from the Saharaja plant. Similarly, apply a poultice and medicine to conquer wind, and administer medicine and bloodletting from below.

original: 'brum bu gso ba ni thor bu gso ba ji lta ba bzhin du nad gzhi dang sbyar te gso ba ma lus par byas na phan no //
analyzed: 'brum bu gso ba ni thor bu gso ba ji lta ba bzhin du nad gzhi dang sbyar te gso ba ma lus par byas na phan no //
translated: For the treatment of smallpox, treat it according to the condition, just as for boils. If one does all the treatments, it will help.

original: rkang bam gyi nad la ni snum chos dang dugs dang rlung 'joms pa'i sman gyis dugs bya ste /
analyzed: rkang bam gyi nad la ni snum chos dang dugs dang rlung 'joms pa'i sman gyis dugs bya ste /
translated: For the disease of erysipelas, apply oil therapy, poultices, and a poultice of medicine to conquer wind.

original: long mo nas sor gnyis gyen du bcal ba'i rtsal gtar ga gdab bo //
analyzed: long mo nas sor gnyis gyen du bcal ba'i rtsal gtar ga gdab bo //
translated: Make a bloodletting incision two finger-widths above the ankle.

original: de nas zla ba gcig gi bar du ae randa'i mar ba gcin dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: de nas zla ba gcig gi bar du ae randa'i mar ba gcin dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Then, for one month, he should be given a potion of castor oil mixed with cow's urine.

original: sman zhu ba'i rjes ni 'bras rnying pa la sogs pa'i kha zas bca' sga dang 'o ma bskol ba dang bcas pa bza'o //
analyzed: sman zhu ba'i rjes ni 'bras rnying pa la sogs pa'i kha zas bca' sga dang 'o ma bskol ba dang bcas pa bza'o //
translated: After the medicine has been digested, he should eat old rice and other foods, with plenty of milk and ghee.

original: yang na dur byid dang 'o ma sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na dur byid dang 'o ma sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Alternatively, he should be given a potion of Trivrit and milk.

original: yang de ltar byas kyang ma zhin bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de ltar byas kyang ma zhin bsreg par bya'o //
translated: If this does not help, he should be treated for burning sensation.

original: mkhris pa'i rkang bam la ni long mo'i 'og gi rtsa las khrag phyung na ni mkhris pa'i rkang bam thams cad las rgyal bar byed do //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rkang bam la ni long mo'i 'og gi rtsa las khrag phyung na ni mkhris pa'i rkang bam thams cad las rgyal bar byed do //
translated: In the case of a swelling due to pitta, bloodletting should be done from the veins below the kneecaps. This will cure all types of pitta swelling.

original: bad kan gyi rkang bam la ni rkang pa'i mthe bong la khrag gtar te kha zas su nas bsten na phan no //
analyzed: bad kan gyi rkang bam la ni rkang pa'i mthe bong la khrag gtar te kha zas su nas bsten na phan no //
translated: In the case of a swelling due to kapha, bloodletting should be done from the toes. Eating barley is beneficial.

original: sman bskol ba'i khu ba sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
analyzed: sman bskol ba'i khu ba sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
translated: The patient should drink a decoction of medicines mixed with honey.

original: pi pi ling dang aa rur bskyed pa'i cho ga yang bya'o //
analyzed: pi pi ling dang aa rur bskyed pa'i cho ga yang bya'o //
translated: The treatment of Pippali and Haritaki should also be done.

original: yungs kar dang bar dha ka'i rtsa ba gnyis kyi 'dag gus byug pa'am yang na 'u su'i lo ma'i byug pa yang bya'o //🔽'brum chen gyi nad la ni slon khrus kyis gong 'og tu dag @379a * //
analyzed: yungs kar dang bar dha ka'i rtsa ba gnyis kyi 'dag gus byug pa'am yang na 'u su'i lo ma'i byug pa yang bya'o // 'brum chen gyi nad la ni slon khrus kyis gong 'og tu dag @379a * //
translated: One should apply a paste of white mustard seed and barḍhaka root, or also a paste of ushīra.

original: par byas nas de'i 'og tu danti dang / dran pa ti dang / dur byid dang / ka sha hi dang / de ba da li dang / de rnams mar dang bskol ba blud par bya'o //
analyzed: par byas nas de'i 'og tu danti dang / dran pa ti dang / dur byid dang / ka sha hi dang / de ba da li dang / de rnams mar dang bskol ba blud par bya'o //
translated: For the disease of large boils, after cleansing above and below with a warm enema, one should then give a drink of dantī, dhātrī, turmeric, kaśa, and devadāru boiled in ghee.

original: bad kan dang tshil la phan pa'i sman dang / du ba brngub pa dang / mkhur bar bcad pa dang / sna sman rnams kyang bsten na phan no //
analyzed: bad kan dang tshil la phan pa'i sman dang / du ba brngub pa dang / mkhur bar bcad pa dang / sna sman rnams kyang bsten na phan no //
translated: Medicines that are beneficial for phlegm and fat, inhaling smoke, gargling, and nasal medication are also helpful.

original: de bzhin du gtar g-yang bya zhing skyer khanda ba gcin dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtar g-yang bya zhing skyer khanda ba gcin dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
translated: Similarly, one should perform bloodletting and drink a decoction of kyerpai kha (kṣīrakaṇṭa) and urine.

original: 'brum chen thor bu bzhin ma smin pa la ni na ku la dang / lan tshva dang bca' sga rnams kyi 'dag gus bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'brum chen thor bu bzhin ma smin pa la ni na ku la dang / lan tshva dang bca' sga rnams kyi 'dag gus bsku bar bya'o //
translated: For unripened scattered large boils, one should apply a paste of nakula, salt, and ginger.

original: rgya mtsho'i phye ma dum bur byas la dugs bya ste mkhrang ba mnye bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i phye ma dum bur byas la dugs bya ste mkhrang ba mnye bar bya'o //
translated: Divide the ocean salt into pieces, apply it as a compress, and massage the hard areas.

original: sha mi dang / la phug dang / shi kru dang / de rnams kyi sa bon dang / nas dang / yungs kar dang / de rnams btags pa'i phye ma dar ba skyur po dang bcas pas bskus na 'brum chen gyi thor bu dang 'bras nad rnams 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: sha mi dang / la phug dang / shi kru dang / de rnams kyi sa bon dang / nas dang / yungs kar dang / de rnams btags pa'i phye ma dar ba skyur po dang bcas pas bskus na 'brum chen gyi thor bu dang 'bras nad rnams 'joms par byed do //
translated: The seeds of meat, radish, and sugarcane, barley, mustard, and the powder of those mixed with sour gruel, when applied, destroy the boils and tumors of great smallpox.

original: de smin te rma kha nas khrag 'dzag pa la ni mkhris pa dang bad kan 'joms pa'i gso ba sbyar ro //
analyzed: de smin te rma kha nas khrag 'dzag pa la ni mkhris pa dang bad kan 'joms pa'i gso ba sbyar ro //
translated: If it ripens and blood flows from the wound, apply the treatment that conquers bile and phlegm.

original: gal te ma smin na ni 'brum chen gyi nad phyung ste thal sman dang me'i las bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ma smin na ni 'brum chen gyi nad phyung ste thal sman dang me'i las bya'o //
translated: If it does not ripen, remove the boils of great smallpox and perform the burnt offering ritual.

original: 'ol ma se dkar po dang / lang ga li dang / aa hi dang / ha re nu ka dang / ka ka na ti pa la dang / de ba da la'i sa bon dang / kar ko ti dang / bi sha li dang / ko shi ta ki dang /
analyzed: 'ol ma se dkar po dang / lang ga li dang / aa hi dang / ha re nu ka dang / ka ka na ti pa la dang / de ba da la'i sa bon dang / kar ko ti dang / bi sha li dang / ko shi ta ki dang /
translated: White olomose, langali, ahi, herenuka, kakanatipala, the seeds of devadali, karkoti, visali, and koshitika,

original: pa tha dang de rnams srang phyed dang / dug zho gnyis dang / ka ra nydza'i sa bon mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / ni rgun thi'i rang gi khu ba srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang bskol te mar lus pa las btung ba dang bsku byug dang sna sman du sbyar na gsor mi rung ba'i 'bras kyi phye ma yun ring du lon zhing rnag mang du 'dzag pa yang 'dis🔽'drub par 'gyur ro //

translated: If one drinks, anoints, and uses it as a nasal medication, this will cure even a long-standing, incurable abscess with much pus.🔽One prastha of langalika powder,🔽four prasthas of sesame oil,

analyzed: lang ga li'i phye ma dang / de'i bzhi 'gyur gyi til mar dang / de'i bzhi 'gyur gyi ni rgun thi'i rang gi khu ba bskol te mar lus pa las sna sman la sogs par sbyar na 'brum chen 'bras kyi phreng ba sel to //
translated: and four prasthas of grape juice should be boiled until only the oil remains. If used as a nasal medication, etc., this will cure a garland of large boils.

original: tsandan dang / thang shing dang / na le sham dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / dur byid dang / gla sgang dang / de rnams srang re re dang / dug srang phyed dang / de rnams ba gcin las btags pa dang / sman bra hmi'i khu ba dang /🔽aarka'i lo ma dang / ba lang gi lci khu dang / @379b yungs mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / de rnams lhan cig bskol te mar lus pa las ran par bsten na mdze dang / rma 'khyims pa dang 'brum chen rnams myur du sel bar byed do //
analyzed: tsandan dang / thang shing dang / na le sham dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / dur byid dang / gla sgang dang / de rnams srang re re dang / dug srang phyed dang / de rnams ba gcin las btags pa dang / sman bra hmi'i khu ba dang / aarka'i lo ma dang / ba lang gi lci khu dang / @379b yungs mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / de rnams lhan cig bskol te mar lus pa las ran par bsten na mdze dang / rma 'khyims pa dang 'brum chen rnams myur du sel bar byed do //
translated: Sandalwood, pine, nutmeg, the two types of turmeric, Indian valerian, and ginger, each one ounce, and half an ounce of poison, mixed with cow's urine, and the juice of the medicinal plant Brahmi,🔽the leaves of the sun plant, cow's bile, and thirty-two ounces of mustard oil, all boiled together, taken in a suitable amount from the remaining oil, will quickly cure leprosy, carbuncles, and smallpox.

original: shu dag dang / aa ru ra dang / rgya skyegs dang / pu tse shel dang / de rnams til mar dang bskol ba mar lus pa las 'thungs na 'brum chen rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed do //

translated: Take white mustard seed, Indian berberry, lac, and crystal, boiled in sesame oil, and drink the remaining oil; it will completely cure smallpox.

original: sha ra pung ka'i rtsa ba 'bras kyi chu dang btags te sna sman dang byug par sbyar na 'brum chen ma rungs pa dang dug dang srin bu rnams las rgyal bar byed do //

translated: Sharapungka root, mixed with rice water, used as a nasal medication and as an ointment, conquers serious smallpox, poisons, and worms.

original: au ta ma ra ka ri ni'i rtsa ba dang / pi lu'i lo ma dang ; sa ha tsa ra dang / seng phrom dang / aa ru ra dang / shing mngar dang / shu ti dang / tsi tra ka dang / de rnams 'bru mar dang 'o ma cha mnyam pa dang bskol ba las sna sman dang bsku byug dag rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: au ta ma ra ka ri ni'i rtsa ba dang / pi lu'i lo ma dang ; sa ha tsa ra dang / seng phrom dang / aa ru ra dang / shing mngar dang / shu ti dang / tsi tra ka dang / de rnams 'bru mar dang 'o ma cha mnyam pa dang bskol ba las sna sman dang bsku byug dag rab tu bsngags so //
translated: The root of uttamarika, bilva leaves, sahachara, sengphrom, arura, shing ngar, shuti, and citraka, boiled with an equal measure of oil and milk, are highly recommended as nasal medication and as an ointment.

original: ba lang dang / ra dang / lug dang / rta dang / de rnams kyi rmig pa bsregs te yungs mar dang sbyar bas bsku byug bya'o //
analyzed: ba lang dang / ra dang / lug dang / rta dang / de rnams kyi rmig pa bsregs te yungs mar dang sbyar bas bsku byug bya'o //
translated: The hooves of cows, goats, sheep, and horses, burned and mixed with mustard oil, should be used as an ointment.

original: yang na sbrul nag po dang / bya rog rang shi ba'i sha bsregs te sman ai gu ta'i 'bru mar dang 'dag gur byas te bsku'o //
analyzed: yang na sbrul nag po dang / bya rog rang shi ba'i sha bsregs te sman ai gu ta'i 'bru mar dang 'dag gur byas te bsku'o //
translated: Alternatively, the flesh of a black snake and a crow, burned together, should be made into a medicinal oil with iguta oil and jaggery, and used as an ointment.

original: de ltar byas kyang ma zhi ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas kyang ma zhi ste /
translated: If it is still not pacified,

analyzed: rtsib logs dang byin pa la gnas pa'i 'brum chen gzhan 'byung na ni mas gtong ba rnams bya ste /
translated: If a large boil occurs on the side or calf, the mother should be made to expel it.

analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshil byung na mes bsreg par bya'o //
translated: After that, if fat occurs, it should be burned with fire.
