analyzed: rkang pa gyen du bteg ste rting pa'i tshad tsam long mo nas yar bcal bar rmen du mtshon gyis gcad par bya'o //
translated: The foot should be raised and cut with a knife at the ankle bone, about the length of a heel.

original: zhes legs ldan mu khyud kyis bshad do //
analyzed: zhes legs ldan mu khyud kyis bshad do //
translated: This is explained by Bhadraka Muktika.

analyzed: rting pa las yar sor bcu gnyis bcal na dbang po'i chu so zhes bya ba'i gnas yod do //
translated: If one measures twelve finger breadths up from the heel, there is a place called the urinary duct of the organ.

original: de'i g-yas g-yon du dbral te dbus na nya'i sgo nga 'dra ba yod de de drangs shing dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i g-yas g-yon du dbral te dbus na nya'i sgo nga 'dra ba yod de de drangs shing dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: To the right and left of that, there is a place resembling a fish egg. It should be drawn out and removed.

original: zhes drang srong legs par thos kyis bshad do //
analyzed: zhes drang srong legs par thos kyis bshad do //
translated: This is explained by Rishi Sumita.

analyzed: kha cig na re long mo'i rtsa ba tsog tsog po nas cha brgyad yar bcal ba na khu yod pa zhes bya ba nad dbus na yod pa ma gtogs par de'i ngos gnyis dbang po'i chu so dang rje ngar gyi rus pa'i bar du ba ru ra'i tshi

analyzed: gu tsam bcad do zhes 'chad do //

analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i rma 'khyims pa la ni dbral la dugs dang bsku byug legs par bya ste / aa pa ma rga'i 'bras bu dang / til dang @380a * //
translated: For a wound caused by vata, apply a poultice and massage well.🔽Make a poultice paste of the fruit of apamarga, sesame,

analyzed: rgyam tsha rnams btags pa'i phye ma'i lde gus dugs bya'o //
translated: and rock salt.🔽For a wound caused by pitta, apply a poultice of madder, sesame,

analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma 'khyims pa la ni btsod dang / til dang / gan dar ba dang / ser po rnam gnyis gyi lde gus dugs bya'o //

analyzed: zug rdu zug pa'i rma 'khyims pa la ni til dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar sbyar ba'i lde gus dugs bya'o //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbral te zug rdu phyung la dag par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas skud pa thal sman gyi chu'i nang du sbangs la /

translated: and Virtzo, and administer this as a nasal medication.🔽If the medication is administered as a suppository or a pill, it will not be able to increase the strength of the wound, just as a weak person is unable to walk.

original: sngar 'ching ba dam du bcing ba'i skyes bu 'gro ba'i nus pa med pa bzhin du rma mched pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur ro //🔽thor bu dang 'brum bu la sogs pa gso ba'i le'u ste sum cu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sngar 'ching ba dam du bcing ba'i skyes bu 'gro ba'i nus pa med pa bzhin du rma mched pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur ro // thor bu dang 'brum bu la sogs pa gso ba'i le'u ste sum cu pa rdzogs so /
translated: Or, it will be like a person who is tightly bound and is unable to move, and will not be able to heal the wound.🔽This is the thirty chapter, the “Treatment of Smallpox and Measles,” from the Secret Quintessential Instructions on the Eight Branches of the Ambrosia Essence Tantra.

original: // / de nas 'brum bu phra mo'i nad dmigs shes par bya ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas 'brum bu phra mo'i nad dmigs shes par bya ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the chapter on the diagnosis of small pox.

original: de la bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i 'brum bu phra mo'i nad @380b ni mon sran sde'u'i tshad tsam zlum po dang / snum pa dang / nad gzhi rang gi mdog tu 'dug pa dang / tha dad med cing byis pa la 'byung ba yin te de ni ra'i 'gram pa lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i 'brum bu phra mo'i nad @380b ni mon sran sde'u'i tshad tsam zlum po dang / snum pa dang / nad gzhi rang gi mdog tu 'dug pa dang / tha dad med cing byis pa la 'byung ba yin te de ni ra'i 'gram pa lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The small pox caused by phlegm and wind is round like a small pea, oily, the color of the disease itself, not separate, and occurs in children. It is called “like a rabbit’s fur”.

original: yang na 'brum bu nas kyi tshad tsam mang po mthug par 'byung ba de ni nas lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'brum bu nas kyi tshad tsam mang po mthug par 'byung ba de ni nas lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, many small pox the size of a mustard seed appear thick. That is called “small pox like barley”.

original: yang me dbal phra mo rtse mo med pa zlum bo mthug cing mtho bar 'dug pa dang rnag nyung ba de ni me dbal phra mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang me dbal phra mo rtse mo med pa zlum bo mthug cing mtho bar 'dug pa dang rnag nyung ba de ni me dbal phra mo zhes bya'o //
translated: Also, a small, thin, thick, and high pustule without a tip is called “small pustule”.

original: de las thor bu lnga'am drug tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las thor bu lnga'am drug tu 'byung ste /
translated: From that, five or six pustules appear separately.

original: de yang rus sbal gyi rgyab ltar mthon por 'dug pa dang / sra zhing drag tu na ba dang rna mchog gam rna ba 'khor ling kun tu 'byung ba de ni rus sbal lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rus sbal gyi rgyab ltar mthon por 'dug pa dang / sra zhing drag tu na ba dang rna mchog gam rna ba 'khor ling kun tu 'byung ba de ni rus sbal lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The skin becomes rough and hard, and the body is covered with boils that are raised like a tortoise shell. The boils are hard and painful, and the ears become swollen and inflamed. This is called “tortoise-like boils.”

original: yang 'brum bu phra mo autpa la'i rtsa ba 'dra bar skrangs shing tshabs chung dur na ba dang brtan par 'dug pa de ni pa na si ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang 'brum bu phra mo autpa la'i rtsa ba 'dra bar skrangs shing tshabs chung dur na ba dang brtan par 'dug pa de ni pa na si ka zhes bya'o //
translated: “Lotus-root-like boils” are small boils that are swollen like the root of a lotus flower. They are slightly painful and firm.

original: yang 'brum bu 'gram pa'i tshigs mtshams nas byung ba de ni par na sha gar ta pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang 'brum bu 'gram pa'i tshigs mtshams nas byung ba de ni par na sha gar ta pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Parnasika” are boils that appear at the jaw joints.

original: yang skyes bu na tshod lang tsho la bab pa'i dus su 'brum bu phra mo shing shal ma li'i tsher ma dang 'dra ba dang nad dang bcas shing mthug pa dang / nang na tshil yod pa skyes te des gdong ma rungs par byed pa de ni bzhin ma rungs par byed pa'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang skyes bu na tshod lang tsho la bab pa'i dus su 'brum bu phra mo shing shal ma li'i tsher ma dang 'dra ba dang nad dang bcas shing mthug pa dang / nang na tshil yod pa skyes te des gdong ma rungs par byed pa de ni bzhin ma rungs par byed pa'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
translated: “Ugly-face boils” are small boils that appear on the face of a young man in the prime of life. They are accompanied by pain and are thick and greasy. They make the face ugly.

original: bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i 'brum bu dkar po padma'i tsher ma bzhin du lus la khyab bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i 'brum bu dkar po padma'i tsher ma bzhin du lus la khyab bar 'byung ste /
translated: The white pustules that appear on the body, like lotus thorns, are caused by phlegm and wind.

original: de ni 'brum bu padma'i tsher ma can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'brum bu padma'i tsher ma can zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the lotus thorn pustule.🔽The pustules that appear on the body, like ripe udumbara fruit, are caused by bile. They are small, with large openings, hot, and cause fever.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i 'brum bu phra mo au dumb'a ri'i 'bras bu smin pa ltar kha che zhing tsha ba dang / rims kyis 'debs par byed pa de ni rma kha yangs par byed pa 'brum bu'i nad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i 'brum bu phra mo au dumb'a ri'i 'bras bu smin pa ltar kha che zhing tsha ba dang / rims kyis 'debs par byed pa de ni rma kha yangs par byed pa 'brum bu'i nad ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the pustule disease that causes large openings in wounds.🔽The pustules that appear on the body and face are small, thick, the size of lentils, and have the color of lentils. They are hot and itchy, and painful.

original: lus dang ngo gdong la 'brum bu phra mo mthug pa sran chung gi tshad tsam mdog sran chung 'dra ba tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / zug gzer dang ldan pa de ni 'brum bu sran chung lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngo gdong la 'brum bu phra mo mthug pa sran chung gi tshad tsam mdog sran chung 'dra ba tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / zug gzer dang ldan pa de ni 'brum bu sran chung lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the lentil-like pustule.

original: de bas na shin tu mi bzad pa'i 'brum bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bas na shin tu mi bzad pa'i 'brum bu 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, very severe pustules appear.

original: zug gzer dang bcas ba tshabs cher na ba de ni 'brum bu'i nad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zug gzer dang bcas ba tshabs cher na ba de ni 'brum bu'i nad ces bya'o //
translated: They are painful, and the condition is very serious. This is called the pustule disease.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa'i 'brum bu'i nad padma'i snying po 'dra bar 'byung zhing de'i nye 'khor du 'brum bu phra mos khyab pa de ni 'brum bu'i nad gar dha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa'i 'brum bu'i nad padma'i snying po 'dra bar 'byung zhing de'i nye 'khor du 'brum bu phra mos khyab pa de ni 'brum bu'i nad gar dha zhes bya'o //
translated: The disease called “garḍa” is a type of smallpox that appears in the form of a lotus bud, and is surrounded by small pustules.

original: yang na 'brum bu phra mo mchan khung dang nye 'khor @381a * //
analyzed: yang na 'brum bu phra mo mchan khung dang nye 'khor @381a * //
translated: Alternatively, small pustules appear in the armpits and surrounding areas,

original: du dkyil 'khor dang 'dra bar rgya che zhing mtho ba dang / mdog dmar ba dang / 'brum bu phra mo rnams kyis bskor ba 'dug pa ste de ni phal cher rlung las gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: du dkyil 'khor dang 'dra bar rgya che zhing mtho ba dang / mdog dmar ba dang / 'brum bu phra mo rnams kyis bskor ba 'dug pa ste de ni phal cher rlung las gyur pa yin te /
translated: forming a large, raised circle, red in color, surrounded by small pustules. This is mostly caused by wind.

original: de'i ming ni mchan khung gi 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ming ni mchan khung gi 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Its name is “armpit pustule.”

original: mkhris pa shas che ba'i 'brum bu 'bras yos lta bu mthug par 'byung ste de ni 'bras yos lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa shas che ba'i 'brum bu 'bras yos lta bu mthug par 'byung ste de ni 'bras yos lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
translated: A type of pustule that is thick and appears like roasted grain is called “pustule like roasted grain.”

original: de dang 'dra bar 'brum bu chen po gcig 'byung ba de ni 'brum bu dra ba zhes grags so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'brum bu chen po gcig 'byung ba de ni 'brum bu dra ba zhes grags so //
translated: A single large pustule that appears like that is known as “pustule net.”

original: lus tshabs gdungs pas rdul te 'brum bu phra mo mthug pa dang nad dang bcas pa dang / ske tshe'i 'brum bu'i tshad cam mdog dmar por 'byung ba de ni ske tshe'i 'bru lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus tshabs gdungs pas rdul te 'brum bu phra mo mthug pa dang nad dang bcas pa dang / ske tshe'i 'brum bu'i tshad cam mdog dmar por 'byung ba de ni ske tshe'i 'bru lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The body is afflicted with pain, and there are small pustules with a thick discharge, as well as illness. Red pustules the size of mustard seeds appear. This is called “pustules like mustard seeds.”

original: mkhris pa shas che ba'i 'brum bu me dbal phra mo mched pa bzhin du byer te de yang skrangs pa dang smin pa dang sra ba dang dmar ba dang tsha bar byed pa de ni dza la gar dha ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa shas che ba'i 'brum bu me dbal phra mo mched pa bzhin du byer te de yang skrangs pa dang smin pa dang sra ba dang dmar ba dang tsha bar byed pa de ni dza la gar dha ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In pustules with a predominance of bile, the small pustules spread like a rash. They cause swelling, ripening, hardness, redness, and heat. This is called “jalagandha.”

original: mkhris pa shas che ba'i 'brum bu me dbal sha'i rang bzhin mi bzad pa dang / rims kyis ldan pa dang me'i mdog lta bu mchan khung phyogs su 'byung ste /
analyzed: mkhris pa shas che ba'i 'brum bu me dbal sha'i rang bzhin mi bzad pa dang / rims kyis ldan pa dang me'i mdog lta bu mchan khung phyogs su 'byung ste /
translated: In pustules with a predominance of bile, the unbearable pustules have a flesh-like nature, are associated with fever, and are the color of fire. They appear in the armpits.

original: de'i ming ni me'i ro hi ni zhes bya ba ste zhag lnga 'am bdun nam zla ba phyed las 'tsho ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ming ni me'i ro hi ni zhes bya ba ste zhag lnga 'am bdun nam zla ba phyed las 'tsho ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Their name is “agnirohini.” Within five, seven, or fifteen days, there is a decline in life.

original: nad gzhi gsum gyi 'brum bu zlum po nam tshong yan chad du 'byung ste de ni pa ri pa la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nad gzhi gsum gyi 'brum bu zlum po nam tshong yan chad du 'byung ste de ni pa ri pa la zhes bya'o //
translated: The three types of pustules occur up to the age of fifty. They are called pariśa.

original: 'brum bu mchan khung dang / chu so dang / brla gnyis kyi bar du sman bi da ri'i rtsa ba lta bu 'byung ste de ni bi da ri lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'brum bu mchan khung dang / chu so dang / brla gnyis kyi bar du sman bi da ri'i rtsa ba lta bu 'byung ste de ni bi da ri lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Pustules appear between the armpits, the urinary tract, and the two thighs, resembling the root of the vidari plant. They are called pustules resembling the vidari plant.

original: tshil dang rlung las gyur pa'i 'brum bu rgyus pa dang sha dang rtsal brten te 'byung la gal te rdol na ni zhag dang mar dang sbrang rtsi lta bu mang du 'dzag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshil dang rlung las gyur pa'i 'brum bu rgyus pa dang sha dang rtsal brten te 'byung la gal te rdol na ni zhag dang mar dang sbrang rtsi lta bu mang du 'dzag par 'gyur te /
translated: Pustules caused by fat and wind occur based on sinews, flesh, and veins. If they burst, they ooze a lot like oil, ghee, or honey.

original: des rlung bskyod de sha skams shing zlum por bsgongs te /
analyzed: des rlung bskyod de sha skams shing zlum por bsgongs te /
translated: The wind stirs that up, drying out the flesh and causing it to swell.

original: rma'i nang du gseg ma lta bu skyes pa dang khrag dang rnag mdog sna tshogs su 'byung ba dang / dri mi zhim pa'i nad gzhi dang bcas pa rnams 'dzag pa ste de ni 'brum bu gseg ma lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rma'i nang du gseg ma lta bu skyes pa dang khrag dang rnag mdog sna tshogs su 'byung ba dang / dri mi zhim pa'i nad gzhi dang bcas pa rnams 'dzag pa ste de ni 'brum bu gseg ma lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Sand-like growths appear inside the wound, and blood and pus of various colors ooze out, along with a foul-smelling discharge. That is called sand-like pustules.

original: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i 'brum bu lag pa dang / rkang pa'i mthil dang / tshigs dang nam tshong yan chad grog ma'i mgo po 'dra bar rim gyis mang pos khyab par byed do //
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i 'brum bu lag pa dang / rkang pa'i mthil dang / tshigs dang nam tshong yan chad grog ma'i mgo po 'dra bar rim gyis mang pos khyab par byed do //
translated: The pustules that result from the gathering of these humors spread gradually over the hands, feet, joints, and the entire body, like the head of an ant.

original: de yang na ba dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por @381b 'dug pa dang g-ya' ba dang tshabs cher rul ba de ni 'brum bu grog ma'i kha lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang na ba dang / tsha 'ur 'ur por @381b 'dug pa dang g-ya' ba dang tshabs cher rul ba de ni 'brum bu grog ma'i kha lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: When these pustules are painful, hot, itchy, and extremely putrid, they are called “pustules like the head of an ant.”

original: rkang pa'i mthil du gseg ma 'am tsher ma zug pa las 'brum bu mdzer pa lta bur skyes pa ni ka da ra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthil du gseg ma 'am tsher ma zug pa las 'brum bu mdzer pa lta bur skyes pa ni ka da ra zhes bya'o //
translated: When a pustule like a boil arises on the soles of the feet from the piercing of a stone or thorn, it is called a “kadara.”

original: thor bu sel bzhes bya ba'i rlung ni gzhang gi nang na gnas te /
analyzed: thor bu sel bzhes bya ba'i rlung ni gzhang gi nang na gnas te /
translated: The “pustule that is a solitary abscess” is a vāyu that resides in the anus.

original: de bshad ba dang lhan cig 'khrugs nas gzhang gi phyi nang du tsher ma lta bu'i 'brum bu skyes te /
analyzed: de bshad ba dang lhan cig 'khrugs nas gzhang gi phyi nang du tsher ma lta bu'i 'brum bu skyes te /
translated: When it is disturbed, it causes pustules like thorns to arise inside and outside the anus.

original: bshang ba 'byung dka' zhing sra ba de ni gzhang 'gags pa zhes bya ba'i 'brum bu yin no //
analyzed: bshang ba 'byung dka' zhing sra ba de ni gzhang 'gags pa zhes bya ba'i 'brum bu yin no //
translated: When it is difficult to defecate and the stool is hard, this is called “the pustule that is an obstruction of the anus.”

original: mkhris pa dang rlung las gyur pa'i 'brum bu ni sen mo dang sha'i nang du smin cing zug gzer tsha ba dang ldan pa de ni 'brum bu nye ba'i sen mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa dang rlung las gyur pa'i 'brum bu ni sen mo dang sha'i nang du smin cing zug gzer tsha ba dang ldan pa de ni 'brum bu nye ba'i sen mo zhes bya'o //
translated: The pustules which appear on the nails and the flesh, which ripen and hurt, are called pustules of the nails.

original: kha cig na re tsam pa ma dang zad byed kyi nad ces bya'o zhes 'chad do //🔽rtsub bag bza' ba dang / drud pa dang / snad pa las gyur pa'i 'brum bu sor mo gnag pa dang reg na shin tu rtsub pa de ni 'brum bu ka na kha zhes bya'o //🔽'dam bag ma rungs pa sen mo'i nang du zhugs pa las 'brum bur gyur te g-ya' ba dang nang du rnag dang bcas pa de ni 'brum bu sor mo skrangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re tsam pa ma dang zad byed kyi nad ces bya'o zhes 'chad do // rtsub bag bza' ba dang / drud pa dang / snad pa las gyur pa'i 'brum bu sor mo gnag pa dang reg na shin tu rtsub pa de ni 'brum bu ka na kha zhes bya'o // 'dam bag ma rungs pa sen mo'i nang du zhugs pa las 'brum bur gyur te g-ya' ba dang nang du rnag dang bcas pa de ni 'brum bu sor mo skrangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say that they are called pustules of the nails and of the flesh.🔽The pustules which appear on the fingers, black and very rough to the touch, are called pustules of the fingers.🔽The pustules which appear on the fingers, accompanied by itching and pus, are called pustules of the fingers and toes.

original: til nag po'i mdog tu snang ba'i 'brum bu ni til nag lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: til nag po'i mdog tu snang ba'i 'brum bu ni til nag lta bu'i 'brum bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The pustules which appear on the fingers, black like sesame seeds, are called pustules like black sesame seeds.

original: pags pa'i steng du mdog gnag cing nad med pa'i 'brum bu mdog dmar ba srog chags sbrang bu mchu rings tsam mthon por 'dug pa 'am yang na 'brum bu ma dog dkar ba dang gnag pa de ni pags pa'i mdzer pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pags pa'i steng du mdog gnag cing nad med pa'i 'brum bu mdog dmar ba srog chags sbrang bu mchu rings tsam mthon por 'dug pa 'am yang na 'brum bu ma dog dkar ba dang gnag pa de ni pags pa'i mdzer pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A dark, healthy red rash on the skin, as high as a mosquito bite, or a white or black rash, is called skin moles.

original: de bzhin du lhan cig skyes pa'i 'brum bu mdog dmar ba de ni dza ru ma ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhan cig skyes pa'i 'brum bu mdog dmar ba de ni dza ru ma ni zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, a natural red rash is called a birthmark.

original: mdog gnag pa dang dkar ba ni dkyil 'khor lan tshva na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdog gnag pa dang dkar ba ni dkyil 'khor lan tshva na zhes bya'o //
translated: A dark or light rash is called a salt circle.

original: mya ngan dang khro ba la sogs pas rlung dang mkhris pa 'khrugs te gdong srab cing sngo ba'i thig le 'byung ba ni do shig ces bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan dang khro ba la sogs pas rlung dang mkhris pa 'khrugs te gdong srab cing sngo ba'i thig le 'byung ba ni do shig ces bya'o //
translated: Sorrow, anger, and so on disturb the wind and bile, causing a thin, blue rash to appear on the face, called a birthmark.

original: lus gzhan du byung ba la ni li ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus gzhan du byung ba la ni li ga zhes bya'o //
translated: A rash on other parts of the body is called a birthmark.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i ngo shig ni rud rud por 'dug pa dang reg na rtsub pa dang mdog sngo bsangs su 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i ngo shig ni rud rud por 'dug pa dang reg na rtsub pa dang mdog sngo bsangs su 'dug pa yin no //
translated: A birthmark caused by wind is rough, rough to the touch, and blue in color.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa ni dbus dmar zhing mtha' sngo ba yin no //
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa ni dbus dmar zhing mtha' sngo ba yin no //
translated: The one caused by bile has a red center and a blue periphery.

original: bad kan las gyur pa ni dkar zhing g-ya' ba yin no //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa ni dkar zhing g-ya' ba yin no //
translated: The one caused by phlegm is white and itchy.

original: khrag las gyur pa ni dbus dmar zhing mtha' zangs ma'i mdog ltar snang zhing skem pa dang / @382a * //
analyzed: khrag las gyur pa ni dbus dmar zhing mtha' zangs ma'i mdog ltar snang zhing skem pa dang / @382a * //
translated: The one caused by blood has a red center and a copper-colored periphery. It is dry,

original: tsha tseg tseg byed cing bem bem por 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: tsha tseg tseg byed cing bem bem por 'dug pa yin no //
translated: hot, and has a burning sensation.

original: rlung gis bad kan pags par son par byas te /
analyzed: rlung gis bad kan pags par son par byas te /
translated: When wind causes phlegm to reach the skin,

original: der bad kan skams nas mdog dkar ba dang / tshor ba med pa dang / cher mi g-ya' ba dang / mi gnag pa de ni pags pa'i nad tshor ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der bad kan skams nas mdog dkar ba dang / tshor ba med pa dang / cher mi g-ya' ba dang / mi gnag pa de ni pags pa'i nad tshor ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the phlegm dries up, becoming white, without sensation, not very itchy, and not dark. This is called “skin disease without sensation.”

original: slon sman nyes te mkhris pa dang bad kan gnyis gcig la gcig 'khrugs nas dkyil 'khor lta bu'i nad du gyur te /
analyzed: slon sman nyes te mkhris pa dang bad kan gnyis gcig la gcig 'khrugs nas dkyil 'khor lta bu'i nad du gyur te /
translated: When the medicine for indigestion is wrong, bile and phlegm disturb each other, becoming a circular disease.

original: de yang shas cher g-ya' zhing mang du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i nad shas cher gyur pa de ni aa ko tha zhes bya ba dang / de ltar 'brum bu mo'i nad kyi bye brag sum cu rtsa drug tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang shas cher g-ya' zhing mang du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i nad shas cher gyur pa de ni aa ko tha zhes bya ba dang / de ltar 'brum bu mo'i nad kyi bye brag sum cu rtsa drug tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the thirty-six types of smallpox have been taught.

original: 'brum bu phra mo'i nad dmigs brtags pa'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa gcig pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'brum bu phra mo'i nad dmigs brtags pa'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa gcig pa rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the examination of the symptoms of the disease of small pox is completed.

original: // / de nas 'brum bu phra mo la sogs pa gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas 'brum bu phra mo la sogs pa gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the chapter on the treatment of small pox and so forth will be explained.

original: de la ra'i 'gram pa lta bu'i nad ma smin pa la ni srin bu pad pas khag dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de la ra'i 'gram pa lta bu'i nad ma smin pa la ni srin bu pad pas khag dbyung ngo //
translated: In the case of the unripe disease of the type that resembles the side of a rat, one should apply a poultice of padma.

original: nas lta bu'i 'brum bu'i nad la ni /
analyzed: nas lta bu'i 'brum bu'i nad la ni /

original: @393a * // shu kha na pa dang / bong nga dkar po dang / kanda ka ri'i rtsa ba dang / de rnams kyi lde gus rma la bsku'o //
analyzed: @393a * // shu kha na pa dang / bong nga dkar po dang / kanda ka ri'i rtsa ba dang / de rnams kyi lde gus rma la bsku'o //
translated: One should apply a paste of shukanapada, white aconite, and kandakari root to the wound.

original: gzhan yang dug 'thungs pa dang / dug gis bzung ba'i gso ba ji ltar 'os par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dug 'thungs pa dang / dug gis bzung ba'i gso ba ji ltar 'os par sbyar ro //
translated: One should also apply whatever is suitable for treating poisoning and being seized by poison.

original: rma rnags pa la ni mkhris pa'i me dbal gyi gso ba rnams spyad do //
analyzed: rma rnags pa la ni mkhris pa'i me dbal gyi gso ba rnams spyad do //
translated: For a foul-smelling wound, one should use the treatments for pitta abscesses.

original: bud med rang skal ba dang ldan pa'i ched du rang gi khyim thab la dbyig dug kha zas dang sbyar ba sbyin pa 'am /
analyzed: bud med rang skal ba dang ldan pa'i ched du rang gi khyim thab la dbyig dug kha zas dang sbyar ba sbyin pa 'am /
translated: For the sake of a woman who is fortunate, her husband may give her poison mixed with food.

original: rgyal po dang 'khon pa'i dgra sa rgyal po'i 'khor nye bar gnas pa la gla rngan byin te kha zas kyi nang du dbyig dug byin na dbyig dug gis zin pa'i mtshan ma ni mdog skya ba dang / lus skem zhing rjud pa dang / me'i drod chung ba dang /
analyzed: rgyal po dang 'khon pa'i dgra sa rgyal po'i 'khor nye bar gnas pa la gla rngan byin te kha zas kyi nang du dbyig dug byin na dbyig dug gis zin pa'i mtshan ma ni mdog skya ba dang / lus skem zhing rjud pa dang / me'i drod chung ba dang /
translated: a thin and emaciated body, little heat in the body,

original: lud pa lu ba dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / rims kyis nyam thag pa dang / rlung lam gzhan du zhugs pa dang / rtag tu gnyid 'ong ba dang / sems las che zhing yid mi bde bar 'gyur ba dang / lto ba dang /
analyzed: lud pa lu ba dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / rims kyis nyam thag pa dang / rlung lam gzhan du zhugs pa dang / rtag tu gnyid 'ong ba dang / sems las che zhing yid mi bde bar 'gyur ba dang / lto ba dang /
translated: spitting, difficulty breathing, exhaustion from fever, wind entering other pathways, constant sleepiness, a restless mind, mental unhappiness, a large stomach,

original: mchin pa dang / mcher pa cher skyes te /
analyzed: mchin pa dang / mcher pa cher skyes te /
translated: and a large liver and spleen.

original: skad gsang dma' ba dang / nyam chung ba dang / sgyid zhan pa dang / skrang ba dang / rtag tu lto sbo ba dang / rkang pa dang / lag pa skem zhing na ba dang / phal cher rmi lam gyi nang du ce spyang dang /
analyzed: skad gsang dma' ba dang / nyam chung ba dang / sgyid zhan pa dang / skrang ba dang / rtag tu lto sbo ba dang / rkang pa dang / lag pa skem zhing na ba dang / phal cher rmi lam gyi nang du ce spyang dang /
translated: The voice is low, weak, and feeble, there is swelling, the stomach is always distended, the feet and hands are thin and painful, and one mostly dreams of jackals,

original: byi la dang / sre mo dang / sbrul 'di rnams mthong zhing nags dang mtsho rnams kyang skam par byed pa mthong ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: byi la dang / sre mo dang / sbrul 'di rnams mthong zhing nags dang mtsho rnams kyang skam par byed pa mthong ba rnams yin no //
translated: monkeys, snakes, and so on, and he sees the forests and lakes dry up.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus dkar po nag por mthong ba dang / sna dang mig kyang mdog 'gyur ba dang / dbang po rnams kyang nyams par mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus dkar po nag por mthong ba dang / sna dang mig kyang mdog 'gyur ba dang / dbang po rnams kyang nyams par mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: He sees his own body as white or black, and his nose and eyes change color, and he sees his faculties deteriorate.

original: de dang de la sogs pa'i gnod pa mang po skye bar 'gyur ba'i dbyig dug gis nyam thag par 'gyur ba des lus 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang de la sogs pa'i gnod pa mang po skye bar 'gyur ba'i dbyig dug gis nyam thag par 'gyur ba des lus 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is afflicted by many such harms, and his body wastes away.

original: la la ni de ma thag gso ba byas na 'tsho ba yod do //
analyzed: la la ni de ma thag gso ba byas na 'tsho ba yod do //
translated: Some are cured immediately, and some live.

original: yang dbyig dug gis nyam thag pa la de ma thag slon pa'i kha zas sbyin te /
analyzed: yang dbyig dug gis nyam thag pa la de ma thag slon pa'i kha zas sbyin te /
translated: To those afflicted by poison, give food immediately.

original: 'phral skyug tu gzhug go //
analyzed: 'phral skyug tu gzhug go //
translated: Make them vomit immediately.

original: de nas dag par byas nas gser sbyin par bya'o ;
analyzed: de nas dag par byas nas gser sbyin par bya'o ;
translated: Then, having purified them, give them gold.

original: / lhag ma ni mdo'i gnas su bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: / lhag ma ni mdo'i gnas su bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The rest should be done according to the ritual explained in the chapter on the sūtras.

original: gser dang / drub mar cang dang / kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi sbyar ba'i lde gu bldag tu bcug na sbyor ba thams cad las byas pa'i dbyig dug drag po yang rab tu zhi bar byed do //🔽mur ba dang / sle tres dang / rgya spos @393b dang ; pi pi ling dang / pa to la dang / dbyi mo dang / tsi tra ka dang / shu dag dang / gla sgang dang / byi dang ga dang / 'di rnams dar ba dang /
analyzed: gser dang / drub mar cang dang / kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi sbyar ba'i lde gu bldag tu bcug na sbyor ba thams cad las byas pa'i dbyig dug drag po yang rab tu zhi bar byed do // mur ba dang / sle tres dang / rgya spos @393b dang ; pi pi ling dang / pa to la dang / dbyi mo dang / tsi tra ka dang / shu dag dang / gla sgang dang / byi dang ga dang / 'di rnams dar ba dang /
translated: If one makes a paste of gold, chang, sugar, and honey, and has the patient lick it, it will completely pacify severe poisoning from all compounds.

original: zho ga chu 'am /
analyzed: zho ga chu 'am /
translated: If one takes myrobalan, ginger, Indian valerian, long pepper, patola, turmeric, citraka, white-flowered leadwort, white-flowered leadwort, and white yam, either with warm water or

original: sha khu skyur po dro 'jam tsam la btang na dbyig dug gis me'i drod nyams pa yang 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: sha khu skyur po dro 'jam tsam la btang na dbyig dug gis me'i drod nyams pa yang 'jig par byed do //
translated: warm sour gruel or meat broth, it will destroy the loss of digestive heat caused by poisoning.

original: phug ron gyi sha dang ; zur ba dang / ma nu dang / 'di rnams bskol te grangs pa blud na dbyig dug dang / skom dad che ba dang / zug pa dang / lud pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / sbos pa dang /
analyzed: phug ron gyi sha dang ; zur ba dang / ma nu dang / 'di rnams bskol te grangs pa blud na dbyig dug dang / skom dad che ba dang / zug pa dang / lud pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / sbos pa dang /
translated: If one cooks pigeon meat, sour jujube, and manna, and gives it as a drink, it will cure poisoning, thirst, pain, phlegm, dyspnea, and swelling.

original: lus mi bde ba tsha ba rnams 'joms par byed pa dang / dug gi rang bzhin can gyi mi la kha zas dus ma yin bar zos pas nad gzhi rnams dang lhan cig 'khrugs pa de ni byi sha sang ga sta zhes bya ba'i dug nad yin par bshad de /
analyzed: lus mi bde ba tsha ba rnams 'joms par byed pa dang / dug gi rang bzhin can gyi mi la kha zas dus ma yin bar zos pas nad gzhi rnams dang lhan cig 'khrugs pa de ni byi sha sang ga sta zhes bya ba'i dug nad yin par bshad de /
translated: It is said that the disease called “poisonous flesh” is a disturbance of the humors that occurs when a person with a poisonous nature eats food at the wrong time.

original: de las rgyal bar byed pas 'ga' zhig 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las rgyal bar byed pas 'ga' zhig 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some people are cured by conquering this disease.

original: byi sha sa ka zhes bya ba'i dbyig dug gi nad la bsrung bar bya ba ni bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / tsha ba dang / nyam chung ba dang / khro ba dang / mya ngan dang / 'jigs pa dang / ngal ba dang /
analyzed: byi sha sa ka zhes bya ba'i dbyig dug gi nad la bsrung bar bya ba ni bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / tsha ba dang / nyam chung ba dang / khro ba dang / mya ngan dang / 'jigs pa dang / ngal ba dang /
translated: The protection against the disease of “poisonous flesh” is to avoid hunger, thirst, heat, weakness, anger, sorrow, fear, fatigue,

original: ma zhu ba dang / 'khru ba dang / gang yang mkhris pa dang / rlung 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu dang / til mar gyi me tog dang / 'bras bu snom pa dang / sa'i rlangs pa snom pa dang / 'brug gi sgra dang / glang po che dang /
analyzed: ma zhu ba dang / 'khru ba dang / gang yang mkhris pa dang / rlung 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu dang / til mar gyi me tog dang / 'bras bu snom pa dang / sa'i rlangs pa snom pa dang / 'brug gi sgra dang / glang po che dang /
translated: indigestion, diarrhea, and anything that increases bile and wind, such as sesame oil, flowers, fruits, the smell of the earth, thunder, elephants,

original: byi ba'i sgra dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / nyan pa dang / shar phyogs kyi rlung dang / autpa la'i dri snom pa dang / gang yang myos par 'gyur ba'i bag bsten na dug 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin te spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byi ba'i sgra dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / nyan pa dang / shar phyogs kyi rlung dang / autpa la'i dri snom pa dang / gang yang myos par 'gyur ba'i bag bsten na dug 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin te spang bar bya'o //
translated: The sounds of mice, music, listening, the wind from the east, smelling the scent of utpala flowers, and any indulgence in intoxicants increase poison. These should be avoided.

original: dbyar ni char mang po 'bab pa'i dus yin te /
analyzed: dbyar ni char mang po 'bab pa'i dus yin te /
translated: Summer is the season of heavy rainfall.

original: de'i tshe dug la chu mang pos brlan par byas nas khu ba gzags te bkrus na dug gi nus pa zhan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dug la chu mang pos brlan par byas nas khu ba gzags te bkrus na dug gi nus pa zhan par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, poison is moistened by the abundance of water, drips, and is washed away, weakening the potency of the poison.

original: de bas na ston sprin med pa'i dus su skar ma ri byi shar te des dug gi mthu 'phrog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ston sprin med pa'i dus su skar ma ri byi shar te des dug gi mthu 'phrog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in autumn, during the cloudless season, when the star Ribhi rises, it steals the power of the poison.

original: de ltar sman pa mkhas pas nad kyi rang bzhin dang / gang la goms pa med pa dang / gnas skabs gang du nad 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyi stobs che chung brtags te de'i 'og tu gso ba'i las spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sman pa mkhas pas nad kyi rang bzhin dang / gang la goms pa med pa dang / gnas skabs gang du nad 'khrugs pa dang / nad kyi stobs che chung brtags te de'i 'og tu gso ba'i las spyad par bya ste /
translated: Thus, a skilled physician should examine the nature of the disease, what it is not accustomed to, the stage at which the disease is agitated, and the strength of the disease. Then, he should engage in the work of healing.

original: de la bad kan gyi rang bzhin can gyi dug nad la ni dro ba dang / rtsub pa dang @394a * //
analyzed: de la bad kan gyi rang bzhin can gyi dug nad la ni dro ba dang / rtsub pa dang @394a * //
translated: For poisoning with a phlegm nature, use warm, rough,

original: rno ba'i skyug sman dang byug pa sbyar ro //🔽kha zas su ni ro bska ba dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba rnams su sbyar na dug gi gnod pa zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: rno ba'i skyug sman dang byug pa sbyar ro // kha zas su ni ro bska ba dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba rnams su sbyar na dug gi gnod pa zhi bar byed do //
translated: and sharp emetics and ointments.🔽For food, use astringent, hot, and sour ingredients.

original: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dug nad la ni bkru sman dang / byug pa dang / blugs pa rnams kyang shin tu bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan par byed do //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dug nad la ni bkru sman dang / byug pa dang / blugs pa rnams kyang shin tu bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan par byed do //
translated: For poisoning with a bile nature, use decoctions, ointments, and enema ingredients that have a very cooling potency.

original: kha zas su ni ro bska ba dang / kha ba dang / mngar ba rnams mar dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //
analyzed: kha zas su ni ro bska ba dang / kha ba dang / mngar ba rnams mar dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //
translated: For food, use astringent, sour, and sweet ingredients mixed with butter.🔽For poisoning with a wind nature, use sweet, oily, sour, and salty ingredients mixed with butter.

original: rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi dug nad la ni sman mngar ba dang / snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / mar dang sbyar ba bza' ba dang / byug pa dang sha la sogs pa sbyar na yang phan no //
analyzed: rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi dug nad la ni sman mngar ba dang / snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / mar dang sbyar ba bza' ba dang / byug pa dang sha la sogs pa sbyar na yang phan no //
translated: They are also helpful for eating, ointments, and meat and so forth.

original: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i dug nad thams cad la ni bkru sman dang / byug pa dang / bza' ba dang / sman thams cad la yang mar dang sbyar ba bsngags te /
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i dug nad thams cad la ni bkru sman dang / byug pa dang / bza' ba dang / sman thams cad la yang mar dang sbyar ba bsngags te /
translated: For all poison diseases caused by contact with poison, purgation, ointments, and all medicines are recommended, especially when combined with ghee.

original: dug 'joms pa la ni mar dang 'dra ba gzhan gang yang med do //
analyzed: dug 'joms pa la ni mar dang 'dra ba gzhan gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing else like ghee for destroying poison.

original: lhag par rlung shas che ba la bzang ngo //
analyzed: lhag par rlung shas che ba la bzang ngo //
translated: It is especially good for those with a predominance of wind.

original: dug bad kan gyi gnas su byung na ni tshegs chung dus gso sla ba yin no //
analyzed: dug bad kan gyi gnas su byung na ni tshegs chung dus gso sla ba yin no //
translated: If the poison arises in the location of phlegm, it is easy to cure with little difficulty.

original: mkhris pa'i gnas su byung na ni gso dka' ba yin no //🔽dug nad kyi dmigs brtag cing gso ba'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa lnga pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mkhris pa'i gnas su byung na ni gso dka' ba yin no // dug nad kyi dmigs brtag cing gso ba'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa lnga pa rdzogs so /
translated: If it arises in the location of bile, it is difficult to cure.

original: // / de nas sbrul gdug pas zin pa gso ba'i cho ga'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas sbrul gdug pas zin pa gso ba'i cho ga'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: This concludes the thirty-fifth chapter, on diagnosing and treating poison diseases, from The Quintessence Tantra, the Secret Oral Tradition of the Eight Branches of the Science of Healing.🔽Chapter Thirty-Six: The Ritual for Treating Bites by Venomous Snakes

original: de la sa'i steng na gnas pa'i sbrul gdug pa can gyi rigs mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sa'i steng na gnas pa'i sbrul gdug pa can gyi rigs mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The types of venomous snakes that live on the earth are, in brief, of three kinds:

original: gdengs ka can dang / lus 'khyil ba dang / khra bo'i rigs dang gsum ste dbye na rnam pa du ma grangs med pa yod mod kyi mdor bsdus te bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gdengs ka can dang / lus 'khyil ba dang / khra bo'i rigs dang gsum ste dbye na rnam pa du ma grangs med pa yod mod kyi mdor bsdus te bshad par bya'o //
translated: The three types of snakes are the hooded, the coiled, and the variegated. Although there are many types of snakes, they can be summarized and explained.

original: sbrul gyi dug de dag gi yon tan ni khyad par du rtsub pa dang / tsha ba dang / skyur ba dang / drod che ba dang / mngar ba dang / bsil ba yin no //
analyzed: sbrul gyi dug de dag gi yon tan ni khyad par du rtsub pa dang / tsha ba dang / skyur ba dang / drod che ba dang / mngar ba dang / bsil ba yin no //
translated: The qualities of snake venom are particularly rough, hot, sour, warm, sweet, and cool.

original: de la sbrul gyi rigs gdengs ka can dang / lus 'khyil ba dang / khra bo'i rigs gsum gyi bye brag las rlung gi rang bzhin dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gyi rang bzhin rnams go rims bzhin du so so nas sbyar ro //🔽de la sbrul gzhon nu'i dug ni dbyar gyi dus su 'phel la sbrul bar ma'i dug ni dgun gyi dus su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la sbrul gyi rigs gdengs ka can dang / lus 'khyil ba dang / khra bo'i rigs gsum gyi bye brag las rlung gi rang bzhin dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gyi rang bzhin rnams go rims bzhin du so so nas sbyar ro // de la sbrul gzhon nu'i dug ni dbyar gyi dus su 'phel la sbrul bar ma'i dug ni dgun gyi dus su 'byung ngo //
translated: Among them, the three types of snakes—the hooded, the coiled, and the variegated—are classified according to their specific natures as wind, bile, and phlegm, respectively.🔽The venom of young snakes increases in the summer, the venom of middle-aged snakes occurs in the winter,

original: sbrul rgan po'i dug ni sos ka tsha ba'i dus su ldang ngo //
analyzed: sbrul rgan po'i dug ni sos ka tsha ba'i dus su ldang ngo //
translated: and the venom of old snakes arises in the spring and hot season.

original: @394b de las gzhan pa'i sbrul gyi dug ni dus tshigs rnams kyi mtshams su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @394b de las gzhan pa'i sbrul gyi dug ni dus tshigs rnams kyi mtshams su 'byung ngo //
translated: The poison of other snakes occurs at the junction of the seasons.

original: 'khor lo dang / gshol dang / gdugs dang / g-yung drung dang / lcags kyu dang / de rnams kyi ri mo'i mtshan dang ldan zhing 'gros shin tu myur ba dang ldan pa de ni sbrul gdengs ka can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang / gshol dang / gdugs dang / g-yung drung dang / lcags kyu dang / de rnams kyi ri mo'i mtshan dang ldan zhing 'gros shin tu myur ba dang ldan pa de ni sbrul gdengs ka can zhes bya'o //
translated: The snake with a wheel, a plow, an umbrella, a swastika, or a hook on its head, which moves very quickly, is called the hooded snake.

original: sbrul 'khyil ba zhes bya ba ni ri mo 'khyil ba'i bye brag sna tshogs su 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: sbrul 'khyil ba zhes bya ba ni ri mo 'khyil ba'i bye brag sna tshogs su 'dug pa yin no //
translated: The coiled snake has various patterns of coils.

original: sbrul gyi rigs khra bo zhes bya ba ni shin tu mdangs gsal ba'i ri mo dang ldan zhing snum pa dang / chu zheng kun tu mdog sna tshogs su ri mo de ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: sbrul gyi rigs khra bo zhes bya ba ni shin tu mdangs gsal ba'i ri mo dang ldan zhing snum pa dang / chu zheng kun tu mdog sna tshogs su ri mo de ltar snang ba'o //
translated: The striped snake has a very bright pattern, is oily, and has a pattern that appears in various colors all over its body.

original: gzhan yang sbrul gyi rigs srog chags go ta'i bu go da ra zhes bya ba'i dug ni sbrul gdengs ka can dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbrul gyi rigs srog chags go ta'i bu go da ra zhes bya ba'i dug ni sbrul gdengs ka can dang 'dra'o //
translated: The poison of the snake species called the spotted snake is similar to that of the hooded snake.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i sbrul gyi rigs rkang pa bzhi pa ni rigs 'dres pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i sbrul gyi rigs rkang pa bzhi pa ni rigs 'dres pa yin te /
translated: Other types of snakes with four legs are mixed types.

original: mtshan nyid dang ri mo yang 'dres par snang ste des zin pa ni 'dus pa'i nad skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ri mo yang 'dres par snang ste des zin pa ni 'dus pa'i nad skyed pa yin no //
translated: Their characteristics and patterns appear mixed, and they cause diseases of the combination type.

original: sbrul gyi dug 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu ni bza'o snyam pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / lhung ba dang / gzhan gyis reg pa dang / khros pa dang / sdig pa'i las dang / lha dang drang srong rnams kyis bskul bas sbrul mi la 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: sbrul gyi dug 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu ni bza'o snyam pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / lhung ba dang / gzhan gyis reg pa dang / khros pa dang / sdig pa'i las dang / lha dang drang srong rnams kyis bskul bas sbrul mi la 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The causes that increase the poison of snakes are thinking “I will eat,” fear, falling, being touched by another, anger, sinful actions, and being seized by a snake because of being urged by gods and sages.

original: de dag ni yams kyi rims bzhin du tsha bas che ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni yams kyi rims bzhin du tsha bas che ba yin no //
translated: These are greater than contagious fevers because of their heat.

original: de ltar sbrul gyis zin pa'i rgyu ji lta ba bzhin du shes nas de lta de ltar gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sbrul gyis zin pa'i rgyu ji lta ba bzhin du shes nas de lta de ltar gso bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, having understood the causes of being seized by a snake, one should treat it in this way and that way.

original: sbrul gyi rigs de las gzhan pa sdig pa byed pas lam bcad de gnas nas gang du skyes bu rgyu ba'i lus kha chu dang / dri ma dang / rnag tsam gyis reg cing gnod par byas te mche ba'i rma ni snang ba de ni mchus gnod par byed pa zhes bya'o //🔽gang gi lus la mche ba gcig gam /
analyzed: sbrul gyi rigs de las gzhan pa sdig pa byed pas lam bcad de gnas nas gang du skyes bu rgyu ba'i lus kha chu dang / dri ma dang / rnag tsam gyis reg cing gnod par byas te mche ba'i rma ni snang ba de ni mchus gnod par byed pa zhes bya'o // gang gi lus la mche ba gcig gam /
translated: The other type of snake is the one that blocks the path with its body, and wherever a person goes, it bites him with its fangs, causing him to be afflicted by saliva, excrement, pus, and blood. This is called the “one that bites with its mouth.”

original: gnyis kyi rjes snang zhing khrag med pa de ni bya di da zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rjes snang zhing khrag med pa de ni bya di da zhes bya'o //
translated: The one that has the marks of one or two fangs without blood is called the “one that bites with its beak.”

analyzed: mche ba gnyis kyi rjes snang zhing khrag dang bcas pa de ni bya lupta zhes bya'o //

original: mche ba gsum gyis bzung ste sha la sogs pa phug cing khrag rgyu ba'i gnas rnams su mche bas phog pa de ni bi tshi na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mche ba gsum gyis bzung ste sha la sogs pa phug cing khrag rgyu ba'i gnas rnams su mche bas phog pa de ni bi tshi na zhes bya'o //
translated: The one that is bitten by three fangs and whose flesh and so on is pierced and whose blood vessels are struck by the fangs is called the “one that bites with its beak, claws, and fangs.”

original: mche ba bzhis khrag gi gnas phug ste khrag 'dzag pa de ni bi ti ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mche ba bzhis khrag gi gnas phug ste khrag 'dzag pa de ni bi ti ta zhes bya'o //
translated: The one that is bitten by four fangs and whose blood vessels are pierced and whose blood flows is called the “one that bites with its beak, claws, fangs, and blood.”

original: de la dang po gnyis ni dug med pa yin no //

original: des bzung ba 'am yang na srog chags gang yang rung ba nub mo ma tshor bar zin pa las bdag ni sbrul gyis zin no snyam nas dug gis rtog par rims dang / skyugs pa dang / brgyal ba dang / lus tsha ba skye ba 'am /
analyzed: des bzung ba 'am yang na srog chags gang yang rung ba nub mo ma tshor bar zin pa las bdag ni sbrul gyis zin no snyam nas dug gis rtog par rims dang / skyugs pa dang / brgyal ba dang / lus tsha ba skye ba 'am /
translated: Or else, a person is bitten by a snake at night without being aware of it. He thinks, “I have been bitten by a snake,” and the poison spreads through his imagination. He has a fever, vomits, faints, and his body becomes hot.

original: yang na mi bde ba 'am /
analyzed: yang na mi bde ba 'am /
translated: Or else, he is not comfortable,

original: rmongs bag tu 'dug pa dang / tshad par 'khru ba de ni rtog pa las gyur pa'i dug nad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rmongs bag tu 'dug pa dang / tshad par 'khru ba de ni rtog pa las gyur pa'i dug nad ces bya'o //
translated: or he is confused, or he has diarrhea, or he is delirious. This is called “poisoning by imagination.”

original: sbrul gyis zin pa'i rma nad dang bcas pa las skrang ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / zug gzer dang ldan pa dang / tsha ba 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / rmen bu bu ga mdud pa ltar snang na ni dug dang bcas pa yin la de las bzlog par ni dug med pa yin no //
analyzed: sbrul gyis zin pa'i rma nad dang bcas pa las skrang ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / zug gzer dang ldan pa dang / tsha ba 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / rmen bu bu ga mdud pa ltar snang na ni dug dang bcas pa yin la de las bzlog par ni dug med pa yin no //
translated: If the wound of a snake bite is swollen, itchy, painful, hot, and throbbing, and if the lymph nodes appear knotted, then the poison is present. If it is the opposite, then the poison is absent.

original: de la gdengs ka chen po'i sbrul gyis zin pa'i dug gi shugs rnam pa bdun du gyur te /
analyzed: de la gdengs ka chen po'i sbrul gyis zin pa'i dug gi shugs rnam pa bdun du gyur te /
translated: In the case of a bite by a hooded cobra, the force of the poison becomes sevenfold.

original: de yang dang po ni khrag skyon dang bcas shing nag por 'gyur ba de bzhin du rma kha la sogs pa thams cad du mdog gnag cing lus la grog ma mang po rgyu ba snyam sems pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dang po ni khrag skyon dang bcas shing nag por 'gyur ba de bzhin du rma kha la sogs pa thams cad du mdog gnag cing lus la grog ma mang po rgyu ba snyam sems pa yin no //
translated: The first stage is when the blood is vitiated and turns black. Similarly, in all wounds, etc., the color becomes dark and one feels as if many ants are crawling on the body.

original: gnas skabs gnyis pa la thor bur skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gnyis pa la thor bur skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the second stage, [the blood] arises in pieces.

original: gsum pa la ni mgo lci zhing dud pa dang / glo snying mi bde ba dang / rma rnags pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni mgo lci zhing dud pa dang / glo snying mi bde ba dang / rma rnags pa'o //
translated: In the third, the head becomes heavy and droops, there is discomfort in the chest and heart, and the wound becomes putrid.

original: bzhi pa la ni mchil ma mang ba dang / skyugs pa dang / tshigs rnams 'bye ba dang / sgyid skyur ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni mchil ma mang ba dang / skyugs pa dang / tshigs rnams 'bye ba dang / sgyid skyur ba rnams yin no //
translated: In the fourth, there is much saliva, vomiting, separation of the joints, and lassitude.

original: lnga pa la ni tshigs rnams 'jig pa dang / tsha ba 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / skyigs bu 'byung ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni tshigs rnams 'jig pa dang / tsha ba 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / skyigs bu 'byung ba rnams yin no //
translated: In the fifth, the joints are destroyed, there is a burning sensation, and hiccups occur.

original: drug pa la ni glo snying na ba dang / khong lci ba dang / brgyal ba dang / kha zas yi gar mi 'ju ba dang tshad pas 'khru ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: drug pa la ni glo snying na ba dang / khong lci ba dang / brgyal ba dang / kha zas yi gar mi 'ju ba dang tshad pas 'khru ba rnams yin no //
translated: In the sixth, there is pain in the chest and heart, heaviness in the stomach, fainting, and indigestion with fever.

original: @395b bdun pa la ni khu chu'i nus pa phyin te phrag gong dang / rgyab kyi sgal tshigs dang / rked pa'i tshigs rnams 'jig pa dang / spyod lam thams cad las ldog cing nub pa yin no //
analyzed: @395b bdun pa la ni khu chu'i nus pa phyin te phrag gong dang / rgyab kyi sgal tshigs dang / rked pa'i tshigs rnams 'jig pa dang / spyod lam thams cad las ldog cing nub pa yin no //
translated: In the seventh stage, the power of the semen is exhausted, and the shoulders, the vertebrae of the back, and the vertebrae of the waist break, and all activities are reversed and decline.

original: sbrul 'khyil ba'i rigs kyis zin pa la ni dug gi shugs lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbrul 'khyil ba'i rigs kyis zin pa la ni dug gi shugs lngar 'gyur te /
translated: When bitten by a coiled-type snake, the force of the poison has five stages.

original: dang po la khrag 'dzag pa skyon can du byas nas ser por 'gyur la des lus dang / yan lag ser por 'gyur zhing tsha ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po la khrag 'dzag pa skyon can du byas nas ser por 'gyur la des lus dang / yan lag ser por 'gyur zhing tsha ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first stage, the blood is made defective and flows, turning yellow, and by that the body and limbs turn yellow and a fever arises.

original: gnas skabs gnyis pa la ni skrang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gnyis pa la ni skrang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the second stage, there is swelling.

original: gsum pa la ni rma rnags pa dang / rngu ba la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni rma rnags pa dang / rngu ba la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the third stage, sores, pus, and so on arise.

original: bzhi pa la ni rims kyis 'debs shing lus tsha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni rims kyis 'debs shing lus tsha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the fourth stage, there is a fever in the body due to a contagious disease.

original: lnga pa la ni lus thams cad du khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni lus thams cad du khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the fifth stage, the body is pervaded.

original: sbrul khra bo'i rigs kyis zin pa la gnas skabs lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbrul khra bo'i rigs kyis zin pa la gnas skabs lngar 'gyur te /
translated: When bitten by a multicolored-type snake, there are five stages.

original: dang po ni khrag ma rungs par byas nas mdog dkar bar 'gyur ba dang lus thams cad kyang dkar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po ni khrag ma rungs par byas nas mdog dkar bar 'gyur ba dang lus thams cad kyang dkar por 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first stage, the blood becomes vitiated and the complexion becomes pale, and the whole body becomes pale.

original: gnyis pa la ni lus thams cad kyang shin tu lci bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni lus thams cad kyang shin tu lci bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the second stage, the whole body becomes very heavy.

original: gsum pa la ni rma rul zhing rnags pa dang / sna dang / mig dang / kha'i nang nas 'dzag pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni rma rul zhing rnags pa dang / sna dang / mig dang / kha'i nang nas 'dzag pa yin no //
translated: In the third stage, the wounds become putrid and festering, and ooze from the nose, eyes, and mouth.

original: bzhi pa la ni mgo lci ba dang / gnya' ba rengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni mgo lci ba dang / gnya' ba rengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the fourth stage, the head becomes heavy and the neck stiff.

original: lnga pa la ni skad nyams pa dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / grang ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni skad nyams pa dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / grang ba rnams yin no //
translated: In the fifth stage, the voice is impaired, one is afflicted by fever, and one feels cold.

original: lhag ma rnams ni sbrul gdengs ka can dang 'khyil pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sbrul gdengs ka can dang 'khyil pa bzhin no //
translated: The remaining stages are like a snake with a hood and coils.

original: de bas na dug gi shugs gnas skabs lnga pa la ni 'bad pa dang bcas pas gso ba myur du bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dug gi shugs gnas skabs lnga pa la ni 'bad pa dang bcas pas gso ba myur du bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in the fifth stage of the progression of poison, one should quickly and diligently treat it.

original: sbrul chu'i nang du brgyal ba dang ; 'khrig pa zin nas nyam chung ba dang / sre mos 'jigs pa dang / sre mos pham par byas nas /
analyzed: sbrul chu'i nang du brgyal ba dang ; 'khrig pa zin nas nyam chung ba dang / sre mos 'jigs pa dang / sre mos pham par byas nas /
translated: A snake that has been stunned in water, that has recently mated and is weak, that is frightened by a mongoose, or that has been defeated by a mongoose,

original: shin tu grang ba'i rlung gis brten pa dang / tsha bas gdungs pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / skom pa dang / bkres pas gdungs pa dang / shin tu ngal ba dang lam ring po nas 'ongs te dub pa dang / sbrul spyod lam de dag ltar 'dug na ni sbrul gyi gdug pa med cing nyam thag pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu grang ba'i rlung gis brten pa dang / tsha bas gdungs pa dang / nad kyis gzir ba dang / skom pa dang / bkres pas gdungs pa dang / shin tu ngal ba dang lam ring po nas 'ongs te dub pa dang / sbrul spyod lam de dag ltar 'dug na ni sbrul gyi gdug pa med cing nyam thag pa yin no //
translated: If the snake is lying down in a place where it is very cold, or is tormented by heat, or is afflicted by illness, or is tormented by thirst and hunger, or is very tired, or is exhausted from coming a long way, then the snake is powerless and helpless.

original: / sbrul de rtsva ku sha dang / sman dang / tsher ma dang ldan pa'i nags rnams su rgyu ba yin na ni sbrul de'i dug gi nyes pa med cing dug dang bral ba yin @396a * //
analyzed: / sbrul de rtsva ku sha dang / sman dang / tsher ma dang ldan pa'i nags rnams su rgyu ba yin na ni sbrul de'i dug gi nyes pa med cing dug dang bral ba yin @396a * //
translated: If the snake moves in a forest with kuśa grass, medicinal herbs, and thorns, then the snake is free from the fault of poison and is free from venom.

original: no ; sbrul de dur khrod dang / mchod rten la sogs pa'i nang du rgyu ba dang / tshes lnga dang / bco lnga dang / gnam stong dang / tshes brgyad dang / tshes dgu dang / srod dang / tho rangs dang / nam phyed dang /
analyzed: no ; sbrul de dur khrod dang / mchod rten la sogs pa'i nang du rgyu ba dang / tshes lnga dang / bco lnga dang / gnam stong dang / tshes brgyad dang / tshes dgu dang / srod dang / tho rangs dang / nam phyed dang /
translated: If the snake moves in a cemetery, a temple, and so on, on the fifth, the fifteenth, the thirtieth, the eighth, the ninth, in the evening, in the morning, or at midnight, then the snake is powerless and helpless.

original: nyi ma gung dang / dus de dag tu sbrul gyis zin pa dang / rgyu skar bra nye dang / smin drug dang / mchu dang / skag dang / sa ga dang / gre dang / chu stod dang / khrums stod dang / snubs dang /
analyzed: nyi ma gung dang / dus de dag tu sbrul gyis zin pa dang / rgyu skar bra nye dang / smin drug dang / mchu dang / skag dang / sa ga dang / gre dang / chu stod dang / khrums stod dang / snubs dang /
translated: or under the lunar mansions of Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Mṛgaśirā, Punarvasu, Puṣya, Āśleṣā, Maghā, Uttarāṣāḍhā, Uttarabhādrapadā, and Revatī,

original: gzhan yang ne re ta zhes bya ba'i yud tsam gyi dus dang / dus de dag tu gnad du bsnun par zin na ni spang bar bya'o //🔽skyes bu gang sbrul gyis zin ma thag mig dang gdong dkar por 'gyur ba dang / skra 'byi zhing rang lhags pa dang / lce gyong ba dang / yang dang yang brgyal ba dang / dbugs grang mo 'thon pa de ni mi 'tsho'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ne re ta zhes bya ba'i yud tsam gyi dus dang / dus de dag tu gnad du bsnun par zin na ni spang bar bya'o // skyes bu gang sbrul gyis zin ma thag mig dang gdong dkar por 'gyur ba dang / skra 'byi zhing rang lhags pa dang / lce gyong ba dang / yang dang yang brgyal ba dang / dbugs grang mo 'thon pa de ni mi 'tsho'o //
translated: and also at the time of the moment called Neretā, if bitten at these times, it should be abandoned.🔽If a person, immediately after being bitten by a snake, the eyes and face turn white, the hair stands on end, the tongue is stiff, he faints again and again, and cold breath comes out, he will not live.

original: gzhan yang sbrul gyi dug gis zin ma thag tu skyigs bu dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / lud pa lu ba dang / skyugs pa dang / cig car glo snying na zhing zug pa de ni mi 'tsho'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbrul gyi dug gis zin ma thag tu skyigs bu dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / lud pa lu ba dang / skyugs pa dang / cig car glo snying na zhing zug pa de ni mi 'tsho'o //
translated: Moreover, if, immediately after being bitten by a snake, there is hiccups, dyspnea, coughing, vomiting, and a sudden pain in the chest and heart, he will not live.

original: dug 'thung ngam /🔽dug bzung ngam /
analyzed: dug 'thung ngam / dug bzung ngam /
translated: Or,🔽has he drunk poison?

original: dug mdas phog gam /
analyzed: dug mdas phog gam /
translated: Or has he been struck by a poisoned arrow?

original: dug gis phog kyang rung ste /
analyzed: dug gis phog kyang rung ste /
translated: Or has he been struck by poison?

original: rtags 'di dag dang ldan na skyes bu de nges par 'chi zhing 'tsho ba spang ba yin te /
analyzed: rtags 'di dag dang ldan na skyes bu de nges par 'chi zhing 'tsho ba spang ba yin te /
translated: If a person has these signs, he is certainly going to die and should be abandoned.

original: de yang lbu ba skyugs pa dang / 'du shes nyams pa dang / rkang pa dang / lag pa dang / gdong rnams gnag cing sngo bsangs su gyur pa dang / sna zhom pa dang / yan lag rnams zhig pa dang / tshigs lhod pa dang /
analyzed: de yang lbu ba skyugs pa dang / 'du shes nyams pa dang / rkang pa dang / lag pa dang / gdong rnams gnag cing sngo bsangs su gyur pa dang / sna zhom pa dang / yan lag rnams zhig pa dang / tshigs lhod pa dang /
translated: Moreover, if he vomits foam, loses his sense of smell, and his feet, hands, and face become dark and pale, his nose flattens, his limbs disintegrate, his joints loosen,

original: phyi sa sla zhing khong 'khru ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: phyi sa sla zhing khong 'khru ba rnams yin no //
translated: and his feces become loose and his stomach gurgles,

original: gzhan yang sna sman rnon po la sogs pa sbyar yang 'du shes mi rnyed pa dang / smas sam mtshon gyis smas na yang khrag mi 'byung ba dang / dbyug pas bsnun kyang rjes su rmugs par mi mngon pa de ni gshin rje'i khyim gyi nang du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang sna sman rnon po la sogs pa sbyar yang 'du shes mi rnyed pa dang / smas sam mtshon gyis smas na yang khrag mi 'byung ba dang / dbyug pas bsnun kyang rjes su rmugs par mi mngon pa de ni gshin rje'i khyim gyi nang du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: even if he applies strong nasal medicine and so on, he will not regain his sense of smell, and if he is cut or wounded, blood will not come out, and even if he is beaten with a stick, no bruise will appear. He has entered the house of Yama.

original: 'chi ba'i mtshan ma de dag dang mi ldan na ni sman pas myur du khyim la me mched pa bzhin du gso bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mtshan ma de dag dang mi ldan na ni sman pas myur du khyim la me mched pa bzhin du gso bar bya ste /
translated: If the patient does not have these signs of death, the physician should quickly treat him as if his house were on fire.

original: dug gi nad kyis srog lkog mar phyin pa tsam la bsrung zhing zhi bar bya ba la 'bad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dug gi nad kyis srog lkog mar phyin pa tsam la bsrung zhing zhi bar bya ba la 'bad par bya ba yin no //
translated: He should strive to protect and pacify the life force, which is like a poison that has reached the throat.

original: sbrul gyis bzung ma thag nas se gol gtogs pa brgya'i bar du ni rma kha de nyid na dug 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: sbrul gyis bzung ma thag nas se gol gtogs pa brgya'i bar du ni rma kha de nyid na dug 'dug pa yin no //
translated: As soon as one is bitten by a snake, the poison remains in the wound for as long as it takes to snap one’s fingers a hundred times.

original: de phan chad ni lus kyi khrag la @396b sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams rim gyis khyab cing 'gro bar byed do /
analyzed: de phan chad ni lus kyi khrag la @396b sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams rim gyis khyab cing 'gro bar byed do /
translated: After that, it gradually spreads and moves through the body’s constituents, such as the blood.

original: dug de khrag las gyur pa'i nang du ma khyab pa'i gong du de ma thag par rma'i thon 'khor bcad pa la sogs pa'i las ci ltar rigs par bsnyur te bya'o //
analyzed: dug de khrag las gyur pa'i nang du ma khyab pa'i gong du de ma thag par rma'i thon 'khor bcad pa la sogs pa'i las ci ltar rigs par bsnyur te bya'o //
translated: Before the poison spreads through the blood, one should immediately apply a compress to the wound, and so forth, as appropriate.

original: sbrul gyis zin pa de ma thag par sbrul de nyid myur du bzung ste /
analyzed: sbrul gyis zin pa de ma thag par sbrul de nyid myur du bzung ste /
translated: As soon as one is bitten by a snake, one should quickly catch that very snake.

original: rang gi sos gcad pa 'am /
analyzed: rang gi sos gcad pa 'am /
translated: One should cut off its head with one’s teeth.

original: sbrul ma zin na yang rung ste nye 'khor na bong pa 'am sa 'am /
analyzed: sbrul ma zin na yang rung ste nye 'khor na bong pa 'am sa 'am /
translated: Whether or not you catch the snake, you should throw clods of earth or stones at it.

original: shing la sogs pa ci mthong yang sos bcad de /🔽de ma thag glo bur du 'byung zhing rang gi mchil ma 'am /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa ci mthong yang sos bcad de / de ma thag glo bur du 'byung zhing rang gi mchil ma 'am /
translated: Whether or not the snake is caught, whatever is seen nearby, such as a clod of earth or a piece of wood,🔽is cut off with a knife.🔽Immediately, the wound of the snake bite is anointed with one’s own saliva

original: rna spabs kyis sbrul gyis zin pa'i rma la gdab po //
analyzed: rna spabs kyis sbrul gyis zin pa'i rma la gdab po //
translated: or earwax.🔽Then, above the wound, a string of lungtendons about four finger-widths long is tied on.

original: de nas rma'i gong rol du lung tang gi phreng ba sor bzhi tsam chings shig / zar ma dang 'od ma la sogs pa'i skud pa la shes par grub pa'i sngags kyis btab ste /
analyzed: de nas rma'i gong rol du lung tang gi phreng ba sor bzhi tsam chings shig / zar ma dang 'od ma la sogs pa'i skud pa la shes par grub pa'i sngags kyis btab ste /
translated: A thread of hemp, bamboo, or the like is enchanted with the mantra of knowledge and tightly bound.

original: dam du bcings te mnan na ji ltar chu bo la chu lon gyis bzlog pa dang 'dra bar rtsa'i rgyun srang rnams su dug rgyur mi ster zhing gcod par byed do //
analyzed: dam du bcings te mnan na ji ltar chu bo la chu lon gyis bzlog pa dang 'dra bar rtsa'i rgyun srang rnams su dug rgyur mi ster zhing gcod par byed do //
translated: When pressed down, just as a river is blocked by a dam, the flow of poison is prevented from moving through the channels and veins, and is cut off.

original: gnad dang tshigs rnams su sbrul gyis bzung ba la ni 'phral du dam du btsir zhing dug gzag cing dbyung ba byas na dug gi nad kyi shugs mi skye zhing ji ltar sa bon nyams pa'i myu gu bzhin no ;
analyzed: gnad dang tshigs rnams su sbrul gyis bzung ba la ni 'phral du dam du btsir zhing dug gzag cing dbyung ba byas na dug gi nad kyi shugs mi skye zhing ji ltar sa bon nyams pa'i myu gu bzhin no ;
translated: If a snake has seized a person at the joints or vital points, then if one immediately presses hard and causes the poison to spread and be expelled, the force of the poison’s disease will not arise, just like a sprout whose seed has been damaged.

original: / sbrul gyi rigs 'khyil bas bzung ba'i rma ni mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas de la ni myur du gser dang lcags la sogs pa me la bsregs pa 'am /
analyzed: / sbrul gyi rigs 'khyil bas bzung ba'i rma ni mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas de la ni myur du gser dang lcags la sogs pa me la bsregs pa 'am /
translated: A wound seized by a coiled type of snake is of the nature of bile, so if one quickly burns it with gold, iron, and so on, heated in fire,

original: yang na mgal mes rma kha bsregs par byas na dug gi nus pa thal bar rlag par byed do //
analyzed: yang na mgal mes rma kha bsregs par byas na dug gi nus pa thal bar rlag par byed do //
translated: or else burns the wound with a fire drill, the power of the poison will be destroyed.

original: de tsam gyis las sus mi bzod de bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis las sus mi bzod de bzod par bya'o //
translated: No one can bear that much, so one should bear it.

original: me'i las de ma gtogs pa gzhan ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: me'i las de ma gtogs pa gzhan ni mi bya'o //
translated: Except for that fiery action, one should not do anything else.

original: de'i 'og tu rma kha gzhibs te kha bkang la phyir dbo'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rma kha gzhibs te kha bkang la phyir dbo'o //
translated: After that, one should close the wound, fill it, and expel it outside.

original: de nas sa 'am thal ba 'am /🔽dug 'joms pa'i sman nam /
analyzed: de nas sa 'am thal ba 'am / dug 'joms pa'i sman nam /
translated: Then one should apply earth, ash,🔽medicinal plants that destroy poison,

original: ba lang gi lci bas rma kha la gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi lci bas rma kha la gdab par bya'o //
translated: or cow dung to the wound.

original: gal te dug des nang du khyab par song ba dang / lhag par sha che ba la ni rma dang lus su bcas pa thams cad la dug 'joms pa'i sman gyis bsku byug bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dug des nang du khyab par song ba dang / lhag par sha che ba la ni rma dang lus su bcas pa thams cad la dug 'joms pa'i sman gyis bsku byug bya'o //
translated: If the poison has spread inside the body, especially to the flesh, then all wounds and the body should be anointed with medicines that destroy poison.

original: tsandan dang pu shel tse chu dang sbyar bas blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan dang pu shel tse chu dang sbyar bas blugs par bya'o //
translated: It should be poured with sandalwood and pusheltse mixed with water.

original: dug des kun la khyab pa la ni gtar ga byas te khrag phyung na gso ba'i mchog yin te /
analyzed: dug des kun la khyab pa la ni gtar ga byas te khrag phyung na gso ba'i mchog yin te /
translated: If the poison has spread everywhere, then the best cure is to open a vein and let blood.

original: khrag mang du phyung na ni dug gi rang bzhin @397a * //
analyzed: khrag mang du phyung na ni dug gi rang bzhin @397a * //
translated: If a lot of blood is let out, then the nature of the poison

original: nag po yang 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: nag po yang 'byung ba yin no //
translated: will also come out.

original: de la dug yod pa'i khrag ni dri nga ba dang / me'i nang du bsregs na sreg sreg zer ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dug yod pa'i khrag ni dri nga ba dang / me'i nang du bsregs na sreg sreg zer ba yin no //
translated: The blood that has poison in it will smell bad and when burned in fire, it will make a sizzling sound.

original: de ltar khrag phyung ste dag pa lta na khrag de nad gzhi ci lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ste brtag go //
analyzed: de ltar khrag phyung ste dag pa lta na khrag de nad gzhi ci lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ste brtag go //
translated: If the blood is let out like that and the blood is examined, then the blood should be analyzed according to the nature of the disease.

original: rtsa mi snang ba la ni rva dang srin bu bad pa gnyis kyis khrag dbyung ngo //
analyzed: rtsa mi snang ba la ni rva dang srin bu bad pa gnyis kyis khrag dbyung ngo //
translated: If the pulse is not visible, then blood should be let with a horn and a worm.

original: khrag phyung ba'i lhag ma yod pa dug gi slan ter byas pa de ni lhag par bsil ba'i sman gyis blugs pa dang / byug pa la sogs pa lan mang du byas te bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: khrag phyung ba'i lhag ma yod pa dug gi slan ter byas pa de ni lhag par bsil ba'i sman gyis blugs pa dang / byug pa la sogs pa lan mang du byas te bzlog par bya'o //
translated: The remaining poison that has not been expelled should be treated with a cooling medicine, and the patient should be treated many times with cooling ointments and so on.

original: sbrul gyis zin te dug gi mthus brgyal bar byed pa dang / snying 'dzag pa la ni sman bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pas blugs pa dang / gtor ba dang rlung g-yab kyis g-yab par byas te spu zing zhes byed du bcug na dug gi mthu rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbrul gyis zin te dug gi mthus brgyal bar byed pa dang / snying 'dzag pa la ni sman bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pas blugs pa dang / gtor ba dang rlung g-yab kyis g-yab par byas te spu zing zhes byed du bcug na dug gi mthu rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the patient has fainted from the power of the poison of a snake bite, or if the heart is sinking, the poison will be pacified by the power of a cooling medicine, sprinkling, and fanning with a yak-tail fan, causing the hair to stand on end.

original: dug shin tu rno bas snying brus pa snyam sems pa la ni mar nyi tshe'am /
analyzed: dug shin tu rno bas snying brus pa snyam sems pa la ni mar nyi tshe'am /
translated: If the patient feels as if the heart is being torn out by very sharp poison, he should be given clarified butter in small doses.

original: yang na dug 'joms pa'i sman dang / mar dang sbrang rtsi sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na dug 'joms pa'i sman dang / mar dang sbrang rtsi sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Or he should be given a medicine that counteracts poison, mixed with clarified butter and honey.

original: snying la dug bab na ni der bad kan nye bar shas cher sogs shing 'phel te /
analyzed: snying la dug bab na ni der bad kan nye bar shas cher sogs shing 'phel te /
translated: If the poison has reached the heart, phlegm will increase and spread there.

original: lus lci ba dang / nad 'khrugs shing brang tsha la kha nas chu skyur 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: lus lci ba dang / nad 'khrugs shing brang tsha la kha nas chu skyur 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The body becomes heavy, the disease is agitated, the chest is hot, and sour water comes from the mouth.

original: de la ni skyug sman gtang ngo //
analyzed: de la ni skyug sman gtang ngo //
translated: In this case, emetic medicine should be given.

original: de ltar slon bya ba de yang rtsabs skyur po dang / rgya sran dang / til mar dang / chang la sogs pa de dag spangs te gang yang dug 'joms pa'i sman dang slon byas na dug gis kun tu khyab par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar slon bya ba de yang rtsabs skyur po dang / rgya sran dang / til mar dang / chang la sogs pa de dag spangs te gang yang dug 'joms pa'i sman dang slon byas na dug gis kun tu khyab par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, those who are to be treated should avoid sour roots, beans, sesame oil, alcohol, and so on. If treated with medicines that overcome poison and emetics, the poison will not spread.

original: sbrul gyi dug gi rang bzhin dang / mi'i nad gzhi'i rang bzhin dang / gnas kyi bye brag zhib tu legs par brtags te gso ba rnams ma nor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbrul gyi dug gi rang bzhin dang / mi'i nad gzhi'i rang bzhin dang / gnas kyi bye brag zhib tu legs par brtags te gso ba rnams ma nor bar bya'o //
translated: The nature of snake poison, the nature of human disease, and the specific location should be carefully examined, and the treatments should be done without error.

original: shing sin du ba ra'i rtsa ba dang / gi ri kar ni ka dkar po dang gnyis kyi btung ba sbrul gdengs ka chen pos zin pa la sbyar ro //
analyzed: shing sin du ba ra'i rtsa ba dang / gi ri kar ni ka dkar po dang gnyis kyi btung ba sbrul gdengs ka chen pos zin pa la sbyar ro //
translated: The drink of Sindhuvara root and white Girikarnika should be applied to those bitten by a large hooded snake.

original: pa ka la dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba rnams sna sman du blud do //
analyzed: pa ka la dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba rnams sna sman du blud do //
translated: Pakala mixed with honey should be used as a nasal medication.

original: sbrul nag pos zin pa la ni thog mar khrag gtar te de'i 'og tu tsa ra ti dang / na ku li rnam gnyis dang sbyar ba 'am /
analyzed: sbrul nag pos zin pa la ni thog mar khrag gtar te de'i 'og tu tsa ra ti dang / na ku li rnam gnyis dang sbyar ba 'am /
translated: For a bite by a black snake, first let blood and then apply a paste of either Tsara ti and Nakuli,

original: yang na shi kru dang / bong nga dkar po gnyis dang sbyar ba gang yang rung ba'i lde gus bsku'o //
analyzed: yang na shi kru dang / bong nga dkar po gnyis dang sbyar ba gang yang rung ba'i lde gus bsku'o //
translated: or Shi kru and white Bong nga.

original: btsod dang / dud pa dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba btung bar blud do //
analyzed: btsod dang / dud pa dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba btung bar blud do //
translated: Give a drink of a mixture of Tsod, Dud, butter, and honey.

original: rgya sne'u dang / tang phal dang / gi ri @397b ka rnam gnyis dang / kha lung dang / kha ra dkar po dang / she lu dang / de rnams kyi btung ba dang sna sman du sbyar na phan no //
analyzed: rgya sne'u dang / tang phal dang / gi ri @397b ka rnam gnyis dang / kha lung dang / kha ra dkar po dang / she lu dang / de rnams kyi btung ba dang sna sman du sbyar na phan no //
translated: A drink and nasal medication prepared from Gya ne’u, Tang phal, the two Giri karas, Kha lung, white sugar, and She lu are beneficial.

original: de bzhin du gdengs ka chen po'i sbrul gyi gdug pa mi bzad pa dang / sbrul gyi rigs khra bo la yang dug 'joms pa'i sman de dag sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gdengs ka chen po'i sbrul gyi gdug pa mi bzad pa dang / sbrul gyi rigs khra bo la yang dug 'joms pa'i sman de dag sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, apply those medicines that eliminate poison for the unbearable poison of a large hood snake and for a multicolored snake.

original: aa shra gandha dang / rgun 'bru dang / gi ri ka dkar po dang / sa nag po dang / pi pi ling dang / de rnams cha mnyam pa dang / byi'u rug pa dang / ka phid tha dang / bil ba dang / se'u dang /
analyzed: aa shra gandha dang / rgun 'bru dang / gi ri ka dkar po dang / sa nag po dang / pi pi ling dang / de rnams cha mnyam pa dang / byi'u rug pa dang / ka phid tha dang / bil ba dang / se'u dang /
translated: Ashvagandha, grapes, white giri kaka, black earth, and pippali, each in equal parts,

original: de rnams kyi lo ma rnams re re yang aa shva gandha'i cha phyed phyed sbrang rtsi dang ldan par sbyar te zos na sbrul 'khyil ba zhes bya ba'i dug la khyad par du phan no //
