analyzed: de rnams kyi lo ma rnams re re yang aa shva gandha'i cha phyed phyed sbrang rtsi dang ldan par sbyar te zos na sbrul 'khyil ba zhes bya ba'i dug la khyad par du phan no //
translated: and each half the amount of ashvagandha, mixed with honey, if eaten, is especially beneficial for the poison called coiled snake.

original: shing 'o ma can lnga'i shun pa dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / shing mngar dang / n'a ga pushpa dang / ae la ba lu dang / dzi ba ka dang / zangs rtsi ba dang / pu shel tse dang / kha ra dkar po dang /
analyzed: shing 'o ma can lnga'i shun pa dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / shing mngar dang / n'a ga pushpa dang / ae la ba lu dang / dzi ba ka dang / zangs rtsi ba dang / pu shel tse dang / kha ra dkar po dang /
translated: The bark of the five milky trees, the three fruits, sweet wood, nagapuspa, ela, jivaka, copper ore, pushkalika, white sugar,

original: shug pa dang / autpa la dang / de rnams sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i dug sman ni gangs can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shug pa dang / autpa la dang / de rnams sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i dug sman ni gangs can zhes bya ste /
translated: juniper, and utpala, mixed with honey, is the medicine called snow mountain.

original: de'i 'dag gus bskus na sbrul 'khyil ba'i dug 'joms te /
analyzed: de'i 'dag gus bskus na sbrul 'khyil ba'i dug 'joms te /
translated: If one anoints with the juice of that, it destroys the poison of a coiled snake.

original: de bzhin du skrang ba dang / shu ba mched pa dang / 'brum bu dang / rims dang / lus tsha ba rnams la phan no //
analyzed: de bzhin du skrang ba dang / shu ba mched pa dang / 'brum bu dang / rims dang / lus tsha ba rnams la phan no //
translated: Likewise, it is beneficial for swelling, spreading erysipelas, smallpox, fever, and bodily heat.🔽The juice of boiled🔽tangu, nyagrodha sprouts,

original: tang bal dang / n+ya gro dha'i myu gu dang / dzi ba ka dang / zangs rtsi ba dang / kha ra dkar po dang / btsod dang / shing mngar dang / de rnams bskol ba'i khu ba blud na sbrul 'khyil bas zin pa 'joms so //
analyzed: tang bal dang / n+ya gro dha'i myu gu dang / dzi ba ka dang / zangs rtsi ba dang / kha ra dkar po dang / btsod dang / shing mngar dang / de rnams bskol ba'i khu ba blud na sbrul 'khyil bas zin pa 'joms so //
translated: jibaka, copper resin, white sugar, madder, sweet wood, and so forth destroys the poison of a coiled snake.🔽The juice of bamboo bark,🔽seeds, puche shel, patala seeds,🔽chaaga, shrisha seeds, white aconite,🔽gabebu seeds,

original: smyug ma'i shun pa dang / sa bon dang / pu tse shel dang / pa ta la'i sa bon dang / bca' sga dang ; shri sha'i sa bon dang / bong nga dkar po dang / ga be bu ga'i 'bru dang / rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: smyug ma'i shun pa dang / sa bon dang / pu tse shel dang / pa ta la'i sa bon dang / bca' sga dang ; shri sha'i sa bon dang / bong nga dkar po dang / ga be bu ga'i 'bru dang / rtsa ba dang /
translated: roots,🔽and shudag,

original: shu dag dang / de rnams ba gcin la btab pa'i 'dag gu ni yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shu dag dang / de rnams ba gcin la btab pa'i 'dag gu ni yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: when applied to urine, is called the eight-part decoction.

original: sbrul 'khyil pas zin pa'i rigs go da na sa zhes bya bas zin pa sel to //
analyzed: sbrul 'khyil pas zin pa'i rigs go da na sa zhes bya bas zin pa sel to //
translated: If one is bitten by a coiled snake, one should take the remedy called gonadana.

original: pu tse shel dang ; bong nga dkar po dang / ru rta dang / khyim gyi dud pa dang / ha re nu ka dang / tsha ba gsum dang / rgya spos dang / de rnams lhan cig sbyar ba zos na sbrul khra bos zos pa'i nad sel to //
analyzed: pu tse shel dang ; bong nga dkar po dang / ru rta dang / khyim gyi dud pa dang / ha re nu ka dang / tsha ba gsum dang / rgya spos dang / de rnams lhan cig sbyar ba zos na sbrul khra bos zos pa'i nad sel to //
translated: If one eats a compound of calcite, white mica, mica, house smoke, harītakī, the three hot spices, and olibanum, this will cure the disease of being bitten by a multicolored snake.

original: 'dam bu mda' rgyu dang / dan ti dang gnyis kyi rtsa ba mtho nyi shu'i sa bon 'og na @398a * //🔽mar brkos te phyung la 'bras dang sa gnyis lhan cig byas te byug pas bsku'o //
analyzed: 'dam bu mda' rgyu dang / dan ti dang gnyis kyi rtsa ba mtho nyi shu'i sa bon 'og na @398a * // mar brkos te phyung la 'bras dang sa gnyis lhan cig byas te byug pas bsku'o //
translated: One should dig twenty cubits below the roots of a reed and a dhenḍika,🔽and apply a paste of rice and earth.

original: mar rnying pa'i nang du 'bras bu gsum gyi phye ma btab ste blud la de zhu ba'i tshod tsam nas las byas pa'i zan tshod ma dang bcas pa bza'o //
analyzed: mar rnying pa'i nang du 'bras bu gsum gyi phye ma btab ste blud la de zhu ba'i tshod tsam nas las byas pa'i zan tshod ma dang bcas pa bza'o //
translated: One should drink old butter mixed with the powder of the three fruits, and when it has been digested, one should eat rice with vegetables.

original: ka ra b'i ra dang / aarka'i me tog dang / me tog ku su ma dang / lang ka li'i rtsa ba dang / pi pi ling dang / pa tha dang / na le sham dang / de rnams kyi rtsa ba phye ma rtsabs skyur po dang sbyar te 'thungs na gong ma'i sbrul las gzhan pa'i sbrul gyis zin pa'i dug thams cad la sbyar ro //
analyzed: ka ra b'i ra dang / aarka'i me tog dang / me tog ku su ma dang / lang ka li'i rtsa ba dang / pi pi ling dang / pa tha dang / na le sham dang / de rnams kyi rtsa ba phye ma rtsabs skyur po dang sbyar te 'thungs na gong ma'i sbrul las gzhan pa'i sbrul gyis zin pa'i dug thams cad la sbyar ro //
translated: karavira, arka flower, kusuma, the root of langali, pippali, patha, and nalika. If one drinks a powder of these roots mixed with sour gruel, it is applied to all poisons of snakes other than the above-mentioned cobra.

original: shri sha'i me tog gi rang gi khu ba'i nang du shi kru zhag bdun gyi bar du spangs te /
analyzed: shri sha'i me tog gi rang gi khu ba'i nang du shi kru zhag bdun gyi bar du spangs te /
translated: One should soak sugar in the juice of shrisha flowers for seven nights.

original: de las btung ba dang / snar blugs pa sbyar na sbrul gyis zin pa'i nad thams cad la phan no //
analyzed: de las btung ba dang / snar blugs pa sbyar na sbrul gyis zin pa'i nad thams cad la phan no //
translated: If one drinks and inhales this mixture, it is beneficial for all illnesses caused by snakebites.

original: rgya spos dang ru rta srang gnyis dang mar dang sbrang rtsi srang gnyis dang sbyar ba'i lde gu byin na sbrul gyi rgyal po 'jog pos zin pa la yang sman 'di blud na bde ba sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: rgya spos dang ru rta srang gnyis dang mar dang sbrang rtsi srang gnyis dang sbyar ba'i lde gu byin na sbrul gyi rgyal po 'jog pos zin pa la yang sman 'di blud na bde ba sbyin par byed do //
translated: If one gives a medicinal paste of two suvarnas each of eaglewood and costus, two suvarnas each of ghee and honey, even if bitten by the king of snakes, Takshaka, this medicine will bring relief.

original: sbrul gyi rigs gdengs ka chen pos zin pa'i gnas skabs dang po la ni khrag phyung ste /
analyzed: sbrul gyi rigs gdengs ka chen pos zin pa'i gnas skabs dang po la ni khrag phyung ste /
translated: In the first stage of a bite by a large-hooded serpent, blood should be drawn and

original: mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba myur du blud do //
analyzed: mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba myur du blud do //
translated: a potion of clarified butter and honey should be given immediately.

original: gnas skabs gnyis pa la ni slon bya ste gong ma bzhin du mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar bas bsku'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gnyis pa la ni slon bya ste gong ma bzhin du mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar bas bsku'o //
translated: In the second stage, the patient should be made to vomit and anointed as before with clarified butter and honey.

original: gsum pa la ni dug 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar te sman de nyid kyang snar blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni dug 'joms pa'i sman dang sbyar te sman de nyid kyang snar blugs par bya'o //
translated: In the third stage, a potion of anti-venomous medicine should be given and the same medicine should be used as a nasal medication.

original: bzhi pa la ni skyug sman btang ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni skyug sman btang ste /
translated: In the fourth stage, emetics should be given.

original: nas thug dug 'joms pa'i sman dang lhan cig blud do //
analyzed: nas thug dug 'joms pa'i sman dang lhan cig blud do //
translated: Barley gruel mixed with anti-venomous medicine should be given.

original: lnga pa dang drug pa la ni sman bsil ba dang sbyar ba'i dug sman gtang ngo //
analyzed: lnga pa dang drug pa la ni sman bsil ba dang sbyar ba'i dug sman gtang ngo //
translated: In the fifth and sixth stages, a potion of anti-venomous medicine mixed with cooling medicine should be given.

original: de bzhin du bsil ba'i nus pa sman blugs pa dang / byug pa yang dang yang du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsil ba'i nus pa sman blugs pa dang / byug pa yang dang yang du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, the cooling potency should be applied again and again with nasal medication and ointments.

original: slon sman rnon po blud la de'i 'og tu dug 'joms pa'i sman dang thug par sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: slon sman rnon po blud la de'i 'og tu dug 'joms pa'i sman dang thug par sbyar ba blud do //
translated: A strong emetic should be given and after that a potion of anti-venomous medicine mixed with gruel should be given.

original: gnas skabs bdun pa la ni dug 'joms pa'i sman rnon po dang / mig sman dang / sna sman sbyar ba dang / spyi bor mtshon gyis rgya gram du cung zhig dbral ba'i nang du sha 'am khrag gam pags pa gang yang rung ba gzhug go //
analyzed: gnas skabs bdun pa la ni dug 'joms pa'i sman rnon po dang / mig sman dang / sna sman sbyar ba dang / spyi bor mtshon gyis rgya gram du cung zhig dbral ba'i nang du sha 'am khrag gam pags pa gang yang rung ba gzhug go //
translated: In the seventh stage, one should apply a strong antidote to poison, eye medicine, and nose medicine, and in the center of a slight cross-cut on the head, insert either flesh, blood, or skin.

original: sbrul 'khyil bas bzung ba'i gnas skabs gsum pa la ni slon khrus byas te thug pa blud do //
analyzed: sbrul 'khyil bas bzung ba'i gnas skabs gsum pa la ni slon khrus byas te thug pa blud do //
translated: In the third stage of being seized by a coiled snake, one should bathe and give warm food.

original: dug 'joms pa'i sman ni rno ba dang / yang na shug pa'i sde tshan @398b bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
analyzed: dug 'joms pa'i sman ni rno ba dang / yang na shug pa'i sde tshan @398b bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
translated: One should give a strong antidote to poison, or a decoction of the cardamom group.

original: sbrul khra bos zin pa'i gnas skabs dang po la ni rma la zhal zhal bya ste /
analyzed: sbrul khra bos zin pa'i gnas skabs dang po la ni rma la zhal zhal bya ste /
translated: In the first stage of being bitten by a multicolored snake, one should apply a compress to the wound.

original: de'i 'og tu ku bas khrag phyung ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ku bas khrag phyung ste /
translated: After that, one should draw out the blood with a cucumber.

original: gong ma bzhin du dug 'joms pa'i sman blud do //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du dug 'joms pa'i sman blud do //
translated: As before, one should give an antidote to poison.

original: drug pa la ni sman shin tu rno ba'i mig sman dang snar brngub pa rnams sbyar ro //
analyzed: drug pa la ni sman shin tu rno ba'i mig sman dang snar brngub pa rnams sbyar ro //
translated: In the sixth stage, one should apply very strong medicinal eye ointment and nose drops.

original: gzhan yang grangs ma smos pa rnams ni sbrul gdengs ka chen pos zin pa'i gnas skabs kyi gso ba 'di yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang grangs ma smos pa rnams ni sbrul gdengs ka chen pos zin pa'i gnas skabs kyi gso ba 'di yang sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, the treatment for those not mentioned here is also applied in the case of being bitten by a large-hooded serpent.

original: bud med sbrum ma dang / byis pa dang / rgan po rnams la ni khrag nyung shas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: bud med sbrum ma dang / byis pa dang / rgan po rnams la ni khrag nyung shas dbyung ngo //
translated: For pregnant women, children, and the elderly, bloodletting should be done in small amounts.

original: shing tsha dang / ldong ros dang / yung ba dang / rgya spos dang / ku sha'i khu ba dang / chu srin sen mo dang / ta ma la'i ge sar dang / 'bras kyi chu grang mo dang lhan cig sbyar ba blud na dug thams cad 'joms te /
analyzed: shing tsha dang / ldong ros dang / yung ba dang / rgya spos dang / ku sha'i khu ba dang / chu srin sen mo dang / ta ma la'i ge sar dang / 'bras kyi chu grang mo dang lhan cig sbyar ba blud na dug thams cad 'joms te /
translated: If a mixture of neem, realgar, indigo, eaglewood, kusha juice, crocodile claw, tamala blossom, and cold rice water is given, it will destroy all poisons.

original: ci ltar dbang po'i rdo rjes lha ma yin rnams 'joms pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar dbang po'i rdo rjes lha ma yin rnams 'joms pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as Indra's vajra destroys the asuras.

original: bil ba'i rtsa ba dang / byi'u rug pa'i me tog dang / ka ranydza ba la dang / ta ma la'i ge sar dang / thang shing dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / tsha ba gsum dang / de rnams ra gcin dang zhib tu btags pa las mig sman btab pa dang /
analyzed: bil ba'i rtsa ba dang / byi'u rug pa'i me tog dang / ka ranydza ba la dang / ta ma la'i ge sar dang / thang shing dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / tsha ba gsum dang / de rnams ra gcin dang zhib tu btags pa las mig sman btab pa dang /
translated: The root of the bilva tree, the flower of the bīru tree, the karṇajā flower, the stamen of the tamāla tree, the pine tree, the three fruits, the two kinds of yellow myrobalan, the three hot medicines, and so forth, ground finely with goat urine, are used as eye medicine.

original: sna sman du sbyar na sbrul dang / srog chags lu ta dang / byi ba dang / sdig pa la sogs pa'i dug dang / gsud pa dang / ma zhu ba dang / dbyig dug dang / rims kyis btab pa dang / gdon gyis zin pa la sogs pas nyam thag pa'i mi la phan te bde legs su byed do //
analyzed: sna sman du sbyar na sbrul dang / srog chags lu ta dang / byi ba dang / sdig pa la sogs pa'i dug dang / gsud pa dang / ma zhu ba dang / dbyig dug dang / rims kyis btab pa dang / gdon gyis zin pa la sogs pas nyam thag pa'i mi la phan te bde legs su byed do //
translated: When applied as a nasal medicine, they benefit and bring well-being to people afflicted by the poisons of snakes, luṭa creatures, rats, scorpions, and so forth, as well as by indigestion, undigested food, poisoning, contagious fevers, and possession by spirits.

original: dug gis phog pa'i rma la dug gi lhag ma cung zad cig yod na yang byug pa la sogs pas ma lus par phyung ste /
analyzed: dug gis phog pa'i rma la dug gi lhag ma cung zad cig yod na yang byug pa la sogs pas ma lus par phyung ste /
translated: If there is even a trace of poison remaining in a wound struck by poison, it should be completely removed by applying ointments and so forth.

original: lhag ma lus na ni yang dug gi mthu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag ma lus na ni yang dug gi mthu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If a trace is left behind, the power of the poison will arise again.

original: ci ltar dug gis nad gzhi 'khrugs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar dug gis nad gzhi 'khrugs pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as a disease is aggravated by poison.

original: dug gi nyes pa snad pas rlung 'khrugs shing skyes na ni til mar dang / chang dang / rgya sran dang / skyur dang / de rnams ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma rlung 'joms pa'i gso ba thams cad sbyar ro //🔽dug gis mkhris pa skyes pa la ni rims 'joms pa'i sman bskol ba dang / 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba rnams bya'o //
analyzed: dug gi nyes pa snad pas rlung 'khrugs shing skyes na ni til mar dang / chang dang / rgya sran dang / skyur dang / de rnams ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma rlung 'joms pa'i gso ba thams cad sbyar ro // dug gis mkhris pa skyes pa la ni rims 'joms pa'i sman bskol ba dang / 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba rnams bya'o //
translated: If the wind is aggravated by the fault of poison, all treatments except for sesame oil, alcohol, beans, sour [substances], and those that defeat the wind should be applied.🔽If bile is produced by poison, decoctions that defeat fever and unctuous enemas should be given.

original: dug gis bad kan skyes pa la ni dong ga'i sde tshan sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //
analyzed: dug gis bad kan skyes pa la ni dong ga'i sde tshan sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba gtang ngo //
translated: If phlegm is produced by poison, the group of long peppers should be given with honey.

original: mu zi dang / rgun @399a * //
analyzed: mu zi dang / rgun @399a * //
translated: Realgar, grapes,

original: 'bru dang ; pa ya sya dang / shing mngar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / de spyi'i phyed dang mnyam pa'i kha ra dkar po dang sbyar ba'i lde gu bldag go //
analyzed: 'bru dang ; pa ya sya dang / shing mngar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / de spyi'i phyed dang mnyam pa'i kha ra dkar po dang sbyar ba'i lde gu bldag go //
translated: bay leaves, sweet flag, honey, and white sugar equal to half of that in total should be mixed and licked as a paste.

original: chu la sngags kyis btab ste btung ba dang gtor ba rnams bya'o //
analyzed: chu la sngags kyis btab ste btung ba dang gtor ba rnams bya'o //
translated: Water should be enchanted and used for drinking and sprinkling.

original: snying dga' ba'i bag bsten cing sems dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: snying dga' ba'i bag bsten cing sems dga' bar byed do //
translated: It delights the heart and gladdens the mind.

original: sbrul gyi lus kyis reg pa las byung ba'i dug dang / rtog pa las byung ba'i dug gis nyam thag pa yang cho ga gong ma bzhin du sbyar na phan no //
analyzed: sbrul gyi lus kyis reg pa las byung ba'i dug dang / rtog pa las byung ba'i dug gis nyam thag pa yang cho ga gong ma bzhin du sbyar na phan no //
translated: It is also beneficial for those afflicted by the poison that arises from the touch of a snake's body or the poison that arises from imagination, if one applies the above ritual.

original: rin po che ke ke ru dang / margad dang / mu tig dang / rdo rje dang / bee d'urya dang / garbha ma ni dang / pi tsu ka dang / byi ba'i dug dang / de bzhin du ri kha ba can na skyes pa'i sman so ma ra dza dang /
analyzed: rin po che ke ke ru dang / margad dang / mu tig dang / rdo rje dang / bee d'urya dang / garbha ma ni dang / pi tsu ka dang / byi ba'i dug dang / de bzhin du ri kha ba can na skyes pa'i sman so ma ra dza dang /
translated: It is also beneficial for the poison of precious stones such as cat's eye, emerald, pearl, diamond, lapis lazuli, gharbhamâni, picuka, and rat poison, as well as the poison of the herbs born in the snowy mountains such as somaraja,

original: ba spru ba dang / dro na dang / ma h'a dro na zhes bya ba dang / sbrul la yod pa'i nor bu dang / ma na si dang / dug zhi bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba spru ba dang / dro na dang / ma h'a dro na zhes bya ba dang / sbrul la yod pa'i nor bu dang / ma na si dang / dug zhi bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: vasuka, droona, mahadroona, the jewel of the snake, and manas.

original: de bzhin du nus pa dang ldan pa'i sman rnon po rnams kyang bcang par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nus pa dang ldan pa'i sman rnon po rnams kyang bcang par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should also keep potent sharp medicines.

original: gal te nub mo rgyu na yang gdugs dang / 'khar gsil dag lag tu thogs na de'i grib ma dang sgras lag 'gro rnams sdangs shing 'bye bar 'gyur ro //🔽sbrul gdug pas zin pa gso ba'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa drug pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gal te nub mo rgyu na yang gdugs dang / 'khar gsil dag lag tu thogs na de'i grib ma dang sgras lag 'gro rnams sdangs shing 'bye bar 'gyur ro // sbrul gdug pas zin pa gso ba'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa drug pa rdzogs so /
translated: If you travel at night, hold an umbrella and a staff in your hands. The shadow and the sound of those will frighten the snakes and they will flee.

original: // / de nas srin bu srog chags lu ta la sogs pa'i dug gis zin pa'i dmigs brtags shing gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas srin bu srog chags lu ta la sogs pa'i dug gis zin pa'i dmigs brtags shing gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: This concludes the thirty-sixth chapter, on the treatment of snakebite, from The Quintessence Tantra, the Secret Oral Tradition of the Eight Branches of the Science of Healing.🔽Chapter Thirty-seven: Treatment of the Bites of Lice, Bugs, and Fleas

original: srin bu'i dug de yang sbrul gyi tshil dang / bshang gci dang / khu chu dang / sgo nga dang / khog pa dang / pags pa las skyes te /
analyzed: srin bu'i dug de yang sbrul gyi tshil dang / bshang gci dang / khu chu dang / sgo nga dang / khog pa dang / pags pa las skyes te /
translated: The poisons of lice, bugs, and fleas are born from the fat, feces, semen, eggs, body, and skin of snakes.

original: srin bu de'i rang bzhin yang nad gzhi gsum dang / 'dus pa dang / rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: srin bu de'i rang bzhin yang nad gzhi gsum dang / 'dus pa dang / rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The nature of these parasites is to be known as having three, four, and four types of diseases.

original: de yang rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi srin bu'i dug gis zin pa'i rtags ni rma kha che zhing zug cing na ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi srin bu'i dug gis zin pa'i rtags ni rma kha che zhing zug cing na ba yin no //
translated: The signs of being bitten by a parasite of the wind type are a large wound, pain, and illness.

original: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi srin bus zin pa'i rtags ni 'dzag pa nyung ba dang / tsha ba dang / mdog dmar ba dang / shu ba mched pa dang / yang na shing pi lu'i 'bras bu smin pa dang / 'bra go'i 'bras bu smin pa dang 'dra bar 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi srin bus zin pa'i rtags ni 'dzag pa nyung ba dang / tsha ba dang / mdog dmar ba dang / shu ba mched pa dang / yang na shing pi lu'i 'bras bu smin pa dang / 'bra go'i 'bras bu smin pa dang 'dra bar 'dug pa yin no //
translated: The signs of being bitten by a worm of the bile type are: little discharge, heat, red color, spreading sores, or it looks like a ripe bilva fruit or a ripe pomegranate.

original: bad kan gyi rang bzhin can gyi srin bus zin pa'i rtags ni zug gzer chung ba dang / au @399b dumb'a ra smin pa 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: bad kan gyi rang bzhin can gyi srin bus zin pa'i rtags ni zug gzer chung ba dang / au @399b dumb'a ra smin pa 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The signs of being bitten by a worm of the phlegm type are: little pain, and it looks like a ripe udumbara fruit.

original: 'dus pa'i rang bzhin can gyi srin bus zin pa ni tshabs cher 'dzag cing rten thams cad dang ldan pa yin te de ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rang bzhin can gyi srin bus zin pa ni tshabs cher 'dzag cing rten thams cad dang ldan pa yin te de ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: A bite by a worm of the combined type has heavy discharge and all the above signs. It should be avoided.

original: srin bu gdug pa de dag gi mthu'i gnas skabs dang po la sogs pa sbrul gyi ltar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: srin bu gdug pa de dag gi mthu'i gnas skabs dang po la sogs pa sbrul gyi ltar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The stages of the power of those poisonous worms should be observed like a snake.

original: de bzhin du skrang ba 'phel ba dang / khrag dri nga ba 'dzag pa dang / mgo dang mig lci ba dang / mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / rab tu na ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skrang ba 'phel ba dang / khrag dri nga ba 'dzag pa dang / mgo dang mig lci ba dang / mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / rab tu na ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, there is swelling, increase, foul-smelling blood discharge, heaviness of head and eyes, dizziness, fainting, dyspnea, and severe pain.

original: srin bu gdug pa spyi dang mthun par rma'i nang du padma'i snying po lta bu 'byung zhing tsha ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / kha zas yi gar mi 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: srin bu gdug pa spyi dang mthun par rma'i nang du padma'i snying po lta bu 'byung zhing tsha ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / kha zas yi gar mi 'ong ba yin no //
translated: The general characteristics of a poisonous insect are: a wound that resembles the center of a lotus, heat, itching, and aversion to food.

original: sdig pa shas zin pa'i dug ni shin tu rno ba yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa shas zin pa'i dug ni shin tu rno ba yin te /
translated: The poison of a sinful insect is extremely sharp.

original: dang po me bzhin du lus la sreg par byed la de ma thag ro stod du mched par 'gro ste /
analyzed: dang po me bzhin du lus la sreg par byed la de ma thag ro stod du mched par 'gro ste /
translated: First, it burns the body like fire, and immediately spreads to the upper body.

original: de'i 'og rma'i nang du 'dug pa yin te des bzung ma thag rab tu na zhing skrang ba dang 'gas pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og rma'i nang du 'dug pa yin te des bzung ma thag rab tu na zhing skrang ba dang 'gas pa rnams yin no //
translated: Then, it remains in the wound. As soon as it is grasped, there is severe pain, swelling, and bursting.

original: sdig pa de skye ba'i rgyu ni ba lang la sogs pa'i lci ba dang / pags pa bsregs te rul zhing rlan pa las skyes pa dang / sbrul gyi pags pa las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa de skye ba'i rgyu ni ba lang la sogs pa'i lci ba dang / pags pa bsregs te rul zhing rlan pa las skyes pa dang / sbrul gyi pags pa las skyes pa yin te /
translated: from the dung of cows and so on, from the rotting and moistening of the burnt skin, and from the skin of a snake.

original: rked pa phra ba'i sdig pa'i dug tshabs che ba yin te de yang mdog ser ba dang / gnag pa dang / rtsub pa dang / mdog sna tshogs su snang ba dang / nor bu gzi mdog tu snang ba yin no //
analyzed: rked pa phra ba'i sdig pa'i dug tshabs che ba yin te de yang mdog ser ba dang / gnag pa dang / rtsub pa dang / mdog sna tshogs su snang ba dang / nor bu gzi mdog tu snang ba yin no //
translated: The poison of the thin-waisted scorpion is very strong. It is yellow, black, rough, multicolored, and appears like a sapphire.

original: sdig pa kha cig ni spu mang zhing tshigs kyang mang ba yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa kha cig ni spu mang zhing tshigs kyang mang ba yin no //
translated: Some scorpions have many hairs and many joints.

original: kha cig ni rgyab dmar zhing lto dkar ba yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyab dmar zhing lto dkar ba yin no //
translated: Some have a red back and a white belly.

original: kha cig ni mdog dud khar 'dug cing tshigs gsum yod pa dang / rked pa ser skyar 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni mdog dud khar 'dug cing tshigs gsum yod pa dang / rked pa ser skyar 'dug pa yin no //
translated: Some have an ash-colored body and three joints, and their waist is yellowish.

original: kha cig ni thal ba'i mdog tu 'dug pa dang / sre mo'i mdog dang / khrag 'thung ba de ni dug chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni thal ba'i mdog tu 'dug pa dang / sre mo'i mdog dang / khrag 'thung ba de ni dug chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Some have the color of ashes, the color of a weasel, and drink blood. They have great poison.

original: kha cig ni me'i mdog tu snang zhing tshigs gnyis yod pa dang / lto dkar ba'am dmar ba 'am gnag pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni me'i mdog tu snang zhing tshigs gnyis yod pa dang / lto dkar ba'am dmar ba 'am gnag pa yin no //
translated: Some appear to be the color of fire and have two joints, and their bellies are white, red, or black.

original: sdig pa de rnams kyis zin pa'i rtags ni lce skrang ba dang / lce gyong ba dang / lus rengs pa dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / kha la sogs pa'i sgo nas khrag nag po mang du 'dzag pa dang / dbang po rnams kyis don mi tshor ba dang /
analyzed: sdig pa de rnams kyis zin pa'i rtags ni lce skrang ba dang / lce gyong ba dang / lus rengs pa dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / kha la sogs pa'i sgo nas khrag nag po mang du 'dzag pa dang / dbang po rnams kyis don mi tshor ba dang /
translated: The signs of being seized by these nonvirtuous ones are: the tongue swells, the tongue becomes stiff, the body becomes stiff, one is afflicted by fever, much black blood flows from the mouth and other orifices, and the sense faculties do not perceive objects.

original: rdul  ba dang / brgyal ba dang / kha skam pa dang / rmongs pa dang / rab tu na ba dang / @400a * //
analyzed: rdul  ba dang / brgyal ba dang / kha skam pa dang / rmongs pa dang / rab tu na ba dang / @400a * //
translated: One perspires, faints, has a dry mouth, is confused, is very sick,

original: sha 'drul zhing lhags pa snyam sems pa'i nad pa de ni phal cher srog 'dor ba yin no //
analyzed: sha 'drul zhing lhags pa snyam sems pa'i nad pa de ni phal cher srog 'dor ba yin no //
translated: and the patient feels as if his flesh is being torn and his body is being burned. He will mostly lose his life.

original: srog chags au tsi ting ga zhes bya ba'i srog chags ni khas 'dzin par byed pa dang / de yang gong ma bas tshabs cher na ba yin te /
analyzed: srog chags au tsi ting ga zhes bya ba'i srog chags ni khas 'dzin par byed pa dang / de yang gong ma bas tshabs cher na ba yin te /
translated: The being called the ucitinga worm seizes the throat, and it is more serious than the above.

original: sdig pa bas lus kyi g-yas g-yon gnyis ka nas 'dzin pa yin no //🔽srog chags lu ta au tsi ting gas bzung ba'i mtshan ma ni pho mtshan 'greng ba 'am /
analyzed: sdig pa bas lus kyi g-yas g-yon gnyis ka nas 'dzin pa yin no // srog chags lu ta au tsi ting gas bzung ba'i mtshan ma ni pho mtshan 'greng ba 'am /
translated: The sign of being seized by the sin-born worm is that the penis is erect,🔽the body hair stands on end, the body sweats, wounds fester, cold pus oozes, and the worm is called the ucitinga worm.

original: ba spu langs pa dang / lus las rdul 'byung ba dang / rma mched pa dang / chu ser grang mor 'dzag pa dang / srin bu au tsi ting ga'i ming gi rnam grangs ni rnga mo dud kha zhes bya /
analyzed: ba spu langs pa dang / lus las rdul 'byung ba dang / rma mched pa dang / chu ser grang mor 'dzag pa dang / srin bu au tsi ting ga'i ming gi rnam grangs ni rnga mo dud kha zhes bya /
translated: The synonyms for the ucitinga worm are the camel-colored worm,

original: mtshan mo rgyu ba zhes bya /
analyzed: mtshan mo rgyu ba zhes bya /
translated: the night-wanderer,

original: mtshan mo can zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan mo can zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: and the night-time worm.

original: de ni rlung dang mkhris shas che ba yin no //🔽srin bu ka na ba zhes bya ba dang / bi ba zhes bya ba'i srin bu gnyis ni bad kan shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rlung dang mkhris shas che ba yin no // srin bu ka na ba zhes bya ba dang / bi ba zhes bya ba'i srin bu gnyis ni bad kan shas che ba yin no //
translated: It is a worm that is predominantly wind and bile.🔽The two worms called the kanabha and the vibha are predominantly phlegm.

original: de las kyang sdig pa'i dug dang / srin bu rnga mo dud ka zhes bya ba gnyis ni phal cher rlung shas che ba yin no //
analyzed: de las kyang sdig pa'i dug dang / srin bu rnga mo dud ka zhes bya ba gnyis ni phal cher rlung shas che ba yin no //
translated: Among them, the two worms called the sin-born worm and the camel-colored worm are predominantly wind.

original: srin bu ka na ba zhes bya ba dang / bi ba zhes bya ba'i srin bu nad gzhi gang dang gang gi shas che ba legs par brtags te /
analyzed: srin bu ka na ba zhes bya ba dang / bi ba zhes bya ba'i srin bu nad gzhi gang dang gang gi shas che ba legs par brtags te /
translated: The worms called kanabaka and vibhi should be examined to determine which of the humors is dominant in the illness.

original: de dang de'i sman gyi yon tan gyis gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dang de'i sman gyi yon tan gyis gso bar bya'o //
translated: Then they should be treated with the qualities of medicine that are appropriate.

original: de la rlung shas che ba'i rtags ni glo snying na ba dang / stod du rlung 'byung ba dang / lus khong rengs pa dang / rtsa ba rgya che ba song ba dang / rus ba dang / tshigs su zug pa dang / rna ba'i sgra za zi zer ba dang /
analyzed: de la rlung shas che ba'i rtags ni glo snying na ba dang / stod du rlung 'byung ba dang / lus khong rengs pa dang / rtsa ba rgya che ba song ba dang / rus ba dang / tshigs su zug pa dang / rna ba'i sgra za zi zer ba dang /
translated: The signs of a predominance of wind are pain in the chest and heart, wind moving upward, a feeling of constriction in the body, a feeling of the channels spreading out, pain in the bones and joints, a whistling sound in the ears,

original: lus gcus pa snyam byed pa dang / lus mdog gnag pa yin no //
analyzed: lus gcus pa snyam byed pa dang / lus mdog gnag pa yin no //
translated: a feeling that the body is twisted, and a dark complexion.

original: mkhris pa shas che ba'i rtags ni 'du shes nyams pa dang / drod che ba dang / dbugs tsha ba 'byung ba dang / glo snying tsha ba dang / khar kha ba bro ba dang / sha 'gas pa dang / lus skrang ba dang / mdog dmar zhing ser ba yin no //
analyzed: mkhris pa shas che ba'i rtags ni 'du shes nyams pa dang / drod che ba dang / dbugs tsha ba 'byung ba dang / glo snying tsha ba dang / khar kha ba bro ba dang / sha 'gas pa dang / lus skrang ba dang / mdog dmar zhing ser ba yin no //
translated: The signs of a predominance of bile are a loss of perception, a high fever, hot breath, a burning sensation in the chest and heart, a bitter taste in the mouth, a breaking out in blisters, swelling of the body, and a red and yellow complexion.

original: bad kan shas che ba'i dug nad kyi rtags ni skyug pa dang / kha zas yi gar mi 'ong ba dang / brang tsha zhing kha nas chu 'byung ba dang / cham pas btab pa dang / sna chu 'dzag pa dang / grang ba dang /
analyzed: bad kan shas che ba'i dug nad kyi rtags ni skyug pa dang / kha zas yi gar mi 'ong ba dang / brang tsha zhing kha nas chu 'byung ba dang / cham pas btab pa dang / sna chu 'dzag pa dang / grang ba dang /
translated: The symptoms of a poison that is dominated by phlegm are vomiting, distaste for food, a burning chest, salivation, a cold, a runny nose,

original: kha mngar bro ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: kha mngar bro ba rnams yin no //
translated: and a sweet taste in the mouth.

original: de la rlung gi bdag nyid kyi dug gis zin pa la ni til gyi tshigs mas byug pa dang / til mar gyis bsku ba dang / pu la ka ka la sogs pa'i sbu bu'i dugs bya ba dang / @400b lus 'phel zhing lus brta ba'i cho ga rnams byas na phan no //
analyzed: de la rlung gi bdag nyid kyi dug gis zin pa la ni til gyi tshigs mas byug pa dang / til mar gyis bsku ba dang / pu la ka ka la sogs pa'i sbu bu'i dugs bya ba dang / @400b lus 'phel zhing lus brta ba'i cho ga rnams byas na phan no //
translated: In the case of being seized by a poison that is of the nature of wind, it is beneficial to apply a paste of sesame seeds, to anoint with sesame oil, to apply a poultice of pūlaka, ka, and so forth, and to perform the rites for increasing the body and strengthening the body.

original: mkhris pa'i dug nad la ni bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa blugs pa dang / byug pas 'jam rtsi bcad cing bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i dug nad la ni bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa blugs pa dang / byug pas 'jam rtsi bcad cing bzlog par bya'o //
translated: In the case of a bile poison, it should be pacified and reversed by applying cooling substances and by anointing.

original: bad kan gyi shas che ba'i dug la ni thog mar skyug sman btang ste /
analyzed: bad kan gyi shas che ba'i dug la ni thog mar skyug sman btang ste /
translated: In the case of a poison that is dominated by phlegm, first administer emetics.

original: dugs bya ba dang / mtshon gyis bcad cing bzhar na phan no //
analyzed: dugs bya ba dang / mtshon gyis bcad cing bzhar na phan no //
translated: Fomentation, cutting with a surgical instrument, and shaving are beneficial.

original: srin bu'i rang bzhin nad gzhi rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba de bzhin du gso ba yang de ltar byas na phan no //
analyzed: srin bu'i rang bzhin nad gzhi rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba de bzhin du gso ba yang de ltar byas na phan no //
translated: Just as the nature of worms is threefold, so too is the treatment beneficial when done in that way.

original: dugs dang / blugs pa dang / byug pa la sogs pa rnams kyang phal cher dron por sbyar na phan no //
analyzed: dugs dang / blugs pa dang / byug pa la sogs pa rnams kyang phal cher dron por sbyar na phan no //
translated: Fomentation, pouring, anointing, and so on are mostly beneficial when applied warm.

original: dug gis zin pa'i rma gzhan du mched cing rnags pa dang / pags pa rul ba la ni mi'i skra dang / yungs kar ser po dang / bu ram rnying pa rnams sbyar ba'i dud pas bdugs te /
analyzed: dug gis zin pa'i rma gzhan du mched cing rnags pa dang / pags pa rul ba la ni mi'i skra dang / yungs kar ser po dang / bu ram rnying pa rnams sbyar ba'i dud pas bdugs te /
translated: For a wound seized by poison that has spread elsewhere, become putrid, or has rotting skin, fumigate with a mixture of human hair, yellow mustard seeds, and old molasses.

original: de ni dug nad thams cad la bdug par bya ste zhes drang srong chen po 'drob skyong gis bshad do //
analyzed: de ni dug nad thams cad la bdug par bya ste zhes drang srong chen po 'drob skyong gis bshad do //
translated: This is to be used as fumigation for all poison illnesses, explained the great sage Ātreya.

original: srin bu'i dug dang / sdig pa'i dug mi bzad pa gnyis la ni sbrul gyi dug gi gso ba bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: srin bu'i dug dang / sdig pa'i dug mi bzad pa gnyis la ni sbrul gyi dug gi gso ba bzhin du bya ste /
translated: For the two unbearable poisons of worm and snake, act as in the treatment of snake poison.

original: de bzhin du dug 'joms pa'i sman dang / gso ba thams cad dang / slon khrus kyis lus dag pa rnams spyad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dug 'joms pa'i sman dang / gso ba thams cad dang / slon khrus kyis lus dag pa rnams spyad do //
translated: Likewise, one should use medicines that counteract poison, all healing remedies, and cleansing baths for the body.

original: mon sran rde'u dme ru dang / dur byid cha snyoms te mar dang sbyar ba blud na srin bu'i dug g-yo bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mon sran rde'u dme ru dang / dur byid cha snyoms te mar dang sbyar ba blud na srin bu'i dug g-yo bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one gives a potion of black gram, me-ru, and dur-wa mixed with butter, the poison of worms will not move.

original: ji ltar rlung gis gangs te se mi bsgul ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rlung gis gangs te se mi bsgul ba bzhin no //
translated: It is just as the wind cannot move snow.

original: shing 'o ma can gyi shun pa btags pa'i lde gus lus sbyang ba'i 'og tu bskus na srin bu las gyur pa'i dug thams cad 'joms so //
analyzed: shing 'o ma can gyi shun pa btags pa'i lde gus lus sbyang ba'i 'og tu bskus na srin bu las gyur pa'i dug thams cad 'joms so //
translated: If one anoints the body after bathing with a paste of the bark of a milky tree, one will destroy all poisons that come from worms.

original: gong du bshad pa'i byug pa mchog des bskus na skrangs pa dang / na zhing tsha ba dang bcas pa'i rims nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i byug pa mchog des bskus na skrangs pa dang / na zhing tsha ba dang bcas pa'i rims nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If one anoints with the supreme ointment explained above, one will cure swelling, pain, and the fever of contagious diseases.

original: shu dag dang / shing kun dang / byi dang ga dang / rgyam tsha dang / ha ti pi pi ling dang / pa tha dang / bong nga dkar po dang / tsha ba gsum dang / de rnams lhan cig sbyar ba la ni yan lag bcu pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shu dag dang / shing kun dang / byi dang ga dang / rgyam tsha dang / ha ti pi pi ling dang / pa tha dang / bong nga dkar po dang / tsha ba gsum dang / de rnams lhan cig sbyar ba la ni yan lag bcu pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The ten ingredients are:

original: de las ran par zos na srin bu'i dug thams cad las rgyal bar byed do zhes drang srong 'drob skyong gis bshad do //
analyzed: de las ran par zos na srin bu'i dug thams cad las rgyal bar byed do zhes drang srong 'drob skyong gis bshad do //
translated: If one eats the right amount of this compound, it will conquer all worm poisons, as explained by the sage Ātreya.

original: sdig pas zin pa la ni de ma thag tsa kra mar da'i 'bru mar gyis bsku'o //
analyzed: sdig pas zin pa la ni de ma thag tsa kra mar da'i 'bru mar gyis bsku'o //
translated: For those seized by evil spirits, immediately anoint with mustard oil.

original: yang na sa la par ni bskol ba'i khu ba chu dro 'jam tsam gyis bsku ba 'am /
analyzed: yang na sa la par ni bskol ba'i khu ba chu dro 'jam tsam gyis bsku ba 'am /
translated: Alternatively, anoint with a lukewarm decoction of the three myrobalan fruits, or with a lukewarm decoction of the three hot herbs.

original: yang na rgyam tsha mar dang bcas pas yang dang yang bsku'o //🔽@401a * // rang skyur dro 'jam tsam mam /
analyzed: yang na rgyam tsha mar dang bcas pas yang dang yang bsku'o // @401a * // rang skyur dro 'jam tsam mam /
translated: Alternatively, anoint again and again with rock salt and butter.🔽Anoint with lukewarm sour gruel,

original: 'o ma dang bcas pa'i lan tshvas bsku'o //
analyzed: 'o ma dang bcas pa'i lan tshvas bsku'o //
translated: or with salt mixed with milk.

original: mar brngos pa'i nang du go snyod dang / rgyam tsha btags pa'i phye mas btab pa'i lde gus rma'i thon 'khor du dugs bya'o //
analyzed: mar brngos pa'i nang du go snyod dang / rgyam tsha btags pa'i phye mas btab pa'i lde gus rma'i thon 'khor du dugs bya'o //
translated: In the case of a burn, apply a paste of roasted barley flour mixed with asafoetida and rock salt to the area around the wound.

original: de nas rma'i steng du zhal zhal byas la /
analyzed: de nas rma'i steng du zhal zhal byas la /
translated: Then, cover the wound with a plaster.

original: yung ba dang / rgyam tsha dang ; tsha ba gsum dang / shri sha'i me tog dang / 'bras bu btags pa'i phye ma ma du lung ga'i khu ba dang / ba gcin nam chang gi dangs ma dang sbyar ba'i 'dag gus bsku'o //
analyzed: yung ba dang / rgyam tsha dang ; tsha ba gsum dang / shri sha'i me tog dang / 'bras bu btags pa'i phye ma ma du lung ga'i khu ba dang / ba gcin nam chang gi dangs ma dang sbyar ba'i 'dag gus bsku'o //
translated: Apply a compress made of a paste of indigo, rock salt, the three hot medicines, śirīṣa flowers, and śirīṣa fruit mixed with the juice of madūla, cow’s urine, and fermented grain.

original: de bzhin du til mar gyi tshigs ma 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du til mar gyi tshigs ma 'am /
translated: Alternatively, apply a compress of sesame oil cake.

original: ba lang gi lci ba dro 'jam tsam gyis byug go //
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba dro 'jam tsam gyis byug go //
translated: Or apply a compress of warm cow dung.

original: btung ba ni mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas pa dang / 'o ma dang sha kha ra shas cher btab pa blud do //
analyzed: btung ba ni mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas pa dang / 'o ma dang sha kha ra shas cher btab pa blud do //
translated: As for drinks, give a mixture of butter, honey, and milk, or milk with a lot of sugar.

original: phug ron gyi rtug pa dang / mar dang / rgya spos dang / bca' sga dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma kha lung gi khu ba'i nang du btab ste 'thungs na sdig pas zin pa'i dug 'joms pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: phug ron gyi rtug pa dang / mar dang / rgya spos dang / bca' sga dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma kha lung gi khu ba'i nang du btab ste 'thungs na sdig pas zin pa'i dug 'joms pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: Pigeon droppings, ghee, camphor, and ginger, ground into a powder and drunk with the juice of the Indian night shade, is the best remedy for poison from a sin-born snake.

original: rnga mo'i mche ba chu bal dang lhan cig sbyar ba ni sdig pa'i dug 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: rnga mo'i mche ba chu bal dang lhan cig sbyar ba ni sdig pa'i dug 'joms par byed do //
translated: The tusk of a camel, together with a water bubble, is a remedy for poison from a sin-born snake.

original: shing kun dang / ba bla kha lung gi khu ba'i nang du btags pa'i lde gus byug pa dang / mig sman dang / ri lur byas te bsten pa dang sdig pas zin pa'i dug 'joms par byed pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: shing kun dang / ba bla kha lung gi khu ba'i nang du btags pa'i lde gus byug pa dang / mig sman dang / ri lur byas te bsten pa dang sdig pas zin pa'i dug 'joms par byed pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: A paste made from costus root, Indian valerian, and Indian night shade, used as an ointment, eye medicine, or pill, is the best remedy for poison from a sin-born snake.

original: ka ranydza dang / aardzu na dang / she lu na dang / ge ri karni ka dang / shri sha'i me tog dang / 'di rnams zho ga chu dang bcas par btags pas bskus na sdig pas zin pa'i dug 'joms so //
analyzed: ka ranydza dang / aardzu na dang / she lu na dang / ge ri karni ka dang / shri sha'i me tog dang / 'di rnams zho ga chu dang bcas par btags pas bskus na sdig pas zin pa'i dug 'joms so //
translated: The flowers of the karṇaja, arjuna, śelunā, gerikarnīka, and śirīṣa, mixed with curd and water, and used as an ointment, is a remedy for poison from a sin-born snake.

original: gang myos shing rmugs shas byed pa dang / dbugs rngam pa 'thon pa dang / glal ba dang / mi bzad par na ba de la ni /
analyzed: gang myos shing rmugs shas byed pa dang / dbugs rngam pa 'thon pa dang / glal ba dang / mi bzad par na ba de la ni /
translated: If there is intoxication and excessive dullness, heavy breathing, yawning, and unbearable pain,

original: aa ru ra dang / yung ba dang / pi pi ling dang / btsod dang / bong nga dkar po dang / na le sham dang / ba spru ba dang / bkru sman dang / bar dka'i khu ba'i nang du btags te byug pa bya'o //
analyzed: aa ru ra dang / yung ba dang / pi pi ling dang / btsod dang / bong nga dkar po dang / na le sham dang / ba spru ba dang / bkru sman dang / bar dka'i khu ba'i nang du btags te byug pa bya'o //
translated: then apply a paste of yellow myrobalan, indigo, long pepper, madder, white Indian pennywort, liquorice, Indian groundsel, purgative medicine, and the juice of barnyard grass.

original: dug gis thams cad du khrag tu khyab pa la ni zho dang / mar blud pa dang / rtsa las khrag gtar ba rnams dang / sna sman dang / mig sman yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dug gis thams cad du khrag tu khyab pa la ni zho dang / mar blud pa dang / rtsa las khrag gtar ba rnams dang / sna sman dang / mig sman yang sbyar ro //
translated: If there is a spread of blood throughout the body due to poison, then administer curd and ghee, perform bloodletting from the veins, and apply nasal medication and eye medication.

original: dro ba dang / snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / mngar ba dang / rlung 'joms pa'i kha zas kyang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dro ba dang / snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / mngar ba dang / rlung 'joms pa'i kha zas kyang sbyar ro //
translated: Also, administer warm, oily, sour, sweet, and wind-pacifying foods.

original: dong gra dang / khyim gyi thi ba'i rtug pa dang / ba lang gi khu ba dang / ba bla dang / rgyam tsha dang / 'di rnams sbyar ba'i @401b lde gu'i dug sman 'dis sbrang ma'i rigs kyi dug myur du 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: dong gra dang / khyim gyi thi ba'i rtug pa dang / ba lang gi khu ba dang / ba bla dang / rgyam tsha dang / 'di rnams sbyar ba'i @401b lde gu'i dug sman 'dis sbrang ma'i rigs kyi dug myur du 'joms par byed do //
translated: The excrement of a house sparrow, cow’s urine, cow dung, rock salt, and black salt—this medicinal paste made from these ingredients quickly destroys the poison of bees.

original: sdig pas zin pa'i rma dus phyi zhig na dug gi gnod pa yang dag par bskyed pa la ni rma la byug pas bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pas zin pa'i rma dus phyi zhig na dug gi gnod pa yang dag par bskyed pa la ni rma la byug pas bsku bar bya'o //
translated: If a wound that has been affected by sin later causes harm from poison, apply an ointment to the wound.

original: au tsi ting ga zhes bya ba'i dug gi yang cho ga 'di bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: au tsi ting ga zhes bya ba'i dug gi yang cho ga 'di bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The poison of a ucitinga should be treated in the same way.

original: glang po che'i rtug pa dang / tshad tra dang / ro hi sha'i rtsa ba dang / she lu'i khu ba dang lhan cig bsku ba dang / ri lu dang byug pa la sogs pa byas na sbrang ma'i dug 'joms par byed pa'i gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: glang po che'i rtug pa dang / tshad tra dang / ro hi sha'i rtsa ba dang / she lu'i khu ba dang lhan cig bsku ba dang / ri lu dang byug pa la sogs pa byas na sbrang ma'i dug 'joms par byed pa'i gtso bo yin te /
translated: An ointment made from the excrement of an elephant, tshedtra, the root of rohiṣa, and śelu juice, as well as pills and ointments, are the best for destroying the poison of bees.

original: shri sha'i sa bon aarga'i lo ma'i nang du phog gsum bsgos te /
analyzed: shri sha'i sa bon aarga'i lo ma'i nang du phog gsum bsgos te /
translated: Soak the seeds of śrīśa in the juice of arjuna leaves three times.

original: pi pi ling gi phye mas bsres te dug 'joms pa'i sman 'dis ni srog chags go dha'i dug dang / sbrul gyi dug dang / srog chags lu ta'i dug dang / byi ba'i dug dang / sdig pa'i dug rnams sel bar byed do //
analyzed: pi pi ling gi phye mas bsres te dug 'joms pa'i sman 'dis ni srog chags go dha'i dug dang / sbrul gyi dug dang / srog chags lu ta'i dug dang / byi ba'i dug dang / sdig pa'i dug rnams sel bar byed do //
translated: This medicine, mixed with powdered long pepper, cures the poison of the Godha, the poison of the snake, the poison of the LUTA, the poison of the rat, and the poison of the scorpion.

original: shri sha'i sa bon dang / ka ranydza'i sa bon dang / gur kum dang / ru rta dang / ldong ros dang / 'di rnams lhan cig sbyar ba'i dug 'joms pa'i sman 'di ni rgyal ba sangs rgyas kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: shri sha'i sa bon dang / ka ranydza'i sa bon dang / gur kum dang / ru rta dang / ldong ros dang / 'di rnams lhan cig sbyar ba'i dug 'joms pa'i sman 'di ni rgyal ba sangs rgyas kyis gsungs te /
translated: This medicine, which cures poison, was taught by the Victorious Buddha: the seed of the Shrisha, the seed of the Karnaja, saffron, turmeric, red arsenic, and realgar.

original: srin bu mtshan mo can dang / sdig pa'i dug lus la khyab pa gcig tu sdud par byed do //
analyzed: srin bu mtshan mo can dang / sdig pa'i dug lus la khyab pa gcig tu sdud par byed do //
translated: It gathers together in one place the poison of the nocturnal worm and the poison of the scorpion that spreads through the body.

original: srog chags ka ti'i dug pas kyang srog chags lu ta'i dug mi bzad pa yin te /
analyzed: srog chags ka ti'i dug pas kyang srog chags lu ta'i dug mi bzad pa yin te /
translated: The poison of the KATI insect is worse than the poison of the LUTA insect.

original: de yang srog chags lu ta'i dbye ba yang bcu drug yod do //
analyzed: de yang srog chags lu ta'i dbye ba yang bcu drug yod do //
translated: And that also has sixteen varieties of LUTA poison.

original: zhes kha cig 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes kha cig 'chad do //
translated: Thus some explain.

original: kha cig ni nyi shu rtsa brgyad yod do //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni nyi shu rtsa brgyad yod do //🔽zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say there are twenty-eight.

original: gzhan dag ni nyi ma'i phyi bzhin 'brang zhing stong phrag tsam du yod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni nyi ma'i phyi bzhin 'brang zhing stong phrag tsam du yod do //
translated: The others follow the sun and are about a thousand in number.

original: zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes 'chad do //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: srog chags lu ta zhes bya ba de'i tshul ni gnod pa byed par snang na yang mtshan nyid ni dug dang gcig go //
analyzed: srog chags lu ta zhes bya ba de'i tshul ni gnod pa byed par snang na yang mtshan nyid ni dug dang gcig go //
translated: The nature of the creature called luta is such that even when it appears to do harm, it is the same as poison.

original: srog chags lu ta de'i lus dang ming yang shes par dka' zhing 'dres pa yin te gnas su bzhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: srog chags lu ta de'i lus dang ming yang shes par dka' zhing 'dres pa yin te gnas su bzhag pa yang med do //
translated: The body and name of the luta creature are difficult to know and are mixed up, and there is no place to put it.

original: de bas na nad gzhi la brtag par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na nad gzhi la brtag par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be known to examine the disease.

original: de yang nad gzhi re re las gyur pa'i lu ta'i dug ni gso dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang nad gzhi re re las gyur pa'i lu ta'i dug ni gso dka' ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the luta poison that arises from each disease is difficult to cure.

original: lu ta'i nad mkhris pa las gyur pa ni gsor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: lu ta'i nad mkhris pa las gyur pa ni gsor mi rung ngo //
translated: The luta disease arising from bile is incurable.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i lu ta'i mtshan ma ni lus tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / 'brum bu gsum 'byung ba dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / rmongs bag tu 'dug pa dang / tsha ba che ba dang / mdog ser zhing dmar ba dang /🔽rul ba dang / rgun 'brum gyi 'bras bu 'dra ba yin no //🔽bad @402a * //🔽kan las gyur pa'i lu ta'i mtshan ma ni sra ba dang / mdog dkar ba dang / shing tog dang / ru ka'i dbyibs 'dra ba dang / gnyid che ba dang / grang ba dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / lud pa lu zhing lhag par g-ya' ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i lu ta'i mtshan ma ni lus tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / 'brum bu gsum 'byung ba dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / rmongs bag tu 'dug pa dang / tsha ba che ba dang / mdog ser zhing dmar ba dang / rul ba dang / rgun 'brum gyi 'bras bu 'dra ba yin no // bad @402a * // kan las gyur pa'i lu ta'i mtshan ma ni sra ba dang / mdog dkar ba dang / shing tog dang / ru ka'i dbyibs 'dra ba dang / gnyid che ba dang / grang ba dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / lud pa lu zhing lhag par g-ya' ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The signs of a boil arising from bile are: the body is hot and burning, three boils appear, there is a fever, there is confusion, there is a high fever, and the color is yellow and red.🔽The signs of a boil arising from phlegm are: it is hard, the color is white, it is shaped like a fruit or a ruka, there is excessive sleep, there is a fever, there is a lot of phlegm, and there is excessive itching.

original: rlung las gyur pa'i lu ta'i mtshan ma ni rtsub cing rud rud por 'dug pa dang / mdog gnag pa dang / tshigs rnams bye ba snyam byed pa dang / rims kyis 'debs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung las gyur pa'i lu ta'i mtshan ma ni rtsub cing rud rud por 'dug pa dang / mdog gnag pa dang / tshigs rnams bye ba snyam byed pa dang / rims kyis 'debs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The signs of a boil arising from wind are: it is rough and bumpy, the color is dark, the joints feel as if they will disintegrate, and there is a fever.

original: srog chags lu ta de'i rang rang gi dbye ba yang nad kyi rtags las shes par bya ba dang / 'dus pa las gyur ba'i gsor mi rung ba'i lu ta'i nad ni snying tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang /🔽skyigs bu'i nad dang / mgo 'gyur mi shes pa dang / 'brum bu'i mdog dkar ba dang / ser ba dang / gnag pa dang / dmar ba dang / skrang ba dang / lus 'dar ba dang / slon pa dang / lus tsha ba dang /
analyzed: srog chags lu ta de'i rang rang gi dbye ba yang nad kyi rtags las shes par bya ba dang / 'dus pa las gyur ba'i gsor mi rung ba'i lu ta'i nad ni snying tsha 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / skyigs bu'i nad dang / mgo 'gyur mi shes pa dang / 'brum bu'i mdog dkar ba dang / ser ba dang / gnag pa dang / dmar ba dang / skrang ba dang / lus 'dar ba dang / slon pa dang / lus tsha ba dang /
translated: The incurable lutas that arise from a combination of factors are: the heart being warm and throbbing, difficulty in breathing,🔽coughing, dizziness, white, yellow, black, or red rashes, swelling, trembling, feeling full, feeling hot,

original: skom dad che ba dang / long bar 'gyur ba dang / sna yo bar 'gyur ba dang / mchu dang kha dang so gnag par 'gyur ba dang / rgyab kyi sgal tshigs dang / mgrin pa zhig par 'gyur ba dang / shing 'dzam bu smin pa'i mdog 'dra bar snang ba dang /
analyzed: skom dad che ba dang / long bar 'gyur ba dang / sna yo bar 'gyur ba dang / mchu dang kha dang so gnag par 'gyur ba dang / rgyab kyi sgal tshigs dang / mgrin pa zhig par 'gyur ba dang / shing 'dzam bu smin pa'i mdog 'dra bar snang ba dang /
translated: extreme thirst, blindness, a crooked nose, black lips, mouth, and teeth, a broken spine and neck, and appearing like a ripe jambū fruit.

original: rma'i sgo nas khrag 'dzag pa dang / de ni phal cher sa las byung ba'i srog chags lu ta'i dug yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rma'i sgo nas khrag 'dzag pa dang / de ni phal cher sa las byung ba'i srog chags lu ta'i dug yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The wound oozes blood, and it should be known that this is the poison of the leech, a creature born from the earth.

original: sa las byung ba'i srog chags lu ta de yang dug shin tu rno ba dang / 'bring dang / tha ma dang / rnam pa gsum du bshad do /
analyzed: sa las byung ba'i srog chags lu ta de yang dug shin tu rno ba dang / 'bring dang / tha ma dang / rnam pa gsum du bshad do /
translated: The leech, a creature born from the earth, is explained to have three types of poison: very sharp, medium, and mild.

original: gso ba ma byas te yal bar bor na ni 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gso ba ma byas te yal bar bor na ni 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not treated and is neglected, it will lead to death.

original: zhag bdun dang / zhag bcu dang / zla ba phyed dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: zhag bdun dang / zhag bcu dang / zla ba phyed dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: [The time of death is] after seven days, ten days, and a half month, respectively.

original: srog chags lu tas zin pa'i rma thams cad kyang shu ba'i 'khor ling lta bur snang ba dang / de yang dkar ba dang / rtsa gnag pa dang / ser ba dang / sngo bsangs su 'dug pa dang / 'jam pa dang / mthon por 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: srog chags lu tas zin pa'i rma thams cad kyang shu ba'i 'khor ling lta bur snang ba dang / de yang dkar ba dang / rtsa gnag pa dang / ser ba dang / sngo bsangs su 'dug pa dang / 'jam pa dang / mthon por 'dug pa dang /
translated: All wounds seized by a leech appear like a boil, and it is also white, with dark veins, yellow, pale blue, smooth, and elevated.

original: rma'i dbus gnag pa dang / yang na bar sngo bsangs su 'dug pa dang / rma'i tha ma dra ba lta bus khebs pa yin no //
analyzed: rma'i dbus gnag pa dang / yang na bar sngo bsangs su 'dug pa dang / rma'i tha ma dra ba lta bus khebs pa yin no //
translated: The center of the wound is dark, or in the middle it is pale blue, and the edge of the wound is covered with a net-like pattern.

original: rma de shu ba mched pa dang / skrang ba dang / lus tsha ba dang / zug gzer dang bcas pa dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / myur du smin cing rnags pa dang / so so nas 'gas pa dang ldan pa dang / lus gang du rnag gis reg @402b ba dang rma skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rma de shu ba mched pa dang / skrang ba dang / lus tsha ba dang / zug gzer dang bcas pa dang / rims kyis 'debs pa dang / myur du smin cing rnags pa dang / so so nas 'gas pa dang ldan pa dang / lus gang du rnag gis reg @402b ba dang rma skyed par byed do //
translated: The wound becomes swollen, hot, and painful, and is accompanied by fever, and it quickly becomes ripe and suppurated, and bursts open by itself, and wherever the pus spreads, it causes sores.

original: gzhan dag na re srog chags lu ta'i dug rnam pa brgyad do zhes bya ba ni dbugs dang / mche ba dang / bshang ba dang / gci ba dang / khu chu dang / sen mo dang / khrag dang / khyad par du ni kha la dug yod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re srog chags lu ta'i dug rnam pa brgyad do zhes bya ba ni dbugs dang / mche ba dang / bshang ba dang / gci ba dang / khu chu dang / sen mo dang / khrag dang / khyad par du ni kha la dug yod do //
translated: Others say that the poison of the louse has eight aspects: breath, fangs, feces, urine, semen, claws, blood, and especially the mouth.

original: srog chags lu ta'i dug de lte ba'i phyogs su 'byung ste /🔽lus kyi gong 'og tu srin bu 'byung zhing rma skyed de /
analyzed: srog chags lu ta'i dug de lte ba'i phyogs su 'byung ste / lus kyi gong 'og tu srin bu 'byung zhing rma skyed de /
translated: The poison of the louse arises in the region of the navel.🔽It causes worms to appear above and below the body, and it causes sores.

original: des reg pa'i gos la sogs pa dang reg na yang na bar byed do //
analyzed: des reg pa'i gos la sogs pa dang reg na yang na bar byed do //
translated: If one touches the clothes, etc. that it has touched, one becomes ill.

original: de la srog chags lu tas zin pa'i dug gi shugs dang po la ni nyi ma phyed kyi bar du khab kyis phug pa tsam gyi bu ga mang du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de la srog chags lu tas zin pa'i dug gi shugs dang po la ni nyi ma phyed kyi bar du khab kyis phug pa tsam gyi bu ga mang du snang ba yin no //
translated: In the case of a bite by a poisonous spider, the first stage lasts for half a day and is marked by the appearance of many holes, as if pricked by a needle.

original: de'i mdog rab tu mi gsal bar snang zhing /
analyzed: de'i mdog rab tu mi gsal bar snang zhing /
translated: The color of the bite is not clear.

original: cung zad g-ya' ba dang / na ba dang ldan par byed do //
analyzed: cung zad g-ya' ba dang / na ba dang ldan par byed do //
translated: It itches a little and causes pain.

original: zhag gnyis pa la ni gong ma ltar snang ba'i bu ga'i nang du 'brum bus khyab par snang zhing /
analyzed: zhag gnyis pa la ni gong ma ltar snang ba'i bu ga'i nang du 'brum bus khyab par snang zhing /
translated: In the second stage, which lasts for a day, the holes that appeared in the first stage are covered with blisters.

original: mdog gsal ba dang / dbus mthon por 'dug pa dang / g-ya' ba dang / rmen bu ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: mdog gsal ba dang / dbus mthon por 'dug pa dang / g-ya' ba dang / rmen bu ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: The color is clear, the center is raised, and it itches and looks like a boil.

original: zhag gsum pa la rims kyis 'debs pa dang / ba spu langs pa dang / khrag mdog dmar ba 'khor ling rdza deb lta bur snang ba dang / tshabs cher na zhing ba spu'i khung bu nas 'dzag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhag gsum pa la rims kyis 'debs pa dang / ba spu langs pa dang / khrag mdog dmar ba 'khor ling rdza deb lta bur snang ba dang / tshabs cher na zhing ba spu'i khung bu nas 'dzag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: In the third stage, which lasts for three days, the patient has a fever, his hair stands on end, his blood is red, and he has a rash like a red clay pot. He is very ill and blood oozes from his pores.

original: nyin zhag bzhi pa la ni shas cher skrangs shing lus tsha ba dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang ; mgo 'khor bar byed do //
analyzed: nyin zhag bzhi pa la ni shas cher skrangs shing lus tsha ba dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang ; mgo 'khor bar byed do //
translated: On the fourth day, it causes swelling, fever, dyspnea, and dizziness.

original: zhag lnga pa la ni dug 'khrugs pa'i nad de dang der byed do //
analyzed: zhag lnga pa la ni dug 'khrugs pa'i nad de dang der byed do //
translated: On the fifth day, it causes various diseases due to the disturbance of the humors.

original: zhag drug pa la ni dug gi shugs gnad du 'byung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhag drug pa la ni dug gi shugs gnad du 'byung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: On the sixth day, the force of the poison enters the vital points.

original: zhag bdun pa la ni srog 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa la ni srog 'dor bar byed do //
translated: On the seventh day, it takes away life.

original: de bzhin du dug gi shugs rno ba dang / bar ma dang / tha ma'i dbye bas zhag bdun nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du dug gi shugs rno ba dang / bar ma dang / tha ma'i dbye bas zhag bdun nam /
translated: Thus, due to the classification of strong, medium, and weak poison, it causes death in seven days,

original: bcu 'am zla ba phyed kyis 'chi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bcu 'am zla ba phyed kyis 'chi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: ten days, or half a month.

original: gal te 'tsho ba yin na zhag nyi shus dug gi shugs rnam pa thams cad du zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: gal te 'tsho ba yin na zhag nyi shus dug gi shugs rnam pa thams cad du zhi bar byed do //
translated: If it is curable, the force of the poison is completely pacified in twenty days.

original: de nas srog chags lu tas zin pa la ni mtshon gyis myur du dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas srog chags lu tas zin pa la ni mtshon gyis myur du dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in the case of a person bitten by a lūtā, it should be quickly removed with a weapon.

original: shing 'dzam bu la sogs pa shing rnam pa brgyad kyis bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: shing 'dzam bu la sogs pa shing rnam pa brgyad kyis bsreg par bya'o //
translated: It should be cauterized with eight types of wood such as the rose apple tree.

original: mkhris pa shas che ba la ni mi bsreg go //
analyzed: mkhris pa shas che ba la ni mi bsreg go //
translated: One should not cauterize a wound that is dominated by bile.

original: srog chags lu tas zin pa'i rma nad la brten cing gnas bcas te spu 'byi ba dang / rtsub pa dang / rgya cher song ba de ni bcad pa 'am /
analyzed: srog chags lu tas zin pa'i rma nad la brten cing gnas bcas te spu 'byi ba dang / rtsub pa dang / rgya cher song ba de ni bcad pa 'am /
translated: If a wound is infested with lice, and is itchy, rough, and spread out, one should cut it out

original: bsreg par bya'o //🔽gong du smos pa'i dug 'joms pa'i sman @403a * //
analyzed: bsreg par bya'o // gong du smos pa'i dug 'joms pa'i sman @403a * //
translated: and cauterize it.🔽One should apply a medicinal powder that counteracts poison, as mentioned above,

original: btags pa'i phye ma rgyam tsha dang / sbrang rtsi dang bcas te bsku'o //
analyzed: btags pa'i phye ma rgyam tsha dang / sbrang rtsi dang bcas te bsku'o //
translated: mixed with salt and honey.

original: shing 'o ma can bskol ba'i khu ba grang mos blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: shing 'o ma can bskol ba'i khu ba grang mos blugs par bya'o //
translated: One should apply a cold infusion of milk-producing plants.

original: lus kun tu rma dang nad gang na yod kyang gtar gas khrag dbyung ba dang / rva gang yang rung bas gtar ga bya'o //
analyzed: lus kun tu rma dang nad gang na yod kyang gtar gas khrag dbyung ba dang / rva gang yang rung bas gtar ga bya'o //
translated: If there is a wound or illness anywhere on the body, one should open it up and let the blood out with a suitable horn.

original: byang chub kyi shing dang / sman sle ma thang ka dang / ba ru ra dang / bri yang ku dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / shug pa dang / de rnams sbrang rtsi dang mar dang sbyar ba grang mos blugs pa dang / byugs pa las thams cad la sbyar na lu ta dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing dang / sman sle ma thang ka dang / ba ru ra dang / bri yang ku dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / shug pa dang / de rnams sbrang rtsi dang mar dang sbyar ba grang mos blugs pa dang / byugs pa las thams cad la sbyar na lu ta dang /
translated: If used in combination with luti and śīta, they will destroy all poisons without exception.🔽The tree of wounds,

original: srin bu shi ta la sogs pa'i dug ma lus pa 'joms par byed do //🔽rma shing dang / btsod dang / padma ge sar dang / rgya spos dang / de rnams mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i nang du tsam pa kas bsgos te btang na phan yon gong ma bas 'phags so //
analyzed: srin bu shi ta la sogs pa'i dug ma lus pa 'joms par byed do // rma shing dang / btsod dang / padma ge sar dang / rgya spos dang / de rnams mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i nang du tsam pa kas bsgos te btang na phan yon gong ma bas 'phags so //
translated: red amṛtā,🔽lotus stamen,🔽and eagle wood, when taken with ghee and honey, and perfumed with campaka, are more beneficial than the previous [remedies].

original: sman gong ma de nyid kyi nang du ba lang gi lci khu dang / sha kha ra dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba yang phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sman gong ma de nyid kyi nang du ba lang gi lci khu dang / sha kha ra dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba yang phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same previous medicine, when taken with cow’s urine, sugar, ghee, and honey, has the same benefits as the previous [remedies].

original: aa pa ma rga dang / ldong ros dang / ba bla dang / skyer pa dang / bya ma ka dang / btsag yug snam dang / rgya spos dang / sug smel dang / ru rta dang / na le sham dang / shing mngar dang /
analyzed: aa pa ma rga dang / ldong ros dang / ba bla dang / skyer pa dang / bya ma ka dang / btsag yug snam dang / rgya spos dang / sug smel dang / ru rta dang / na le sham dang / shing mngar dang /
translated: Apamarga, red arsenic, white mustard seed, spurge, crow-eye, madder, eaglewood, orris root, Indian valerian, liquorice, and sweet flag.

original: de rnams mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba ni dug 'joms pa'i sman manda ra zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba ni dug 'joms pa'i sman manda ra zhes bya ste /
translated: These, mixed with butter and honey, are the medicine called mandara, which cures poison.

original: lde gu la sogs pa byas te bza'o //
analyzed: lde gu la sogs pa byas te bza'o //
translated: Make it into a paste and eat it.

original: rgya spos dang / seng phrom dang / shu dag dang / pu tse shel dang / pa tha dang / sug smel dang / gur gum dang / de rnams dang lhan cig sbyar ba'i dug 'joms pa'i sman 'di ni nad gzhi mang po la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgya spos dang / seng phrom dang / shu dag dang / pu tse shel dang / pa tha dang / sug smel dang / gur gum dang / de rnams dang lhan cig sbyar ba'i dug 'joms pa'i sman 'di ni nad gzhi mang po la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Eaglewood, pomegranate, sweet flag, crystal, betel nut, orris root, saffron, and together with these, this medicine that cures poison should be applied to many illnesses.

original: gandha ma da zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gandha ma da zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called gandhamadana.

original: shing mngar dang / po son cha dang / aa go la dang / ko sha ti ki dang / sin du ba ra dang / de rnams 'bras bu gsum bskol ba'i chu dang sbyar te 'thungs na /
analyzed: shing mngar dang / po son cha dang / aa go la dang / ko sha ti ki dang / sin du ba ra dang / de rnams 'bras bu gsum bskol ba'i chu dang sbyar te 'thungs na /
translated: Take a decoction of the three fruits, namely, sweet wood, posatha, agalloch, koshataki, and sindhuvara, and drink it.

original: bad kan las gyur ba'i dug nad mi bzad pa phyir 'byin te skyug par byed do //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur ba'i dug nad mi bzad pa phyir 'byin te skyug par byed do //
translated: This will induce vomiting and expel the unbearable poisoning caused by phlegm.

original: shri sha'i lo ma dang / rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: shri sha'i lo ma dang / rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'am /
translated: Take the leaves, roots, and fruits of shrisha,

original: yang na aang go la'i lo ma dang / rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu dang / de gnyis gang yang rung ba 'bras bu gsum dang lhan cig bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du /
analyzed: yang na aang go la'i lo ma dang / rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu dang / de gnyis gang yang rung ba 'bras bu gsum dang lhan cig bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du /
translated: or the leaves, roots, and fruits of agalloch, or any one of the two together with the three fruits, and boil them to make a decoction.

original: ni li ni dang / dur byed la sogs pa'i phye ma btab ste bkru sman du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ni li ni dang / dur byed la sogs pa'i phye ma btab ste bkru sman du sbyar ro //
translated: Add to it the powders of nilini, durva, and so on, and use it as a purgative.

original: srog chags lu tas zin pa'i dug nad la @403b tsha ba dang skrang ba la sogs pa'i nad zhi ba dang / padma'i snying po zhes bya ba'i nad rma'i nang du 'byung ste /
analyzed: srog chags lu tas zin pa'i dug nad la @403b tsha ba dang skrang ba la sogs pa'i nad zhi ba dang / padma'i snying po zhes bya ba'i nad rma'i nang du 'byung ste /
translated: For poisoning caused by the lutas insect, use it to treat the diseases of fever, swelling, and so on, and the disease called lotus heart that arises in the wound.

original: de la ni dang po le brgan rtsi'i me tog dang / ba bla dang / gtsang sman khron bu dang / thi ba'i rtug pa dang / dur byid dang / rgyam tsha dang / danti dang / de rnams sbyar bas rma la bskus na padma'i snying po zhes bya ba'i nad 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: de la ni dang po le brgan rtsi'i me tog dang / ba bla dang / gtsang sman khron bu dang / thi ba'i rtug pa dang / dur byid dang / rgyam tsha dang / danti dang / de rnams sbyar bas rma la bskus na padma'i snying po zhes bya ba'i nad 'byin par byed do //
translated: For that, first apply a paste of madder flower, Indian spikenard, clean medicinal soil, pigeon droppings, Indian hellebore, sea salt, and dantī. If applied to the wound, it will remove the disease called lotus heart.

original: yang na autta ma ka ni ri'i rtsa ba dang / smyug ma'i shun pa 'am /
analyzed: yang na autta ma ka ni ri'i rtsa ba dang / smyug ma'i shun pa 'am /
translated: Alternatively, use the root of uttamakaṇi, bamboo skin,

original: yang na rgyam tsha dang / ru rta dang / danti dang / pu tse shel dang / de rnams zho dang lhan cig sbyar ba 'am /
analyzed: yang na rgyam tsha dang / ru rta dang / danti dang / pu tse shel dang / de rnams zho dang lhan cig sbyar ba 'am /
translated: or a paste of sea salt, asafoetida, dantī, purisela, and curd.

original: yang na ra tsa ko sha ta ki'i rtsa ba dang / phabs gnyis dar ba dang lhan cig sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: yang na ra tsa ko sha ta ki'i rtsa ba dang / phabs gnyis dar ba dang lhan cig sbyor ba'am /
translated: Or use the root of racakośataka and the two types of yeast with molasses.

original: sbyor ba de dag gang yang rung bas bsku bar byas na /
analyzed: sbyor ba de dag gang yang rung bas bsku bar byas na /
translated: By applying any of these compounds,

original: padma'i snying po zhes bya ba'i nad 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: padma'i snying po zhes bya ba'i nad 'byin par byed do //
translated: it will remove the disease called lotus heart.

original: de'i dus su dug 'joms pa'i sman gyis nyams brta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dus su dug 'joms pa'i sman gyis nyams brta bar bya ste /
translated: At that time, one should test the strength of the patient with antidotal medicine.

original: de yang snum gyi bya ba ma lus pa dang / mar rnams legs par spyad do //
analyzed: de yang snum gyi bya ba ma lus pa dang / mar rnams legs par spyad do //
translated: All the functions of oil are well performed by ghee.

original: dug gi nad kyis zin pa la ni til mar blud cing bsten na dug 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur te ji ltar rtsva la me mched pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dug gi nad kyis zin pa la ni til mar blud cing bsten na dug 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur te ji ltar rtsva la me mched pa bzhin no //
translated: For one afflicted by poison, if one gives and relies on sesame oil, the poison increases and spreads, just as fire spreads through grass.
