translated: One should drink a decoction of the root of mon sne’u da me ru boiled with ghee.

original: ser po rnam gnyis dang / ge ri karni ka dang / btsod dang / shing mngar dang / sle tres dang / de rnams mar dang sbyar ba'i btung ba sbyar nas yang bza'o //
analyzed: ser po rnam gnyis dang / ge ri karni ka dang / btsod dang / shing mngar dang / sle tres dang / de rnams mar dang sbyar ba'i btung ba sbyar nas yang bza'o //
translated: One should eat a drink prepared with the two types of yellow myrobalan, geriya, karṇikāra, madder, sweet flag, and long pepper mixed with ghee.

original: yang na thal tres kyi rtsa ba mar dang bskol ba 'am /
analyzed: yang na thal tres kyi rtsa ba mar dang bskol ba 'am /
translated: Alternatively, one should drink a decoction of the root of thul tre boiled with ghee.

original: yang na ka pid ta rnam lnga mar dang lhan cig bskol ba gang yang rung ba btud bar blud na phan no //
analyzed: yang na ka pid ta rnam lnga mar dang lhan cig bskol ba gang yang rung ba btud bar blud na phan no //
translated: Alternatively, one should drink a decoction of any of the five myrobalan fruits boiled with ghee.

original: sindhu ra dang / rgya spos dang / shi kru dang / bil ba'i rtsa ba dang / ba spru ba dang / shu dag dang / gze ma dang / dzi mu ta rnams bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang ldan par blud do //
analyzed: sindhu ra dang / rgya spos dang / shi kru dang / bil ba'i rtsa ba dang / ba spru ba dang / shu dag dang / gze ma dang / dzi mu ta rnams bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang ldan par blud do //
translated: One should drink a decoction of sindūra, camphor, śikrī, the root of bilva, ba sbru, sweet flag, ginger, and jimuta, mixed with honey.

original: kha zas su ni 'bras s'a lu'i chan zho dang lhan cig zos na byi ba'i dug gis nyam thag pa sel to //
analyzed: kha zas su ni 'bras s'a lu'i chan zho dang lhan cig zos na byi ba'i dug gis nyam thag pa sel to //
translated: If one eats rice gruel with curd, it cures the distress caused by rat poison.

original: sha ra phung ka'i rtsa ba sa bon btags pa'i phye ma dar ba dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
analyzed: sha ra phung ka'i rtsa ba sa bon btags pa'i phye ma dar ba dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
translated: One should drink a potion of the root of śārapungha mixed with flour and water.

original: aangko la'i rtsa ba btags par thug gi gcin dang sbyar ba'i 'dag gus bsku ba dang / btung bar sbyar na ni byi ba'i dug thams cad 'joms so //
analyzed: aangko la'i rtsa ba btags par thug gi gcin dang sbyar ba'i 'dag gus bsku ba dang / btung bar sbyar na ni byi ba'i dug thams cad 'joms so //
translated: An enema and a potion of the root of aṅkola mixed with goat’s urine will destroy all rat poisons.

original: ka pid ta'i snying po dang / shing ti la ka dang / til dang / ma ko la'i rtsa ba rnams kyi phye ma ba gcin dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: ka pid ta'i snying po dang / shing ti la ka dang / til dang / ma ko la'i rtsa ba rnams kyi phye ma ba gcin dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Give a potion of the essence of kapeśa, the root of tilvaka, sesame, and makkola mixed with goat’s urine.

original: yang na shing ti la ka btags pa'i phye ma 'o ma dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na shing ti la ka btags pa'i phye ma 'o ma dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Or give a potion of the flour of tilvaka mixed with milk.

original: yang na she rgya ka'i rtsa ba sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba 'bras bkrus pa'i chu dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na she rgya ka'i rtsa ba sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba 'bras bkrus pa'i chu dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Or give a potion of the root of śegyā mixed with honey and the water in which rice has been washed.

original: yang na khu ba kha ba'i snod kyi nang du chu zhag gcig sbyar ba blud par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na khu ba kha ba'i snod kyi nang du chu zhag gcig sbyar ba blud par bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, one should administer a mixture of semen and urine in a vessel of cow's milk.

original: sin du ba ra'i rtsa ba dang / byi ba'i rus pa dang / rgya spos dang / bong nga dkar po rnams chu la btab ste /
analyzed: sin du ba ra'i rtsa ba dang / byi ba'i rus pa dang / rgya spos dang / bong nga dkar po rnams chu la btab ste /
translated: One should prepare a paste of Sindhuvara root, mouse bone, eagle wood, and white ox bezoar, and administer it.

original: snar blugs pa la sogs pa byas na byi ba'i dug sel bar byed do //
analyzed: snar blugs pa la sogs pa byas na byi ba'i dug sel bar byed do //
translated: By doing so, one can eliminate the poison of a mouse.

original: byi ba'i dug de'i lhag ma lus pa na dus phyis nad gzhi rnams ji lta ji ltar skyed pa'i dus de dang de'i tshe dug de yang rjes su 'phel zhing skye bar 'gyur te /🔽de la ni gnas skabs brtags te /
analyzed: byi ba'i dug de'i lhag ma lus pa na dus phyis nad gzhi rnams ji lta ji ltar skyed pa'i dus de dang de'i tshe dug de yang rjes su 'phel zhing skye bar 'gyur te / de la ni gnas skabs brtags te /
translated: If the remaining poison of a mouse is not completely eliminated, later on, whenever the disease is produced, the poison will also increase and arise.

original: nad gzhi rang rang gi dug gso ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'joms pa'i sman gyis gso ba yang de ltar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nad gzhi rang rang gi dug gso ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'joms pa'i sman gyis gso ba yang de ltar sbyar ro //
translated: In that case, one should examine the condition and apply the appropriate medicine to eliminate the poison of each disease.

original: aa la ka zhes bya ba'i dug gis bzung ba la ni mar bskol bas rma bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: aa la ka zhes bya ba'i dug gis bzung ba la ni mar bskol bas rma bsreg par bya'o //
translated: In the case of being seized by the poison called alaka, one should cauterize with a heated butter-soaked cloth.

original: gong du smos pa'i dug 'joms pa'i sman gyi lde gus bskus te /
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i dug 'joms pa'i sman gyi lde gus bskus te /
translated: One should apply the paste of the poison-eliminating medicine mentioned above.

original: mar rnying pa btung bar blud do //
analyzed: mar rnying pa btung bar blud do //
translated: and give him old butter to drink.

original: aarga'i 'o ma dang ldan pa'i bkru sman yang myur du bya'o //
analyzed: aarga'i 'o ma dang ldan pa'i bkru sman yang myur du bya'o //
translated: He should also be given a purgative quickly, mixed with the milk of the arka plant.

original: aang ko la'i rtsa ba byang phyogs su zug pa de btus la bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du 'bras @406a * //
analyzed: aang ko la'i rtsa ba byang phyogs su zug pa de btus la bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du 'bras @406a * //
translated: The root of the aṅkola plant, which points to the north, should be dug up and boiled.

original: bu gsum dang / shing pi pi ling dang / phye mar btab ba blud do //
analyzed: bu gsum dang / shing pi pi ling dang / phye mar btab ba blud do //
translated: Rice, the three fruits, and pippali should be ground into a powder and given to him in this decoction.

original: yang na lang tang rtse'i 'bras bu dang / ge ri karni dang / ba spru ba rnams bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na lang tang rtse'i 'bras bu dang / ge ri karni dang / ba spru ba rnams bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
translated: Alternatively, he should be given a decoction of the fruits of the lantung tree, girikarṇī, and baushaka.

original: til btags pa'i lde gu dang / ru sha dang / lcags phye dang / 'o ma dang / bu ram bsres pa blud na /
analyzed: til btags pa'i lde gu dang / ru sha dang / lcags phye dang / 'o ma dang / bu ram bsres pa blud na /
translated: If he is given a paste of sesamum, ruśa, iron filings, milk, and sugar,

original: aa la ka'i dug mi bzad pa yang 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: aa la ka'i dug mi bzad pa yang 'joms par byed do //
translated: even the most virulent poison of the alak plant will be destroyed.

original: ji ltar sprin gyi tshogs rlung gis gtor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sprin gyi tshogs rlung gis gtor ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as a mass of clouds is dispersed by the wind.

original: aa la ka'i dug gis zin pa'i mi la ni grub pa'i sngags dang / sman dang / rin po che dang ldan pas lus bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: aa la ka'i dug gis zin pa'i mi la ni grub pa'i sngags dang / sman dang / rin po che dang ldan pas lus bkru bar bya'o //
translated: A person who has been bitten by the alak plant should be bathed with the recitation of mantras, herbs, and precious substances.

original: srog chags rkang bzhi pa dang / rkang bzhi pa'i so dang sen mo'i nang dug yod pas bzung na smas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog chags rkang bzhi pa dang / rkang bzhi pa'i so dang sen mo'i nang dug yod pas bzung na smas par 'gyur te /
translated: If bitten by a four-legged animal, or by one with teeth and claws, the wound will be damaged.

original: des skrangs pa dang / smin pa dang / mdog dmar ba dang / tsha ba skyes pa dang / chu ser 'dzag pa dang / nad dang bcas pa la ni so ma bal ka dang / aa sha gar na dang / kha la ba go dzi ha dang /
analyzed: des skrangs pa dang / smin pa dang / mdog dmar ba dang / tsha ba skyes pa dang / chu ser 'dzag pa dang / nad dang bcas pa la ni so ma bal ka dang / aa sha gar na dang / kha la ba go dzi ha dang /
translated: If there is swelling, suppuration, redness, pain, discharge of lymph, and fever, apply a paste of Somavalka, Ashvagandha, Kalabhaka,

original: ha na sa pa ti ka dang ser po rnam gnyis dang / btsag dang / de rnams kyi lde gus rma la bskus na /
analyzed: ha na sa pa ti ka dang ser po rnam gnyis dang / btsag dang / de rnams kyi lde gus rma la bskus na /
translated: Hanasa, the two types of Haridra, and Madana fruit to the wound.

original: sen mo dang / so las gyur pa'i dug 'joms so //🔽byi ba dang / aa la ka'i dug gis bzung ba'i nad dmigs brtags shing gso ba'i cho ga'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa brgyad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sen mo dang / so las gyur pa'i dug 'joms so // byi ba dang / aa la ka'i dug gis bzung ba'i nad dmigs brtags shing gso ba'i cho ga'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa brgyad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This will eliminate poison from teeth and claws.🔽This concludes the thirty-eighth chapter, on the diagnosis and treatment of rat and Alak poison, from The Secret Quintessential Instructions on the Eight Branches of the Ambrosia Essence Tantra.

original: // / sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa las dug gso ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: // / sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa las dug gso ba bshad zin to /
translated: This completes the explanation of the treatment of poison from the Eight Branches of the Ambrosia Essence Tantra.

original: // / de nas bcud kyis len gyi cho ga'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas bcud kyis len gyi cho ga'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the chapter on the methods of Rasayana.

original: de la bcud kyis len zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la bcud kyis len zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The elixirs are:

original: tshe ring ba dang / dran pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / nad med pa dang / na tshod gzhon nur gyur pa dang / gzi mdangs skyed pa dang / skad gsal ba dang / lus dang dbang po rnams kyi stobs skye ba dang /
analyzed: tshe ring ba dang / dran pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / nad med pa dang / na tshod gzhon nur gyur pa dang / gzi mdangs skyed pa dang / skad gsal ba dang / lus dang dbang po rnams kyi stobs skye ba dang /
translated: long life, memory, intelligence, health, youthfulness, radiance, eloquence, strength of body and faculties,

original: ngag grub pa dang / ro tsa bar 'gyur ba dang / snying du sdug pa rnams thob par byed pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: ngag grub pa dang / ro tsa bar 'gyur ba dang / snying du sdug pa rnams thob par byed pa rnams yin no //
translated: success in speech, a sweet voice, and the attainment of what is dear.

original: de la ci'i phyir bcud kyis len zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir bcud kyis len zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called elixirs?

original: bcud la sogs pa nyams pa de thob par byed pa'i thabs ni bcud kyis len zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcud la sogs pa nyams pa de thob par byed pa'i thabs ni bcud kyis len zhes bya'o //
translated: The means of attaining what has been lost, such as vitality, are called elixirs.

original: de sgrub pa yang na tshod dang po dang / bar ma la g-yul las rgyal ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de sgrub pa yang na tshod dang po dang / bar ma la g-yul las rgyal ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: And their practice is to be accomplished in the first and middle stages of life, with the nature of victory in battle.

original: thog mar bcud kyis len bsgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: thog mar bcud kyis len bsgrub par 'dod na /
translated: At the outset, one who desires to practice the elixirs🔽should first of all be intent on the vows of purification and increase.

original: dang po rnam pa thams cad du snum chos dang khrag gtar ba dang / @406b slon khrus kyis lus dag par bya ba gces so //
analyzed: dang po rnam pa thams cad du snum chos dang khrag gtar ba dang / @406b slon khrus kyis lus dag par bya ba gces so //
translated: First, it is very important to purify the body in every way with unctuous substances, bloodletting, and purgation.

original: gal te slon khrus kyis lus ma dag cing cho ga log par bcud kyis len gyis dang po ro tsa bar byed pa'i cho ga sgrub par byed na ni 'bras bu don med de /
analyzed: gal te slon khrus kyis lus ma dag cing cho ga log par bcud kyis len gyis dang po ro tsa bar byed pa'i cho ga sgrub par byed na ni 'bras bu don med de /
translated: If the body is not purified by purgation and the elixir preparation is done with a wrong ritual, then the result is meaningless.

original: ji ltar dri ma dang bcas pa'i ras la ri mo 'dri ba 'bras bu med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dri ma dang bcas pa'i ras la ri mo 'dri ba 'bras bu med pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as painting a cloth with stains is fruitless.

original: de la bcud kyis len gyi sbyor ba bsgrub pa la rnam pa gnyis su drang srong rnams kyis bshad do //
analyzed: de la bcud kyis len gyi sbyor ba bsgrub pa la rnam pa gnyis su drang srong rnams kyis bshad do //
translated: In that regard, the sages explain that the elixir preparation has two aspects.

original: de yang khang pa rlung dang nyi ma sa ma phog pa'i gnas su 'dug pa dang / rlung dang nyi ma lhags pa'i gnas gnyis las gong ma mchog yin na /
analyzed: de yang khang pa rlung dang nyi ma sa ma phog pa'i gnas su 'dug pa dang / rlung dang nyi ma lhags pa'i gnas gnyis las gong ma mchog yin na /
translated: Moreover, it is better to stay in a place where the wind, sun, and dust do not reach than in a place where wind, sun, and dust do reach.

original: khang ba bya ba de yang rlung med pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang yang thog gi nang du zhal zhal la sogs pas legs par bstar te /
analyzed: khang ba bya ba de yang rlung med pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang yang thog gi nang du zhal zhal la sogs pas legs par bstar te /
translated: The room should be free of wind, free of danger, and well-sealed with plaster inside and out.

original: yo byad rnams dang / sman pa mkhas pas yang yo byad dang bcas pa nye bar bsags la /
analyzed: yo byad rnams dang / sman pa mkhas pas yang yo byad dang bcas pa nye bar bsags la /
translated: The necessary articles and a skilled physician should be close at hand.

original: khang pa yang dbang ldan gyi phyogs su kha bltas te /
analyzed: khang pa yang dbang ldan gyi phyogs su kha bltas te /
translated: The room should face in a favorable direction.

original: gnas shis par bya ba dang / khang pa sbrel ma gsum du byas te skar khung shin tu phra bar btod do //
analyzed: gnas shis par bya ba dang / khang pa sbrel ma gsum du byas te skar khung shin tu phra bar btod do //
translated: The site should be auspicious, and the room should have three windows with very small openings.

original: de yang du ba dang / nyi ma dang / rul ba dang / srog chags gdug pa dang / bud med dang / glen pa sogs mi bgrod pa'i gnas su bya'o //
analyzed: de yang du ba dang / nyi ma dang / rul ba dang / srog chags gdug pa dang / bud med dang / glen pa sogs mi bgrod pa'i gnas su bya'o //
translated: It should be a place where smoke, sunlight, decay, poisonous creatures, women, fools, and the like are absent.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu nyin zhag shis pa la yang phyi rol gyi lus kyi khrus gtsang sbra bya ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu nyin zhag shis pa la yang phyi rol gyi lus kyi khrus gtsang sbra bya ste /
translated: Then, on an auspicious day, one should bathe outside, purify oneself,

original: mchod par 'os pa rnams la mchod de khang pa der 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par 'os pa rnams la mchod de khang pa der 'dug par bya'o //
translated: and make offerings to those who are worthy of offerings. One should then enter the room.

original: de nas slon khrus kyis lus sbyangs nas nyams stobs bde bar skyes pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / blo brtan pa dang / dad pa dang ldan pa dang / g-yul las dbang po rnams rgyal bar bya ba dang / sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: de nas slon khrus kyis lus sbyangs nas nyams stobs bde bar skyes pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / blo brtan pa dang / dad pa dang ldan pa dang / g-yul las dbang po rnams rgyal bar bya ba dang / sbyin pa dang /
translated: Then, after purifying the body with a cleansing enema, when the strength of the body has arisen well, when one is celibate, when one is steadfast, when one is endowed with faith, when one has conquered the senses in battle, when one abides in generosity,

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa la gnas pa dang / bden pa dang / brtul zhugs dang / chos bzhin du spyod pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / gnyid log pa dang / mi log pa'i tshod tsam shes shing rig par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa la gnas pa dang / bden pa dang / brtul zhugs dang / chos bzhin du spyod pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / gnyid log pa dang / mi log pa'i tshod tsam shes shing rig par spyod pa dang /
translated: morality, and so forth, when one practices the truth, observances, and conduct in accordance with the Dharma, when one is mindful of the gods, when one knows and is aware of the proper amount of sleep and wakefulness,

original: sman la dga' zhing des pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis bcud kyis len brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sman la dga' zhing des pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis bcud kyis len brtsam par bya'o //
translated: an individual who delights in medicine and possesses gentleness should begin the rasayana.

original: de yang thog mar snum chos dang dugs byas pa'i skyes bus bkru sman dang / aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / rgyam tsha dang / bca' sga dang / shu dag dang / yung ba dang / pi pi ling dang / byi dang ga dang /
analyzed: de yang thog mar snum chos dang dugs byas pa'i skyes bus bkru sman dang / aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / rgyam tsha dang / bca' sga dang / shu dag dang / yung ba dang / pi pi ling dang / byi dang ga dang /
translated: First, a person who has undergone oil therapy and fomentation should use a purgative medicine, yellow myrobalan, sour jujube, sea salt, ginger, sweet flag, indigo, black pepper, and long pepper.

original: bu ram dang / de rnams chu dron @407a * //
analyzed: bu ram dang / de rnams chu dron @407a * //
translated: Mix these with warm water

original: dang sbyar bas bkru sman du bya'o //
analyzed: dang sbyar bas bkru sman du bya'o //
translated: and use them as a purgative medicine.

original: khrus de legs te lus dag pa dang / thug ba rkyang rkyang po la sogs pa dang kha zas kyi rim pa sbyar te /
analyzed: khrus de legs te lus dag pa dang / thug ba rkyang rkyang po la sogs pa dang kha zas kyi rim pa sbyar te /
translated: That bath is excellent for purifying the body and for applying the stages of food, such as thin gruel.

original: de yang zhag gsum mam lnga 'am bdun gyi bar du mar dang bcas par sbyor ro //
analyzed: de yang zhag gsum mam lnga 'am bdun gyi bar du mar dang bcas par sbyor ro //
translated: Moreover, for three, five, or seven days, apply it together with ghee.

original: yang na ya ba ka zhes bya ba'o ma dang nas rnying pa'i phye ma sbyar ba lus dag ba'i 'og tu sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na ya ba ka zhes bya ba'o ma dang nas rnying pa'i phye ma sbyar ba lus dag ba'i 'og tu sbyin no //
translated: Alternatively, after purifying the body, give a mixture of goat's milk and old barley flour, called yavak.

original: de ltar lto ba legs par sbyangs nas bcud kyis len gyi sbyor ba la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar lto ba legs par sbyangs nas bcud kyis len gyi sbyor ba la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Thus, after properly purifying the stomach, one should engage in the practice of rasayana.

original: de yang sman pa mkhas pa mang pos gang dang gang la sman goms shing rig pas brtags te sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang sman pa mkhas pa mang pos gang dang gang la sman goms shing rig pas brtags te sbyar ro //
translated: Furthermore, many skilled physicians, having examined with their knowledge and experience, prepared the medicine.

original: aa ru rdog ma stong dang ; de'i sum 'gyur gyi skyu ru ra dang / rtsa ba lnga pa spyi la srang nyis brgya dang / sman de rnams spyi'i bcu 'gyur gyi chu dang bskol te /
analyzed: aa ru rdog ma stong dang ; de'i sum 'gyur gyi skyu ru ra dang / rtsa ba lnga pa spyi la srang nyis brgya dang / sman de rnams spyi'i bcu 'gyur gyi chu dang bskol te /
translated: One thousand pieces of Haritaki, three times that amount of Amlavetasa, and two hundred Palas of the five roots were boiled in ten times the total amount of water.

original: lhag ma bcu cha gcig lus pa dang / aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / rtsa ba lnga pa so sor phyung ste /
analyzed: lhag ma bcu cha gcig lus pa dang / aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / rtsa ba lnga pa so sor phyung ste /
translated: When only one-tenth of the liquid remained, the Haritaki, Amlavetasa, and five roots were removed.

original: skyu ru ra dang / aa ru ra brdungs pa'i rus pa phyung ste bor ba'i shun pa khu ba'i nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: skyu ru ra dang / aa ru ra brdungs pa'i rus pa phyung ste bor ba'i shun pa khu ba'i nang du bcug ste /
translated: The husks of the crushed Haritaki and Amlavetasa were removed and put back into the liquid.

original: de'i nang du shing tsha dang / sug smel dang / gdur dang / skyer pa dang / pi pi ling dang / aa ka ru dang / tsandan dang / sman rgya ka parni dang / ka na ka dang / sha ka pushpa dang / shu dag dang /
analyzed: de'i nang du shing tsha dang / sug smel dang / gdur dang / skyer pa dang / pi pi ling dang / aa ka ru dang / tsandan dang / sman rgya ka parni dang / ka na ka dang / sha ka pushpa dang / shu dag dang /
translated: To that were added Citraka, Shunthi, Devadaru, Kyurura, Pippali, Agaru, Chandana, the Indian medicine Kapini, Kanaka, Shakya Pushpa, and Shudag.

original: bla ba dang / shing mngar dang / byi dang ga dang / de rnams srang bzhi bzhi btags pa'i phye ma dang / khar dkar po srang brgya phrag bcu gcig dang / mar srang sum brgya brgyad cu rtsa bzhi dang / til mar srang nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug dang /
analyzed: bla ba dang / shing mngar dang / byi dang ga dang / de rnams srang bzhi bzhi btags pa'i phye ma dang / khar dkar po srang brgya phrag bcu gcig dang / mar srang sum brgya brgyad cu rtsa bzhi dang / til mar srang nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug dang /
translated: Add eleven hundred su of white sugar, three hundred and eighty-four su of butter, and two hundred and fifty-six su of sesame oil.

original: de rnams lhan cig bskol te lde gu tsam du gyur pa dang / phyir phyung la bsgrangs pa'i nang du sbrang rtsi srang sum brgya nyi shu bcug la kha gzar gyis dkrugs te /
analyzed: de rnams lhan cig bskol te lde gu tsam du gyur pa dang / phyir phyung la bsgrangs pa'i nang du sbrang rtsi srang sum brgya nyi shu bcug la kha gzar gyis dkrugs te /
translated: Boil these together until they become a paste, then remove them and add three hundred and twenty su of honey. Stir with a spoon.

original: rdza ma snum can gyi nang du bcug la kha zas zhu ba'i 'og tu de las thun rab 'bring gsum du bshad pa las thun ci ran zhig gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdza ma snum can gyi nang du bcug la kha zas zhu ba'i 'og tu de las thun rab 'bring gsum du bshad pa las thun ci ran zhig gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Place this in an oiled clay pot and take the appropriate dose, which is explained as being the best, medium, or lesser, from this.

original: de nas sman de zhu ba'i tshod tsam na /
analyzed: de nas sman de zhu ba'i tshod tsam na /
translated: Then, when the medicine is almost digested,

original: 'bras drug cu pa dang 'o mar sbyar ba kha zas su bza'o //
analyzed: 'bras drug cu pa dang 'o mar sbyar ba kha zas su bza'o //
translated: eat food prepared with the six grains and milk.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i bcud kyis len 'di tshangs pas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i bcud kyis len 'di tshangs pas bstan pa yin te /
translated: This elixir explained in this way was taught by Brahma.

original: drang srong bi ga na sva zhes bya ba dang / bal khyi lya zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du yang gzhan yang drang srong dka' thub can mang pos bsgrubs te /
analyzed: drang srong bi ga na sva zhes bya ba dang / bal khyi lya zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du yang gzhan yang drang srong dka' thub can mang pos bsgrubs te /
translated: It was also accomplished by many sages with ascetic practices, such as the sage named Viganasva, the sage named Valkhilya, and others.

original: de yang snyom pa dang / ngal zhing dub pa dang / gnyer ma dang / skra dkar @407b dang de rnams kyi nad sel zhing /
analyzed: de yang snyom pa dang / ngal zhing dub pa dang / gnyer ma dang / skra dkar @407b dang de rnams kyi nad sel zhing /
translated: It removes wrinkles, fatigue, gray hair, and their diseases.

original: yid gzhungs pa dang / dran pa gsal ba dang / stobs dang ldan pa dang / tshe yang dpag tu med pa 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa dang / dran pa gsal ba dang / stobs dang ldan pa dang / tshe yang dpag tu med pa 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It increases memory, intelligence, strength, and one lives for an immeasurable lifespan.

original: aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra rdog ma stong dang / pi pi ling 'bru stong dang / rgya skyegs shing gzhon nu'i thal ba chu dang sbyar te btsags pa'i khu ba snod kyi nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra rdog ma stong dang / pi pi ling 'bru stong dang / rgya skyegs shing gzhon nu'i thal ba chu dang sbyar te btsags pa'i khu ba snod kyi nang du bcug ste /
translated: One thousand pieces of haritaki, one thousand seeds of long pepper, and the ash of a young myrobalan tree mixed with water, the liquid strained and put in a vessel,

original: aa ru ra dang / pi pi ling rnams de'i nang du sbangs te grib ma la skams te phye mar byas pa de'i bcu 'gyur gyi kha ra dkar po dang / bzhi 'gyur gyi mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang de rnams mar snod kyi bum pa'i nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: aa ru ra dang / pi pi ling rnams de'i nang du sbangs te grib ma la skams te phye mar byas pa de'i bcu 'gyur gyi kha ra dkar po dang / bzhi 'gyur gyi mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang de rnams mar snod kyi bum pa'i nang du bcug ste /
translated: Soak the ingredients in a mixture of ghee and honey, and then dry them in the shade. Grind them into a powder, and add ten times as much white sugar, one quarter as much ghee, and honey.

original: sa brkos ba'i nang du zla ba drug bzhag la de nas phyung ste /
analyzed: sa brkos ba'i nang du zla ba drug bzhag la de nas phyung ste /
translated: Place the mixture in a clay pot and bury it in the ground for six months.

original: me drod ji lta ba bzhin du nang bar sman bza' ste /
analyzed: me drod ji lta ba bzhin du nang bar sman bza' ste /
translated: Then, when you take it out, eat the medicine according to the instructions for the digestive heat.

original: kha zas kyang legs par sbyar ba rtag tu bsten cing /
analyzed: kha zas kyang legs par sbyar ba rtag tu bsten cing /
translated: Also, always rely on a well-prepared diet.

original: sman ma lus par zos na lo brgya 'tsho zhing nad med pa dang / skra dkar med pa dang / lus kyi nyams stobs 'phel zhing /
analyzed: sman ma lus par zos na lo brgya 'tsho zhing nad med pa dang / skra dkar med pa dang / lus kyi nyams stobs 'phel zhing /
translated: If you take the entire amount of the medicine, you will live one hundred years without illness, will not have gray hair, and your physical strength will increase.

original: khyad par du dran pa gsal ba dang / yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par du dran pa gsal ba dang / yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In particular, your memory will be clear and your mind will be sharp.

original: rgya skyegs shing rlon pa sngon po'i thor to bcad de nang khru gnyis brkos pa'i nang du skyu ru ra sar ba legs par smin pas bkang ste /
analyzed: rgya skyegs shing rlon pa sngon po'i thor to bcad de nang khru gnyis brkos pa'i nang du skyu ru ra sar ba legs par smin pas bkang ste /
translated: Cut off a fresh blue lac tree, and dig out the inside to a depth of two cubits. Fill it with fresh myrobalan plums that are well ripened.

original: phyi rol kun nas rtsva ku shas dkris la padma skyes pa'i 'dam gyis phyi rol nas bskus te /
analyzed: phyi rol kun nas rtsva ku shas dkris la padma skyes pa'i 'dam gyis phyi rol nas bskus te /
translated: Wrap it completely on the outside with kuśa grass and smear it on the outside with lotus-born mud.

original: rlung med pa'i gnas su ba'i lci ba'i mes bsregs la btsos te /
analyzed: rlung med pa'i gnas su ba'i lci ba'i mes bsregs la btsos te /
translated: In a place without wind, heat it with a fire of cow dung and cook it.

original: de nas skyu ru ra chos pa dang / skyes bu des mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang bcas pa yog tshad du bza' zhing /
analyzed: de nas skyu ru ra chos pa dang / skyes bu des mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang bcas pa yog tshad du bza' zhing /
translated: Then, the person should eat as much as he likes of the cooked myrobalan plums together with ghee and honey.

original: btung bar ni 'o ma bskol ba ci 'dod pa blud de /
analyzed: btung bar ni 'o ma bskol ba ci 'dod pa blud de /
translated: As a drink, he should be given as much as he likes of boiled milk.

original: de ltar zla ba gcig gi bar du kha zas gzhan mi za bar de nyid kyis lus gso bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zla ba gcig gi bar du kha zas gzhan mi za bar de nyid kyis lus gso bar bya ste /
translated: In this way, for one month, he should nourish his body with just that, not eating any other food.

original: gzhan yang spang bar bya ba ni spangs la /
analyzed: gzhan yang spang bar bya ba ni spangs la /
translated: Moreover, he should avoid what is to be abandoned.

original: chu grang mo ni 'bad pa dang bcas bas lus dang / lag pas kyang reg tu mi rung ste bsrung ngo //
analyzed: chu grang mo ni 'bad pa dang bcas bas lus dang / lag pas kyang reg tu mi rung ste bsrung ngo //
translated: He should protect himself from touching with his body and hands cold water with effort.

original: de ltar tshul bzhin bsten na zhag bcu gcig 'das pa dang / skra dang / so dang / sen mo rnams lhags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar tshul bzhin bsten na zhag bcu gcig 'das pa dang / skra dang / so dang / sen mo rnams lhags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one resorts to this method in the right way, after eleven days have passed, one’s hair, teeth, and nails will fall out.

original: ji ste nyin zhag nyung du spyad na yang gzugs bzang zhing bud med la phod pa dang / glang po che'i stobs dang 'dra ba thob ste /
analyzed: ji ste nyin zhag nyung du spyad na yang gzugs bzang zhing bud med la phod pa dang / glang po che'i stobs dang 'dra ba thob ste /
translated: Even if one practices for fewer days, one will obtain a good figure, be able to compete with women, and have the strength of an elephant.

original: khyad par du yid gzhungs pa dang / stobs dang ldan pa dang / blo che ba dang / snying stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /🔽lo stong gi bar du 'tsho @408a * //
analyzed: khyad par du yid gzhungs pa dang / stobs dang ldan pa dang / blo che ba dang / snying stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te / lo stong gi bar du 'tsho @408a * //
translated: In particular, one will have a sharp mind, be strong, have great intelligence, and be courageous.

original: bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will live for a thousand years.

original: rtsa ba bcu pa dang / ba bla dang / gla sgang dang / dzi ba ka dang / zangs rtsi ba dang / autpa la dang / 'dab ma rnam gnyis dang / pi pi ling dang / me sha ti gi dang / med rnam gnyis dang /
analyzed: rtsa ba bcu pa dang / ba bla dang / gla sgang dang / dzi ba ka dang / zangs rtsi ba dang / autpa la dang / 'dab ma rnam gnyis dang / pi pi ling dang / me sha ti gi dang / med rnam gnyis dang /
translated: One should take ten roots, milk, sugar, ghee, honey, and the three sweets,

original: lca ba dang / dzi banti dang / sug smel dang / aa ka ru dang ; rgun 'brum dang / pushkar m'u la dang / zur ba dang / ba spru ba dang / ka ko la rnam gnyis dang / sle tres dang / aa ru ra dang /
analyzed: lca ba dang / dzi banti dang / sug smel dang / aa ka ru dang ; rgun 'brum dang / pushkar m'u la dang / zur ba dang / ba spru ba dang / ka ko la rnam gnyis dang / sle tres dang / aa ru ra dang /
translated: The medicines are one ounce each of licorice, jivanti, dry ginger, aguru, grapes, pushkaramula, sour jujube, bacopa, the two kakola, long pepper, and arura.

original: bi da ri dang / ba sha ka'i rtsa ba dang / 'di rnams srang re re chu srang lnga brgya rtsa bcu gnyis dang / skyu ru ra rdog ma lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig bskol te /
analyzed: bi da ri dang / ba sha ka'i rtsa ba dang / 'di rnams srang re re chu srang lnga brgya rtsa bcu gnyis dang / skyu ru ra rdog ma lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig bskol te /
translated: These are boiled together with 512 ounces of water and about 500 sour jujube fruits.

original: bzhi cha srang nyi shu lus pa las sman de btsags nas skyu ru ra'i rus pa phyung ste /
analyzed: bzhi cha srang nyi shu lus pa las sman de btsags nas skyu ru ra'i rus pa phyung ste /
translated: From this, 20 ounces, one quarter of the total, are left. The medicine is strained and the sour jujube seeds are removed.

original: snod kyi nang du bcug nas mar srang drug dang til mar srang drug brngos te sha kha ra srang lnga bcu dang / sman gong ma de rnams lhan cig bskol nas lde gur byas pa dang / grang ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi srang drug dang /
analyzed: snod kyi nang du bcug nas mar srang drug dang til mar srang drug brngos te sha kha ra srang lnga bcu dang / sman gong ma de rnams lhan cig bskol nas lde gur byas pa dang / grang ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi srang drug dang /
translated: The medicine is placed in a container and boiled with six ounces of ghee and six ounces of sesame oil, 50 ounces of white sugar, and the above medicines. When it becomes a paste, six ounces of honey are added to the cooled mixture.

original: smig rkang srang bzhi dang / pi pi ling srang gnyis dang / dri rnam bzhi zho gnyis dang / de rnams kyi phye ma btab ste lde gur byas pa khang pa'i nang du 'dug pa nas thun ran par bza' zhing phan pa'i zas dang bcas pa ni drang srong rtsa ba nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: smig rkang srang bzhi dang / pi pi ling srang gnyis dang / dri rnam bzhi zho gnyis dang / de rnams kyi phye ma btab ste lde gur byas pa khang pa'i nang du 'dug pa nas thun ran par bza' zhing phan pa'i zas dang bcas pa ni drang srong rtsa ba nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: Four ounces of sand reed, two ounces of long pepper, two pounds of the four types of myrobalan, and two pounds of the four types of fragrant substances.

original: ming yang rtsa ba na'i bcud kyis len zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ming yang rtsa ba na'i bcud kyis len zhes bya ste /
translated: The name of this elixir is the “root-based elixir.”

original: drang srong de sngon rgas 'khogs par gyur pa las bud med rnams kyi mig zim bar byed pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / rims dang / glo snying gi nad dang / dreg nad dang / gcin dang / khu chu la gnas pa'i nad dang /
analyzed: drang srong de sngon rgas 'khogs par gyur pa las bud med rnams kyi mig zim bar byed pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / rims dang / glo snying gi nad dang / dreg nad dang / gcin dang / khu chu la gnas pa'i nad dang /
translated: This sage previously became old and decrepit, but now his eyes are clear, his breathing is smooth, he has no fever, no lung or heart disease, no gout, no urinary or semen disorders,

original: skad 'gags pa dang / de bzhin du nyams stobs skye ba dang / glo 'grams pa dang / glo nyams pa dang gcod zad byed kyis lus skams shing nyam chung ba dang / 'phel ba byed pa dang / dran pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang /
analyzed: skad 'gags pa dang / de bzhin du nyams stobs skye ba dang / glo 'grams pa dang / glo nyams pa dang gcod zad byed kyis lus skams shing nyam chung ba dang / 'phel ba byed pa dang / dran pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang /
translated: memory, intelligence,🔽and it generates radiance, health, and longevity.🔽It causes the vāyu to move in the right direction,🔽and it has the ability to generate great pleasure in women,🔽it generates strength,

original: gzi mdangs skyed pa dang nad med cing tshe rab tu 'phel ba dang / rlung lugs su 'byung ba dang / bud med rnams la shin tu dga' ba skyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / stobs skyed pa dang / dbang po rnams gsal bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzi mdangs skyed pa dang nad med cing tshe rab tu 'phel ba dang / rlung lugs su 'byung ba dang / bud med rnams la shin tu dga' ba skyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / stobs skyed pa dang / dbang po rnams gsal bar byed pa dang /
translated: and it clarifies the senses.

original: cho ga bzhin du byas na me'i drod kyang skyed par byed do //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du byas na me'i drod kyang skyed par byed do //
translated: If one performs the rite, it also generates the heat of fire.

original: shing mngar dang / smig rkang dang / pi pi ling dang / rgyam tsha dang / lcags gang yang rung ba re re dang @408b yang na gser nyi tshe dang / shu dag dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / kha ra dkar po dang /
analyzed: shing mngar dang / smig rkang dang / pi pi ling dang / rgyam tsha dang / lcags gang yang rung ba re re dang @408b yang na gser nyi tshe dang / shu dag dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / kha ra dkar po dang /
translated: One should take one of these, or one part of gold, one part of coriander, one part of ghee, one part of honey, and one part of white sugar.

original: 'di rnams gang yang rung ba dang ldan par 'bras bu gsum gyi bcud kyis len zla ba gcig gi bar du bsten na nad thams cad 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: 'di rnams gang yang rung ba dang ldan par 'bras bu gsum gyi bcud kyis len zla ba gcig gi bar du bsten na nad thams cad 'joms par byed do //
translated: If one takes any of these together with the essence of the three fruits for one month, it will destroy all diseases.

original: dran pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / blo skyed bar byed do //🔽man du ka par ni rang gi khu ba'i nang du shing mngar gyi phye ma btab ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / blo skyed bar byed do // man du ka par ni rang gi khu ba'i nang du shing mngar gyi phye ma btab ste /
translated: It produces memory, intelligence, and understanding.🔽One should mix the powder of sweet flag with the juice of manduka.

original: me'i drod ji lta ba bzhin du 'o ma dang lhan cig sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: me'i drod ji lta ba bzhin du 'o ma dang lhan cig sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should combine it with milk according to the heat of the fire.

original: sle tres bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sle tres kyi me tog dang / rtsa ba'i phye ma btab pa dang / shang kha pushpa bskol ba'i nang du de nyid kyi rtsa ba dang / me tog gi phye ma btab pa sbyar na tshe sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sle tres bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sle tres kyi me tog dang / rtsa ba'i phye ma btab pa dang / shang kha pushpa bskol ba'i nang du de nyid kyi rtsa ba dang / me tog gi phye ma btab pa sbyar na tshe sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: If one mixes the juice of boiled eggplant with the powder of eggplant flowers and roots, and if one mixes the juice of boiled śaṅkhapuṣpī with the powder of its roots and flowers, it will bestow longevity.

original: nad 'jig par byed pa dang / stobs dang / mdog dang / me'i drod dang / skad gsal bar byed pa dang / yid gzhungs par byed pa dang / bcud kyis len gyi sbyor ba la de dag las khyad par du shang kha pushpa'i sbyor ba bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: nad 'jig par byed pa dang / stobs dang / mdog dang / me'i drod dang / skad gsal bar byed pa dang / yid gzhungs par byed pa dang / bcud kyis len gyi sbyor ba la de dag las khyad par du shang kha pushpa'i sbyor ba bsten par bya'o //
translated: It will destroy disease, increase strength, complexion, digestive heat, and the clarity of one’s voice, make one’s mind sharp, and it is a rasayana preparation. Among them, one should rely on the śaṅkhapuṣpī preparation.

original: spangs ma dang / pu tse shel dang / pa ya sya dang / shing mngar dang / tsandan dang / thal tres dang / shu dag dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / tsha ba gsum dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / pa to la'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: spangs ma dang / pu tse shel dang / pa ya sya dang / shing mngar dang / tsandan dang / thal tres dang / shu dag dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / tsha ba gsum dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / pa to la'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: One should mix together the three myrobalan fruits, puṣya, pāyasya, sweet plant, sandalwood, talitra, śigru, the three fruits, the three hot medicines, the two types of turmeric, and patola root.

original: rgyam tsha dang / 'di rnams legs par btags te /
analyzed: rgyam tsha dang / 'di rnams legs par btags te /
translated: Add these well.

original: mar srang lnga brgya rtsa bcu gnyis dang / shang kha pushpa bskol ba'i khu ba srang stong lnga brgya sum cu rtsa drug 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te mar lus pa las nye bar sbyar bar gyur na glen pa yin na yang tshig la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: mar srang lnga brgya rtsa bcu gnyis dang / shang kha pushpa bskol ba'i khu ba srang stong lnga brgya sum cu rtsa drug 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te mar lus pa las nye bar sbyar bar gyur na glen pa yin na yang tshig la dbang ba dang /
translated: If one cooks together 500 srans of ghee, 12 srans of sesame oil, 36 srans of the juice of the puskara flower, and 500 srans of milk, and if the ghee remains, it is a preparation that, even for a fool, will give him mastery of speech,

original: thos pa 'dzin pa dang / spobs pa che ba dang / nad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos pa 'dzin pa dang / spobs pa che ba dang / nad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: the ability to retain what he hears, great eloquence, and freedom from illness.🔽512.6

original: padma'i rtsa ba dang / rtsa lag dang / padma ge sar rnams 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te mar lus pa las gser gyi bum pa'i nang du bcug pa de ni padma rnam lnga'i bcud kyis len zhes bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i rtsa ba dang / rtsa lag dang / padma ge sar rnams 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te mar lus pa las gser gyi bum pa'i nang du bcug pa de ni padma rnam lnga'i bcud kyis len zhes bya'o //
translated: If one cooks together the root of the lotus, the stem, and the stamen, with milk, and if the ghee remains, it is to be put in a golden vase. This is called the elixir of the five parts of the lotus.

original: zhes sa steng kun tu grags so //
analyzed: zhes sa steng kun tu grags so //
translated: It is famous everywhere on earth.

original: de la tshul bzhin bsten na skyes bu'i nyams 'jig pa dang / zad pa yang skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin bsten na skyes bu'i nyams 'jig pa dang / zad pa yang skyed par byed do //
translated: If one uses it properly, it will restore the vigor of a man who is worn out and exhausted.

original: autpa la'i sdong bu dang / rtsa ba dang / lo ma dang / ge sar mar dang 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te mar lus pa las de gser gyi snod kyi nang du bcug pa de yang autpa la rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba zhes sa steng kun tu grags pa'i sbyor ba gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: autpa la'i sdong bu dang / rtsa ba dang / lo ma dang / ge sar mar dang 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te mar lus pa las de gser gyi snod kyi nang du bcug pa de yang autpa la rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba zhes sa steng kun tu grags pa'i sbyor ba gnyis pa yin te /
translated: The stem, root, leaf, and stamen of an utpala flower are boiled with ghee and milk. The remaining ghee is placed in a golden vessel. This is the second preparation known as the five-part utpala preparation, which is renowned throughout the world.🔽

original: byol @409a * //
analyzed: byol @409a * //
translated: The stem, root, leaf, and stamen of an utpala flower are boiled together with ghee and milk. The remaining ghee is placed in a golden vessel. This is the second preparation known as the five-part utpala preparation, renowned throughout the world.

original: song ba lang yang yid gzhungs bar byed na skyes bu mi rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /🔽bramhi dang / shu dag dang / rgyam tsha dang / shang kha pushpa dang / gandha d'ur ba dang / bramhi dang / so bar rtsa ba dang / byi shal dang / pi pi ling dang / 'di rnams re re yang nas gsum gsum cam gyi tshad cam dang /
analyzed: song ba lang yang yid gzhungs bar byed na skyes bu mi rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos / bramhi dang / shu dag dang / rgyam tsha dang / shang kha pushpa dang / gandha d'ur ba dang / bramhi dang / so bar rtsa ba dang / byi shal dang / pi pi ling dang / 'di rnams re re yang nas gsum gsum cam gyi tshad cam dang /
translated: If it makes even cattle more intelligent, what need is there to speak of human beings?🔽Brahmi, shunthi, gyan tsha, shangkha pushpa, ganhdu ruba, brahmi, so ba root, bhisha, and pipiling, each one-third part,

original: gser nas 'bru'i tshad tsam dang / dug til 'bru tsam dang / 'di rnams zhib mor btags te /
analyzed: gser nas 'bru'i tshad tsam dang / dug til 'bru tsam dang / 'di rnams zhib mor btags te /
translated: and the size of a grain of gold, and poison the size of a sesame seed, all these are finely ground.

original: mar srang gcig dang sbyar ba'i lde gu bldags te /
analyzed: mar srang gcig dang sbyar ba'i lde gu bldags te /
translated: One should lick a medicinal paste prepared from one pala of each of these,

original: zhu ba'i tshod tsam na kha zas mar shas che ba sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa zos la tshul de bzhin du nyin re bzhin lo gcig gi bar du bsten na blo brtan pa dang / dran pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / rga bas zil gyis gnon pa dang /
analyzed: zhu ba'i tshod tsam na kha zas mar shas che ba sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa zos la tshul de bzhin du nyin re bzhin lo gcig gi bar du bsten na blo brtan pa dang / dran pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / rga bas zil gyis gnon pa dang /
translated: and when it has dissolved, one should eat food that is mostly ghee, together with honey. If one follows this procedure every day for one year, one’s mind will be stable, one’s memory will be good, one’s intellect will be sharp, old age will not overpower one,

original: nad kyis zil gyis non pa dang / sgyid skyur ba dang / snyom pa dang / ngal ba dang / dub pa dang / nad med cing lo brgya brgya yongs su rdzogs par 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad kyis zil gyis non pa dang / sgyid skyur ba dang / snyom pa dang / ngal ba dang / dub pa dang / nad med cing lo brgya brgya yongs su rdzogs par 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will not be overpowered by disease, one will not be lazy, one will not be sluggish, one will not be tired, one will not be exhausted, one will be healthy, and one will live to a ripe old age of one hundred years.🔽One will have glory, splendor, and radiance, and one will be cured of leprosy, vitiligo, tumors, poison, fevers, insanity,

original: dpal dang / gzi brjid dang / mdangs dang ldan pa dang / lhag par mdze dang / sha bkra dang / skran dang / dug dang / rims dang / smyo byed dang / dbyig dug dang / dmu rdzing rnams las zlog par byed do //
analyzed: dpal dang / gzi brjid dang / mdangs dang ldan pa dang / lhag par mdze dang / sha bkra dang / skran dang / dug dang / rims dang / smyo byed dang / dbyig dug dang / dmu rdzing rnams las zlog par byed do //
translated: and snakebites.

original: srid srung gi rig byed la sogs pas skyed par byed pa'i gshed byed kyi gnod pa dang / shin tu stobs che ba'i rlung gi nad kyang 'dis zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: srid srung gi rig byed la sogs pas skyed par byed pa'i gshed byed kyi gnod pa dang / shin tu stobs che ba'i rlung gi nad kyang 'dis zhi bar byed do //
translated: It also pacifies the harm of malevolent spirits that are generated by the Atharva Veda and so forth, as well as very powerful wind disorders.

original: ston dang po'i dus su sman na ga ba la'i rtsa ba skar ma rgyal dang ldan pa'i dus su phyung ste /
analyzed: ston dang po'i dus su sman na ga ba la'i rtsa ba skar ma rgyal dang ldan pa'i dus su phyung ste /
translated: In the first autumn month, when the star Pushya is ascendant, dig up the root of the Indian valerian plant.

original: de las zho gnyis gnyis kyi phye ma thun tshad tsam 'gams la /
analyzed: de las zho gnyis gnyis kyi phye ma thun tshad tsam 'gams la /
translated: Make a paste of two parts of that and one part of sugar.

original: de'i 'og tu 'o ma blud pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'o ma blud pa 'am /
translated: After that, drink milk.

original: yang na mar dang sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa'i lde gu bldag cing kha zas gzhan mi za bar 'o ma nyi tshes gso bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mar dang sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa'i lde gu bldag cing kha zas gzhan mi za bar 'o ma nyi tshes gso bar bya ste /
translated: Or else, lick a paste of ghee and honey, and without eating any other food, live on milk alone.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba lo gcig gi bar du byas na stobs dang ldan zhing lo brgya 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba lo gcig gi bar du byas na stobs dang ldan zhing lo brgya 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: If you do this practice for a year, you will become strong and live for a hundred years.

original: gze ma'i 'bras bu skye ba'i dus su rtsa ba dang bcas pa btus te /
analyzed: gze ma'i 'bras bu skye ba'i dus su rtsa ba dang bcas pa btus te /
translated: When the fruit of the Indian jujube is ripe, dig up the root together with its base.

original: grib ma la skams la de legs par phye mar byas nas gze ma rang bskol ba'i khu bas spangs nas thun che tshad du bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: grib ma la skams la de legs par phye mar byas nas gze ma rang bskol ba'i khu bas spangs nas thun che tshad du bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having finely ground the ash, it should be mixed with the juice of the same kind of sugarcane and taken in a dose of one pala.

original: de'i 'og tu btung bar 'o ma de nyid dang 'bras s'a lu kha zas su sbyin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu btung bar 'o ma de nyid dang 'bras s'a lu kha zas su sbyin te /
translated: After that, the same milk and rice should be given to drink.

original: de ltar byas pa ni gze ma'i phye ma srang brgya ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas pa ni gze ma'i phye ma srang brgya ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the preparation of one hundred palas of sugarcane powder.

original: de las zhag re srang gnyis zos na gzugs bzang ba dang / skal ba dang ldan @409b pa dang / lo brgya thub pa dang / 'dod pa spyod pa dang / ji ltar nog rgyas pa dang / khyu mchog gis ba lang gi khyu la 'jug nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de las zhag re srang gnyis zos na gzugs bzang ba dang / skal ba dang ldan @409b pa dang / lo brgya thub pa dang / 'dod pa spyod pa dang / ji ltar nog rgyas pa dang / khyu mchog gis ba lang gi khyu la 'jug nus pa bzhin no //
translated: If two palas are eaten each day from this, one will have a good complexion, good fortune, a life span of one hundred years, the ability to enjoy sex, and will be able to enter a herd of cows like a bull with a full hump.

original: sman bar hi'i shun phrags dang phral ba rtsa ba shin tu rlon pa brdungs pa 'o ma dang sbyar bzos na de zhu ba'i tshod tsam na kha zas gzhan mi bza' bar 'o ma nyi tshe blud pa 'am /
analyzed: sman bar hi'i shun phrags dang phral ba rtsa ba shin tu rlon pa brdungs pa 'o ma dang sbyar bzos na de zhu ba'i tshod tsam na kha zas gzhan mi bza' bar 'o ma nyi tshe blud pa 'am /
translated: If the bark of the medicinal plant bharangi is removed and the very fresh root is pounded and mixed with milk, when it is digested, without eating any other food, one should drink a little milk.

original: yang na sman ba ra hi'i rtsa ba de nyid rang gi khu ba bskol ba'i nang du legs par spangs te /
analyzed: yang na sman ba ra hi'i rtsa ba de nyid rang gi khu ba bskol ba'i nang du legs par spangs te /
translated: Alternatively, one should boil the root of the medicinal herb rahi in its own juice.

original: mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang lhan cig sbyar ba'i lde gu sbyin pa 'am /
analyzed: mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang lhan cig sbyar ba'i lde gu sbyin pa 'am /
translated: Give a paste prepared with ghee and honey.

original: yang na sman bar hi bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du de nyid kyi phye ma dang zos na /
analyzed: yang na sman bar hi bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du de nyid kyi phye ma dang zos na /
translated: Or, one should boil the medicinal herb rahi in juice and eat it with its own powder.

original: mar rnams lhan cig bskol ba'i mar lus pa blud do //
analyzed: mar rnams lhan cig bskol ba'i mar lus pa blud do //
translated: Boil the ghee together with the medicinal herbs and give the remaining ghee.

original: cho ga bzhin du sman bi da ri dang / ba la dang / aa ti ba la dang / shing mngar dang / ka ka ma tsi dang / dzi banti dang / ra sna dang / aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / sthi ra ste /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du sman bi da ri dang / ba la dang / aa ti ba la dang / shing mngar dang / ka ka ma tsi dang / dzi banti dang / ra sna dang / aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / sthi ra ste /
translated: According to the rite, the medicinal herbs vidari, bala, atibala, madhuka, kakamaci, jivanti, rasanjana, haritaki, amlavetasa, and sthira;

original: sa la par ni dang / sle tres dang / mandu ka parni dang / shang kha pushpa dang / aa shva gandha dang / nye'u shing dang / 'di rnams gang yang rung ba re re cho ga gong ma bzhin du sbyar na yang /
analyzed: sa la par ni dang / sle tres dang / mandu ka parni dang / shang kha pushpa dang / aa shva gandha dang / nye'u shing dang / 'di rnams gang yang rung ba re re cho ga gong ma bzhin du sbyar na yang /
translated: salaparni, udicaka, manduka parni, shanka pushpa, ashwagandha, and nyagrodha—any one of these, prepared according to the above rite,

original: yid gzhungs pa dang / blo dang rgas sra zhing na tshod brtan pa dang / nyams bde ba dang stobs sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa dang / blo dang rgas sra zhing na tshod brtan pa dang / nyams bde ba dang stobs sbyin par byed do //
translated: It makes the mind clear, sharpens the intellect, stabilizes old age, and bestows bliss and strength.

original: tsi tra ka'i me tog ser po dang / dkar po dang / nag po ni rang rang gi me tog gi mdog ji lta ba bzhin du tsi tra ka ser po dang / dkar po dang / nag po zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: tsi tra ka'i me tog ser po dang / dkar po dang / nag po ni rang rang gi me tog gi mdog ji lta ba bzhin du tsi tra ka ser po dang / dkar po dang / nag po zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The yellow, white, and black flowers of citraka are called yellow, white, and black citraka according to their respective flower colors.

original: bcud kyis len gyi cho ga bzhin du spyad na phan yon phas kyi rim bzhin du che ba yin te /
analyzed: bcud kyis len gyi cho ga bzhin du spyad na phan yon phas kyi rim bzhin du che ba yin te /
translated: If used according to the procedure of rasāyana, the benefits are progressively greater.

original: de nas tsi tra ka'i rtsa ba phyung la grib skams su byas nas btags pa'i phye ma'i zhun mar dang sbrang rtsi 'am 'o ma 'am chu gang yang rung ba las lde gu byas nas bldags te /
analyzed: de nas tsi tra ka'i rtsa ba phyung la grib skams su byas nas btags pa'i phye ma'i zhun mar dang sbrang rtsi 'am 'o ma 'am chu gang yang rung ba las lde gu byas nas bldags te /
translated: Then, having dug up the root of citraka, dried it in the shade, and ground it into a powder, make a paste with ghee, honey, milk, or water, whichever is appropriate, and eat it.

original: de'i 'og tu phan pa'i zas dang / de ltar zla ba gcig gi bar du bsten na nad med cing lo brgya 'tsho ba dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / stobs dang ldan pa dang / lus mdangs dang ldan pa dang / me'i drod 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phan pa'i zas dang / de ltar zla ba gcig gi bar du bsten na nad med cing lo brgya 'tsho ba dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / stobs dang ldan pa dang / lus mdangs dang ldan pa dang / me'i drod 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one relies on this for a month, one will be free from disease, live one hundred years, have a sharp memory, be strong, have a radiant body, and have a blazing digestive heat.

original: til mar dang lde gur byas te zla ba gcig gi bar du bsten na /
analyzed: til mar dang lde gur byas te zla ba gcig gi bar du bsten na /
translated: If one relies on it for a month in the form of oil or ointment,

original: rlung nad gso dka' ba yang 'joms par byed do //🔽gcin dang lhan cig sbyar nas 'thungs na mdze 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: rlung nad gso dka' ba yang 'joms par byed do // gcin dang lhan cig sbyar nas 'thungs na mdze 'joms par byed do //
translated: it will destroy even difficult-to-treat wind disorders.🔽If one drinks it together with urine, it will destroy leprosy.

original: dar ba dang lhan cig 'thungs na gzhang 'brum sel to //
analyzed: dar ba dang lhan cig 'thungs na gzhang 'brum sel to //
translated: If one drinks it together with milk, it will remove hemorrhoids.

original: go bye legs par smin par dpyid kyi dus su 'bru'i phung po'i nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: go bye legs par smin par dpyid kyi dus su 'bru'i phung po'i nang du bcug ste /
translated: In the spring, one should place well-ripened barley in a heap of grain.🔽In the winter, one should take it out and mix it with sweet, oily,

original: dgun gyi dus su phyung la sman mngar ba dang / snum pa dang / bsil @410a * //
analyzed: dgun gyi dus su phyung la sman mngar ba dang / snum pa dang / bsil @410a * //
translated: and cold medicines.

original: ba dang nus pa dang ldan pas legs par sbyar te sman de'i brgyad 'gyur gyi chu dang go bye rdog ma brgyad bskol te /
analyzed: ba dang nus pa dang ldan pas legs par sbyar te sman de'i brgyad 'gyur gyi chu dang go bye rdog ma brgyad bskol te /
translated: The medicine is well compounded with the potency and eight times the quantity of water is added. Eight pieces of gokya are boiled.

original: khu ba brgyad cha lus pa dang / 'o ma dang lhan cig sbyar ba grang mo blud de /
analyzed: khu ba brgyad cha lus pa dang / 'o ma dang lhan cig sbyar ba grang mo blud de /
translated: When only one eighth of the liquid remains, it is mixed with milk and drunk cold.

original: de ltar bskol ba'i khu ba rim par zhag bdun gyi bar du nyin re bzhin re res bskyed la /
analyzed: de ltar bskol ba'i khu ba rim par zhag bdun gyi bar du nyin re bzhin re res bskyed la /
translated: In this way, the boiled liquid is increased by one each day for seven days.

original: de nas zhag bdun gyi bar du re res dbri zhing brgyad du phyin pa dang / de nas zhag bdun gyi bar du 'bru re res bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas zhag bdun gyi bar du re res dbri zhing brgyad du phyin pa dang / de nas zhag bdun gyi bar du 'bru re res bskyed de /
translated: Then, for seven days, it is decreased by one each day until it reaches eight. Then, for seven days, it is increased by one grain each day.

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig lon pa dang / de'i 'og tu go bye'i 'bru gong ma brgyad kyi steng du go bye'i 'bru gsum gsum gyis zhag re re bskyed cing dbri ba yang gong ma ltar zhag nyi shu'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig lon pa dang / de'i 'og tu go bye'i 'bru gong ma brgyad kyi steng du go bye'i 'bru gsum gsum gyis zhag re re bskyed cing dbri ba yang gong ma ltar zhag nyi shu'i bar du bya'o //
translated: When twenty-one days have passed, after that, on top of the previous eight grains of gokya, three grains of gokya are increased each day and decreased in the same way as before for twenty days.

original: de ltar go bye'i 'bru bzhi brgya'i bar du dbri zhing bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar go bye'i 'bru bzhi brgya'i bar du dbri zhing bskyed par bya'o //
translated: In this way, the grains of gokya are decreased and increased up to four hundred grains.

original: de'i 'og tu zhag bdun gyi bar du gong ma brgyad pa'i steng du 'bru mar bdun bdun gyis bskyed cing dbri ba yang zhag bdun gyi bar du bskyed pa yang zhag bdun gyi bar du byas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhag bdun gyi bar du gong ma brgyad pa'i steng du 'bru mar bdun bdun gyis bskyed cing dbri ba yang zhag bdun gyi bar du bskyed pa yang zhag bdun gyi bar du byas te /
translated: Then, for seven days, he should increase the sesame seeds by seven each day, and for seven days he should decrease them by seven each day.

original: bskyed pa'i tshul gyis 'bru stong rdzogs kyi bar du yang bya'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i tshul gyis 'bru stong rdzogs kyi bar du yang bya'o //
translated: In this way, he should increase and decrease the sesame seeds up to one thousand.

original: kha zas za ba'i lugs ni mar dang / 'o ma dang / 'bras drug cu pa sbyin no //
analyzed: kha zas za ba'i lugs ni mar dang / 'o ma dang / 'bras drug cu pa sbyin no //
translated: He should eat ghee, milk, and the sixty kinds of grain.

original: de bzhin du sman gyi sbyor ba de yang bdun dang gsum gcig gi bar du yang mar 'bri ba dang / bskyed pa'i go bye'i sbyor ba yang de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sman gyi sbyor ba de yang bdun dang gsum gcig gi bar du yang mar 'bri ba dang / bskyed pa'i go bye'i sbyor ba yang de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, he should understand the method of increasing and decreasing the medicine for seven, three, and one day.

original: sngon legs par smon pa thob pa yang khyad par du me'i drod 'bar ba dang / gcin srib yang srin bu'i nad dang / mdze nad dang / gzhang 'brum gyi nad dang / tshil nad rnams sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sngon legs par smon pa thob pa yang khyad par du me'i drod 'bar ba dang / gcin srib yang srin bu'i nad dang / mdze nad dang / gzhang 'brum gyi nad dang / tshil nad rnams sel bar byed do //
translated: For those who have previously made good aspirations, the heat of the fire blazes, urine and feces are clear, and diseases such as worms, leprosy, hemorrhoids, and obesity are eliminated.

original: go bye'i 'bras bu skyon med pa brdungs te zhib tu btags pa sa brkos pa'i nang du bum pa bzhag ste /
analyzed: go bye'i 'bras bu skyon med pa brdungs te zhib tu btags pa sa brkos pa'i nang du bum pa bzhag ste /
translated: The result of the understanding is a flawless bell that is beaten and finely ground. The vase is placed inside the excavation.

original: de'i khar bum pa zhabs su bu ga phug pa zhig bzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i khar bum pa zhabs su bu ga phug pa zhig bzhag ste /
translated: On top of that, a vase with a hole at the base is placed.

original: bum pa steng ma'i nang du ba la ta ka'i phye ma bcug la sa nag po'i 'jim pas kha dang mtshams thams cad bskus te /
analyzed: bum pa steng ma'i nang du ba la ta ka'i phye ma bcug la sa nag po'i 'jim pas kha dang mtshams thams cad bskus te /
translated: In the upper vase, the powder of the fruit of the belleric myrobalan is inserted and the mouth and all the joints are smeared with black clay.

original: ba lang gi lci ba skam po'i mes btsos te /
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba skam po'i mes btsos te /
translated: It is cooked with the fire of dry cow dung.🔽When it is cooked, the juice will drip into the lower vase.

original: tshos pa dang / de'i khu ba bum pa 'og ma'i nang du 'dzag par 'gyur ba dang / de blangs nas de'i brgyad 'gyur gyi sbrang rtsi dang / nyis 'gyur gyi mar dang sbyar ba'i lde gu 'di yang sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshos pa dang / de'i khu ba bum pa 'og ma'i nang du 'dzag par 'gyur ba dang / de blangs nas de'i brgyad 'gyur gyi sbrang rtsi dang / nyis 'gyur gyi mar dang sbyar ba'i lde gu 'di yang sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: Having taken that, this paste is prepared with eight times honey and two times ghee.

original: cho ga gong ma bzhin du kha zas la sogs pa bsten na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: cho ga gong ma bzhin du kha zas la sogs pa bsten na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: If one uses it as food and so forth according to the above rite, the benefits are the same as above.

original: go bye'i 'bras bu smin cing rgyas pa rang lhung ba srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi bar tshad tsam so phag phye mar byas pa zhib mo bor ba'i rtsing po dang / chus mnye @410b shing bkru ste /
analyzed: go bye'i 'bras bu smin cing rgyas pa rang lhung ba srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi bar tshad tsam so phag phye mar byas pa zhib mo bor ba'i rtsing po dang / chus mnye @410b shing bkru ste /
translated: The ripe and expanded fruit of the gokṣuraka falls by itself. The coarse part of the fine powder of the bricks is measured up to one hundred and twenty sang.

original: de nas go bye rlung la skams te cham chom brdungs la /
analyzed: de nas go bye rlung la skams te cham chom brdungs la /
translated: Then the gokṣuraka is dried in the wind and pounded.

original: chu srang lnga brgya rtsa bcu gnyis bskol te /
analyzed: chu srang lnga brgya rtsa bcu gnyis bskol te /
translated: Then one thousand two hundred and fifty sang of water is boiled.

original: bzhi cha lus pa dang phyung la btsags te /
analyzed: bzhi cha lus pa dang phyung la btsags te /
translated: When one-fourth remains, it is removed and strained.🔽The remaining liquid is mixed with one thousand two hundred and fifty sang of milk, boiled again, and the remaining milk is removed.

original: tshigs ma bor la grangs pa'i khu ba de dang 'o ma srang lnga brgya rtsa bcu gnyis dang / yang bskol te khu ba du zhing 'o ma lus pa dang / de dang mnyam pa'i mar dang yang bskol te 'o ma zad cing mar nyi tshe lus pa dang /
analyzed: tshigs ma bor la grangs pa'i khu ba de dang 'o ma srang lnga brgya rtsa bcu gnyis dang / yang bskol te khu ba du zhing 'o ma lus pa dang / de dang mnyam pa'i mar dang yang bskol te 'o ma zad cing mar nyi tshe lus pa dang /
translated: Then it is boiled again with an equal amount of butter, and when the milk is exhausted and only a little butter remains,

original: sha kha ra'i phye ma ci 'dod pa btab ste /
analyzed: sha kha ra'i phye ma ci 'dod pa btab ste /
translated: as much śarkarā powder as desired is added.

original: gcig tu gyur pa de kha gzar gyis dkrugs te /
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa de kha gzar gyis dkrugs te /
translated: When it becomes one, it is stirred with a spoon.

original: 'bru'i phung po'i nang du zhag bdun gyi bar du sbangs la /
analyzed: 'bru'i phung po'i nang du zhag bdun gyi bar du sbangs la /
translated: Soak it for seven days in a heap of grain.🔽It becomes like the essence of the elixir of immortality.

original: bcud kyi bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar gyur pa dang / skyes bu gang gis nang re de las ran bar bsten cing bza' ste /
analyzed: bcud kyi bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar gyur pa dang / skyes bu gang gis nang re de las ran bar bsten cing bza' ste /
translated: The person who eats it every day should eat a suitable amount.

analyzed: de ltar zhag lnga'i bar du 'thungs pa'i 'og tu dgongs ka snum dang tshva med pa'i nas thug grang mo blud de /

analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi bar du sran mungga'i khu bcud dang bcas pa'i kha zas zos la spang bar 'os pa rnams spangs na /

original: mdze nad thams cad 'joms so //
analyzed: mdze nad thams cad 'joms so //

analyzed: de yang btags pa'i phye ma 'o ma dang sbyar te bza' ba ni me drod che ba la sbyin no //

analyzed: me drod bar ma la ni bskol ba blud do //
translated: To those with medium digestive heat, it should be given as a decoction.

analyzed: de bzhin du pi pi ling ra'i 'o ma dang sbyar te /

translated: If one licks it for a year, and eats suitable and beneficial food, one will eliminate long-lasting illnesses caused by food.

original: mdze nad kyis lus tsha ba dang tshabs cher khyab cing na bar gyur pa'i skyes bu ni so mar dza dang / til nag po gnyis nges par lo gcig gi bar du zos na zla ba bzhin du lus mdog shin tu mdzes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdze nad kyis lus tsha ba dang tshabs cher khyab cing na bar gyur pa'i skyes bu ni so mar dza dang / til nag po gnyis nges par lo gcig gi bar du zos na zla ba bzhin du lus mdog shin tu mdzes par 'gyur ro //
translated: A person whose body is pervaded by the heat and severity of leprosy, and who is sick, should definitely eat both fresh ginger and black sesame seeds for a year. His body will become very beautiful, like the moon.

original: skyes bu gang gis so mar dza phub ma med pa btags pa'i phye ma 'o ma dang lhan cig snod kyi nang du mnan te /
analyzed: skyes bu gang gis so mar dza phub ma med pa btags pa'i phye ma 'o ma dang lhan cig snod kyi nang du mnan te /
translated: A person should grind fresh ginger without the skin into a powder, and mix it with milk in a container.

original: smin pa dang phyung la snying por gyur pa de sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gu bldags te /
analyzed: smin pa dang phyung la snying por gyur pa de sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gu bldags te /
translated: When it ferments, remove it and mix the essence with honey to make a paste.

original: de'i 'og tu dar ba legs par red pa 'thungs na mdze nad kyis lus kyi rkang lag dang sna la sogs pa 'drul zhing chad pa yang sor mo dang sna la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur te /🔽ji ltar shing bcad pa'i 'og tu lo ma skye ba shin tu mdzes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dar ba legs par red pa 'thungs na mdze nad kyis lus kyi rkang lag dang sna la sogs pa 'drul zhing chad pa yang sor mo dang sna la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur te / ji ltar shing bcad pa'i 'og tu lo ma skye ba shin tu mdzes pa bzhin no //
translated: one's leprosy will be cured and one's hands and feet, nose, etc. will grow again.

original: sgog skya ni thog mar sgra gcan zin gyis bdud rtsi brkus pa las khyab 'jug gis 'khor lo 'phangs te /
analyzed: sgog skya ni thog mar sgra gcan zin gyis bdud rtsi brkus pa las khyab 'jug gis 'khor lo 'phangs te /
translated: The tree called garlic was originally the nectar stolen by Rahula.🔽Vishnu shot an arrow at him and cut off his head.

original: mgo bcad pa las bdud rtsi'i thigs pas la lhung zhing thigs pa las sgog skya rnams su gyur to //
analyzed: mgo bcad pa las bdud rtsi'i thigs pas la lhung zhing thigs pa las sgog skya rnams su gyur to //
translated: A drop of nectar fell on the ground and became garlic.

original: sgog skya de bram zes mi za ba ni lha ma yin gyi lus las byung ba'i khrag dang 'dres pa yin pas des mi zab yin no //
analyzed: sgog skya de bram zes mi za ba ni lha ma yin gyi lus las byung ba'i khrag dang 'dres pa yin pas des mi zab yin no //
translated: Brahmins do not eat garlic because it is mixed with the blood of the body of an asura.

original: sgog skya de ni mngon sum gyis bdud rtsi nyid yin te /
analyzed: sgog skya de ni mngon sum gyis bdud rtsi nyid yin te /
translated: Garlic is nectar itself,

original: grong gi bcud kyis len zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grong gi bcud kyis len zhes bya'o //
translated: and is called the elixir of the village.

original: sgog skya de ni @412b khyad par du grang ba'i dus su bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: sgog skya de ni @412b khyad par du grang ba'i dus su bsten par bya'o //
translated: One should especially use garlic in the cold season.

original: dpyid bad kan ldang ba'i dus su lhag bar spyad do //
analyzed: dpyid bad kan ldang ba'i dus su lhag bar spyad do //
translated: In spring, one should use it excessively during the time of kapha arousal.

original: dbyar sprin skyes pa'i dus su ni me dang rlung gis nyam thag pa yin pas de'i dus su bza' ba 'am yang na rtag tu bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar sprin skyes pa'i dus su ni me dang rlung gis nyam thag pa yin pas de'i dus su bza' ba 'am yang na rtag tu bsten par bya'o //
translated: In summer, during the time of cloud formation, one is afflicted by fire and wind, so one should eat it at that time or always use it.

original: sog tsha ba'i dus su ni dus kyi spyod lam bsten cing lus dag pa dang dri ma med par bya ste /
analyzed: sog tsha ba'i dus su ni dus kyi spyod lam bsten cing lus dag pa dang dri ma med par bya ste /
translated: In the autumn, one should follow the conduct of the season and purify and cleanse the body.

original: snum pa dang / bsil ba dang / mngar ba dang / sgog skya lhan cig bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: snum pa dang / bsil ba dang / mngar ba dang / sgog skya lhan cig bsten par bya'o //
translated: One should use oil, coolness, sweetness, and garlic together.

original: de bzhin du gos dang rgyan yang dus dang ji ltar mthun pa dang / g-yog 'khor rnams kyang mthun pa dang lhan cig sgog skya bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gos dang rgyan yang dus dang ji ltar mthun pa dang / g-yog 'khor rnams kyang mthun pa dang lhan cig sgog skya bsten par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should use clothing and ornaments in accordance with the season, and use garlic together with a suitable retinue.

original: ri kha ba can zhes bya ba'i drung na sha kha zhes bya ba'i yul yod de /
analyzed: ri kha ba can zhes bya ba'i drung na sha kha zhes bya ba'i yul yod de /
translated: In front of the snowy mountains, there is a country called Shakha.

original: der skyes pa'i sgog skya'i rtsa ba yul de'i mis dpyid kyi dus su shun pa phral te nub mo chang dang lhan cig zos bas me drod skyed do //
analyzed: der skyes pa'i sgog skya'i rtsa ba yul de'i mis dpyid kyi dus su shun pa phral te nub mo chang dang lhan cig zos bas me drod skyed do //
translated: The root of the garlic that grows there is peeled by the people of that country in the spring and eaten at night with beer, which produces digestive heat.

original: sgog skya cham chom brdungs te btsir ba'i khu ba cha gcig dang chang legs par smin pa cha gsum sbyar ba nang par 'thungs na bzang ngo //
analyzed: sgog skya cham chom brdungs te btsir ba'i khu ba cha gcig dang chang legs par smin pa cha gsum sbyar ba nang par 'thungs na bzang ngo //
translated: One part of the juice squeezed from finely chopped garlic and three parts of well-fermented beer should be drunk in the morning.

original: yang na sgog skya'i khu ba de chang gzhan gang yang rung ba dang btung ba 'am /🔽yang na 'bru mar dang / zhog chu dang rtsab mo 'am de dag gang yang rung ba dang lhan cig sgog skya'i khu ba thun tshad ran par dpyid kyi dus su btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sgog skya'i khu ba de chang gzhan gang yang rung ba dang btung ba 'am / yang na 'bru mar dang / zhog chu dang rtsab mo 'am de dag gang yang rung ba dang lhan cig sgog skya'i khu ba thun tshad ran par dpyid kyi dus su btung bar bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, that garlic juice can be drunk with any other type of beer,🔽or with sesame oil, buttermilk, or radish, or with any of those. The appropriate dose of garlic juice should be drunk in the spring.

original: yang na 'o ma dang / mar dang ; zhag dang / rkang dang / srog chags thang la gnas pa'i sha dang / de dag gang yang rung ba dang lhan cig bskol te /
analyzed: yang na 'o ma dang / mar dang ; zhag dang / rkang dang / srog chags thang la gnas pa'i sha dang / de dag gang yang rung ba dang lhan cig bskol te /
translated: Alternatively, it should be boiled with milk, butter, oil, broth, or the meat of animals that live on dry land, or with any of those.

original: nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du sbyar te btung ba 'am /
analyzed: nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du sbyar te btung ba 'am /
translated: Drink it according to the illness.

original: yang na sgog skya'i khu ba nyi tshe 'thungs na mkhur ba dgang ba tsam gyis kyang mid pa dag par byed do //
analyzed: yang na sgog skya'i khu ba nyi tshe 'thungs na mkhur ba dgang ba tsam gyis kyang mid pa dag par byed do //
translated: Or, if you drink just a little of the garlic juice, it will also purify the throat just by filling the cheeks.

original: zug gzer che zhing na ba la ni sgog skya'i khu ba de rgyun du dugs byas na rab tu bsngags te de'i 'og tu chu grang spong bar bya ste /
analyzed: zug gzer che zhing na ba la ni sgog skya'i khu ba de rgyun du dugs byas na rab tu bsngags te de'i 'og tu chu grang spong bar bya ste /
translated: If there is severe pain and illness, it is highly recommended to continuously apply the garlic juice as a compress, and then avoid cold water.

original: gal te chu grang bsten na ni 'phral la skyug cing brgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chu grang bsten na ni 'phral la skyug cing brgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you rely on cold water, it will immediately cause vomiting and fainting.
